loans.name: Ggulu A(2041) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry feeds. Rose is 40 years old a single mother of five children ranging from age 5 to 20. Her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

Rose is joined in her small group by Topista N., Asiah N., Zariah N., and Halima N.. Topista N. is currently in the piggery business and is requesting a loan to buy more piglets. Asiah N. is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Zariah N. is currently in the business of fishing and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Halima N. is currently in the business of fresh foods and is requesting a loan to purchase more foods for sale.

loans.use: To expand poultry business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 35 year old Anna M.. She is married with five children, aged between 3 and 17. In 1998, Anna established a poultry business and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks for selling. She thanks you for your support.

Kuku means chickens in Swahili. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. Firstly, raising kuku require little start-up capital as you can start with one or two kuku, then either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally. Secondly, they require little space; therefore, you can let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, growing chickens produce eggs that can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks in bulk

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Margret. She is currently in the business of frying edibles and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. N. is 48 years old and married with a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in the business. N. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to expand her business and the loan was paid back on time.

N. is joined in her small group by Sarah K., Margret N., Annet N., and Margret K.. Sarah K. is currently in the tailoring business and is requesting a loan to buy more equipment. Margret N. is also a tailor and is requesting a loan to buy materials. Annet N. is currently sells shoes and is requesting a loan to buy more shoes. Margret K. is currently in the business of selling airtime and sim cards and is requesting a loan to invest in more airtime.

loans.use: Invest in food business

loans.name: Total B(2088)B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan B.. She is currently runs a pub/bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more beer. Suzan is 28 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 10 and 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more brew for sale.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Racheal SS., Maureen Z., Robinah N., and Grace Nankya. Racheal SS. is currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Maureen Z. is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to purchase more birds. Robinah N. is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Grace Nankya is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase various brands of beers and wines

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Neema K.. She is married with three children, aged 18, 22 and 12. In 2006, Neema established a phone credit business and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional phone vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

Mobile phones have become the most common form of phone communication, as a result of numerous factors including the limited availability of landlines and the relative low cost of mobile phones. Not only professionals, but also grandmas in villages, school kids, and street sellers carry mobile phones.

loans.use: To purchase additional phone vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Vena's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Vena. She is currently sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal. N. is 38 years old and is married with a husband who works in a retail shop. She has 1 child, aged 1 year. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. N. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to expand her business and the loan was paid back on time.

N. is joined in her small group by Janet N., Harriet Nakacwa, Annet Nakaweesa, and Agnes N.. Janet N. is currently in the hotel business and is requesting a loan to invest more in her business. Harriet Nakacwa is currently in the newspaper and hotel business and is requesting a loan to purchase more hotel equipment. Annet Nakaweesa is currently in the business of selling food and soda and is requesting a loan to invest more in her business. Agnes N. is currently in the bar business and is requesting a loan to invest more in her business.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal

loans.name: Total B(2088)C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Resty. She is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to expand. N. is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 1 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

N. is joined in her small group by Hadijah N., Ruth N., Sharon Nakayaga, and Tashra N.. Hanifah N. is currently operates a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy two more hair dryers. Ruth N. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge. Sharon Nakayaga is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Tasheirwe N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to buy more land to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Osenatou

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of two children, Mrs. Osénatou S. was born on November 3, 1967 in Porto-Novo (the political capital of Benin) in the district of Oueme. She is currently requesting her third loan. She has proven to be an exemplary borrower here at ALIDé, since she has been very punctual in reimbursing her previous loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée, mère de 02 enfants, Dame S. Osénatou est née le 03/11/1967 à Porto-Novo (Capitale politique du Bénin) dans le Département de l'OUEME. Elle en est à son troisième crédit. Exemplaire parmi les bénéficiaires de crédit à ALIDé, elle a toujours été régulière et ponctuelle dans les remboursements des crédits antérieurs.

loans.use:
Purchasing 7 bolts of African print cloth in the "Hitarget" pattern and 3 of "Wax Hollandais" pattern

Achat de 07 pièces de pagne « HITARGET » et 03 pièces de pagne « WAX HOLLANDAIS »

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Born on October 4, 1964 in Cotonou in the LIttoral District, Mrs. Chantal A. is married and the mother of 7 children, of whom only one is still her dependent. She is presently requesting her third loan and has been very punctual in reimbursing her previous loans. She is also a very careful manager of her little business. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerNée le 04/10/1964 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral, Dame A. Chantal est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont un seul est encore à sa charge. Elle est au troisième crédit et a toujours été prompte dans le remboursement des crédits passés. Aussi, est- elle très rigoureuse dans la gestion de son affaire.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cases of liquor, 2 cases of pasta, and 6 cases of various sorts of canned goods Achat de 05 cartons de liqueur, 02 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et 06 cartons de boîte de conserve de diverses sortes

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Specialized in the wholesaling and retailing of anarcade nuts (as cashew nuts are known in Benin,) processed and ready to eat, Mrs. Antoinette H. has already been granted four loans. She has always reimbursed her loans without difficulty. Born in 1966 in Cotonou, she is married and the mother of 3 children for whom she is still responsible. Only her children are photographed here because Mrs. H. was off making a delivery at the market when we called to see her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Spécialisée dans la vente en gros et au détail de noix d’anarcade (désignées sous le nom d'Acajou au Bénin) transformées et consommables, elle vient a été octroyé quatre fois. Les remboursements de crédit ne souffrent d’aucun problème à son niveau. Née en 1966 à Cotonou, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Seules ses enfants se retrouvent sur la photo parce qu'elle était à une livraison au marché lors de la visite sur le lieu d'activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 600 kilos of unprocessed anarcade (cashew) nuts

Achat de 600 kg de noix d’anarcade à l’étape brute.

loans.name: Jahuri P. Linda

texts.id:
With his modified motorcycle which includes two boxes at the rear to carry goods, Jahuri collects used good everyday. He drive thru hosing areas market and warehouse to collect the use goods. Most of the time he buy them from house wifes, and he price them according to good's condition and weight. Jahuri is the head of the family, even though he is just a used goods collector, he tries his best to support his family, furthermore he still needs to send to school, and as they grow their education cost increases. Financial help from Dinari will be use as a capital to buy more goods. He and his family hopes that their economic condition will improve in the future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya yang dipasang kotak di kedua sisi belakang motornya Jahuri menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Jahuri membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Jahuri adalah kepala keluarga yang sangat bertanggungjawab mekipun hanya berprofesi sebagai seorang pemulung Jahuri dengan penuh keuletan menjalankan aktifitasnya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya, apalagi untuk menyekolahkan anaknya yang semakin dewasa dan membutuhkan biaya yang tidak sedikit. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Capital to buy used goods - Modal untuk membeli barang-barang bekas

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rahmanath A.t.

texts.fr: Born on November 16, 1965 in Coutonou, Rahmanath H. is married and the mother of two children. She is very dynamic and works hard to hold her own. She distributes personal care products that she buys wholesale in the international market called Dantokpa, such as toothpaste.  Always punctual with her repayments, she  is currently on her third loan. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerNée le 16/11/1965 à Cotonou, Rahmanath H. est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est très dynamique et très battante. Elle fait la revente de produits cosmétiques qu’elle achète au marché international de DANTOKPA tout comme les pâtes dentifrices. Toujours ponctuelle à l’échéance des remboursements, elle en est à son troisième crédit.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cases of personal care products Achat de 10 cartons de produits de beauté

loans.name: Juwairiah B. In

texts.id:
Juwairiah operates a food stall, she sells cooked dishes , snacks, drinks and cigarette . With the financial assistances from Dinari, she hopes to increase the variety of dishes in her menu and also increase her number of customers. She operates her stall from 7 in the morning till 10 in the evening. Around 5am she has to shop in the market for the food ingredients. Her profit is just enough to pay the rents for the room and the stall, and also the daily expenses of her and her husband.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan menyewa sebuah warung Juwairiah membuka usaha dengan menjual makanan lewat warung tersebut, yang dijualnya adalah nasi, sayur, lauk pauk dan kebutuhan lain seperti rokok, snack, dan minuman botol. Dengan mendapatkan modal dari DINARI Juwairiah berharap bisa mengembangkan usahanya dengan menambah beberapa menu makanan sehingga dapat meningkatkan jumlah pelanggan yang makan di warungnya. Juwairiah membuka warungnya dari jam 07.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam, sekitar jam 05.00 pagi dia harus berbelanja kepasar tradisional untuk membeli bahan makanan yang nantinya akan di masak untuk makanan. Keuntungan yang didapatkan mampu memenuhi kehidupan dia bersama suaminya disamping harus membayar uang kontrak kamar dan warungnya.

loans.use: Buying food ingredients - Untuk membeli bahan-bahan makanan

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammad Sudi

texts.id:
Mohammad Sudi is a chicken sate seller, everyday he has to walk at least 3 kilometers from his house. He does this to support his family. He stays with his wife and his 4 months old child at a 3x3 meter room which he rents for 100.000 a month. The fluctuation price of the raw material affects his sate business. He usually is able to sell about 100 sticks. However he will need to sell at least 80 sticks to break even. Mohammad Sudi makes around 40.000 – 50.000 a day. This is just enough to pay the rent and daily expenses. With the help from Dinari he can now expand his sate business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Mohammad Sudi adalah seorang pedagang sate ayam yang setiapharinya harus menempu perjalanana sekitar 3 kilometer dari tempat tinggalnya. Usaha ini dia lakukan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Tinggal bersama istri dan anak yang berumur empat tahun ini mengontrak sebuah kamar yang berukuran 3x3 meter dengan membayar uang sewa sebesar 100.000/bulannya. Menurutnya naiknya harga bahan pokok makanan mempengaruhi usahanya berjualan sate, kalau dulu dia bisa menjual sampai 100 tusuk sate sekarang harus dibatasi 80 tusuk untuk menhindari kerugian yang besar. Keuntungan yang didapat Mohammad Sudi perharinya berkisar antara 40.000 – 50.000/harinya. Cukup untuk ditabung membayar uang sewa kamar dan kebutuhan setiaphari. “Sekarang kan saya mendapatkan bantuan modal dari DINARI kiranya ini dapat meningkatkan usaha saya dalam berjualan sate”. ungkapnya.

loans.use: untuk membeli bahan makanan

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Christine C.a.

texts.fr:
Very respected in her neighborhood where she is seen as a resourceful person, Mrs. D. D. is very precise and attentive to detail in running her business. She is now requesting her fifth loan and is very prompt in her repayments. Born on February 17, 1957 in Abomey in the district of Zou, she is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Très respectée dans son quartier où elle est une personne ressource, Dame D. D. est très rigoureuse et pointilleuse dans la gestion D. ses affaires. Elle est à son cinquième crédit et est très prompte dans le respect des échéances. Née le 17/02/1957 à Abomey dans le Département du ZOU, elle est mariée et mère D. quatre enfants.

loans.use:
purchase of 15 lengths of African print cloth, 5 cases of drinks, a case of liqueurs, and various food items

Achat de 15 pièces de pagne, de 05 casiers de boissons, d’un carton de liqueurs et divers produits alimentaires

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lutfiah

texts.id:
With the knowledge to make sandals, Lutfiah started to make Mote Sandals to finance her family and to send her two children to school. She buys her material at shop which sell raw materials for making sandals. She also teach this skills to her other relative, so that they are also able to make the sandals. After collecting all the sandals, she distributes them to shops around Bali. Her husband handles the distribution. She hopes that they will not be any bombing cases like before that had dampen her sales.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan berbekal keahlian dalam membuat sandal, Lutfiah memulai usahanya menjadi pengepul sandal mote. Usaha ini ditekuninya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan juga menyekolahkan kedua anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah. Lutfiah membeli bahan-bahan baku untuk pembuatan sandal disalah satu toko yang memang menjual bahan-bahan dasar untuk pembuatan sandal tersebut. Keahliannya diajarkan kepada tetangganya dengan tujuan agar mereka juga bisa mengerjakan hal yang sama dan setelah jadi dikumpulkan di tempatnya dan Lutfiah yang menyalurkannya kepada toko-toko atau art shop-artshop yang ada di Bali. Untuk bagian penjualan ke toko-toko dan artshop di tangani oleh suaminya. Harapannya supaya tisdak ada lagi kasus bom yang seperti waktu lalu yang mematikan pemasaran sendalnya.

loans.use: buying materials to make sandals -  untuk membeli bahan-bahan pembuatan sendal

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kyaliwajala D1A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joyce K.. She is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to buy more foods and furniture. Joyce is a 48 year old widow with 8 children ranging from age 5 to 28. The her children go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for the children. Joyce has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 which she invested in her restaurant and the loan was paid back on time.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Robinah N., Justine N., Eunice A., and Harriet N.. Robinah N. is currently operates a clinic and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs and a microscope. Justine N. is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan to invest in the brick business. Eunice A. is currently in the business of maize selling and is requesting a loan to buy more maize form the villages and increase her stock. Harriet N. is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Moulitala

texts.fr:
Specialized in the sewing and emboidering of boubous (wide, flowing traditional robes worn by African men) and all sorts of clothing, El Hadj (a title of respect for someone who has gone on a pilgrimage) A. works primarily for expatriates from neighboring countries, but also has clients from Congo and Cote d'Ivoire. Very ingenious, he is always surrounded by a good aura. He is a father and is the breadwinner for 13 persons. He was born on January 1, 1955. This is his third loan. He is on the far right in the photo; the other people are his workmen.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Spécialisé dans la confection et la broderie de boubous et d’habits de tous genres, EL HADJ A. a pour prinicipaux clients les expatriés des pays voisins mais a aussi des clients au Congo et en Côte -d’Ivoire. Très ingénieux, il bénéficie d’un bon aura dans son entourage. Père de famille, il a 13 personnes à sa charge et est né le 01/01/1955. Il est à son troisième prêt. On le retrouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo, les autres personnes sont ses ouvriers.

loans.use:
Purchase of 8 lengths of Damask cloth

Achat de 8 pièces de tissus bazin

loans.name: Sri Iswati

texts.id:
Sri Iswati, a mother of one child, supports her family's economy by opening a motorcycle spare parts shop. Located in Kepayaon street, the shop can generate 400,000 IDR ($43 USD) per week. Her husband helps her collecting the parts from recyclers. Typically the items are paid after they are sold. Sri Iswati runs the shop from the morning until dawn. Through the business they could send their child to school and cover basic needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sri Iswati adalah ibu dari satu orang anak, menopang perekonomian keluarga dengan membuka warung yang khusus menjual spre part motor. Warung yang terleta di jalan kepaon ini mampu meraup keuntungan 400.000 rupiah/minggu. Usaha ini tentunya didukung oleh suaminya yang menyuplay kebutuhan warung dengan mengambil barang-barang dari para pengepul, biasanya oleh suaminya barang-barang tersebut diambil terlebih dahulu kemudian transaksi pembayaran dilakukan apabila barang tersebut sudah laku. Sri Iswati menjaga warung tersebut dari pagi sampai malam dan lewat usaha tersebut mereka dapat menyekolahkan anak serta mampu mencukupi kebutuhan setiaphari.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr:
Born on July 15, 1969 in Cotonou, Mrs. Henriette A. is pragmatic but also very creative in managing her business affairs. So, besides her work as a seamstress, she buys and sells almost everything, but most particularly lengths of African prints and other cloth which she makes available on a cash or credit basis. She never misses the due date for a repayment and is already on her fourth loan. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 15/07/1969 à Cotonou, Dame A. Henriette est pragmatique. Elle est aussi très créative dans la gestion de ses affaires ; ainsi, en plus de son métier de couturière, elle fait l’achat et la vente de presque tout, mais particulier des pagnes et tissus, qu’elle livre à la distribution vente à crédit ou au comptant. Elle ne rate jamais les échéances, en est à son quatrième crédit, est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase of 9 lengths of African print cloth and 10 spools of sewing thread

Achat de 09 pièces de pagnes et de 10 rouleaux de fil à coudre

loans.name: Kyaliwajala D1B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Louinsa K.. She is currently in the business of matooke (green banana) selling and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Louinsa is 40 years old and is married and her husband is a driver. She has 6 children ranging from age 15 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Louinsa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education. Louinsa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest it in the matooke business and the loan was paid back on time.

Louinsa is joined in her small group by Milly N., Mable Nakuwadde, Jane A., and Jane K.. Milly N. is currently in the business of tomato selling and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Mable Nakuwadde is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to construct a kibanda (shade) for the charcoal. Jane A. is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to expand her brew business. Jane K. currently operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock in the shop.

loans.use: To purchase various types of raw foods thus expand business

loans.name: Dasirah

texts.id:
Dasirah rents an area where she has opened a business selling food. She sells Nasi Goreng (Indonesian Fried Rice) and other items like cigarretes, snacks, bottled water and soft-drinks. With funding from this loan, she hopes to grow her business by adding more items to her menu and therefore increasing her customer base at the restaurant. Her store is open from 7A.M. to 10P.M.. At about 5A.M. she goes to the traditional market to shop for the ingredients she needs to cook with. From the increase in profits, she hopes to better her life for herself and her husband as well as to help pay the rent for the room where she runs her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan menyewa sebuah warung Dasirah membuka usaha dengan menjual makanan lewat warung tersebut, yang dijualnya adalah nasi goreng dan kebutuhan lain seperti rokok, snack, dan minuman botol. Dengan mendapatkan modal dari DINARI Dasirah berharap bisa mengembangkan usahanya dengan menambah beberapa menu makanan sehingga dapat meningkatkan jumlah pelanggan yang makan di warungnya. Dasirah membuka warungnya dari jam 07.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam, sekitar jam 05.00 pagi dia harus berbelanja kepasar tradisional untuk membeli bahan makanan yang nantinya akan di masak untuk makanan. Keuntungan yang didapatkan mampu memenuhi kehidupan dia bersama suaminya disamping harus membayar uang kontrak kamar dan warungnya.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Djuwariah

texts.id:
Djuwariah has lived in Bali since 1999. At that time she sold traditional medicinal herbs from a pushcart. Because there was little business, she decided to switch to selling beaded sandals. She purchased unbeaded sandals in Garmen. Afterwards, employees decorated the sandals with beads. Every week she travels to to Monang-Maning in Garmen, Bali. She makes 250,000 Rupiah per week from her sandal business. From the profits she receives she invests in her business and covers her living expenses of 20,000 Rupiah per day and the cost of her children's education at 70,000 Rupiah per month.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Djuwariah tinggal di Bali sejak tahun 1999. Pada waktu itu dia berjualan jamu dengan menggunakan rombong. Karena sepi akhirnya ia beralih menjadi pengepul sandal mote. Ia mengambil di Garmen sandal – sandal yang belum dimote. Kemudian pegawainya akan menghiasinya dengan mote. Seminggu sekali ia pergi ke Garmen di kawasan Monang- Maning. Pendapatan dari pengepul sandal Rp 250.000,00 setiap minggu. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh selain untuk menunjang usahanya juga dipakai untuk biaya hidup Rp 20.000,00/hari dan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 70.000,00/bulan.

loans.use: to increase the capitol in her business

loans.name: Kyaliwajala D1C Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Florence S..  She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 15,00,000 to increase her stock.  Florence is 27 years old and is married with a husband who is a civil servant for work.  She has one child aged nine who goes to school.  Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.  Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600,000 and the loan was paid back on time.  Florence is joined in her small group by Florence M., Harriet N., Janet N., and Christine O..  Florence M. is currently in the business of making and selling snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to start frying chips for sale.  Harriet N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to buy aother fridge.  Janet N. is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to start a charcoal business.  Christine O. is currently in the business of local brewselling and is requesting a loan of UGX 50,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To increase stock in a retail shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
With a profit of 200,000 Rupiah per week, Sri J. is able to meet the day to day needs of life. By decorating regular sandals, she is able to sell them for a profit of 5,000 Rupiah. Her daily expenses are 20,000 Rupiah. In addition to her daily living costs, she must pay rent for her house. Because she lives alone, she feels she can focus more completely on growing her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan keuntungan per minggu Rp 200.000,00, Sri memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Per pasang sandal rata – rata dia mengambil keuntungan Rp 5.000,00. Per hari dia mengeluarkan Rp 20.000,00 untuk biaya hidup. Selain itu dia harus mengeluarkan biaya sewa untuk kontrak rumahnya. Karena hidup sendiri dia merasa lebih bisa fokus terhadap perkembangan usahanya ini.

loans.use: for business captiol

loans.name: Nanmugongo A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Sarah N..  She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to purchase more products and increase her stock.  Sarah is 40 years old and is divorced with two children aged 4 and 14. Both the children go to school.  Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 25,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to complete her house that is under construction. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the shop and the loan was paid back on time.  Sarah is joined in her small group by Rebecca N., Benah N., Ruth N., and Claire N..  Rebecca N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy another fridge.  Benah N. is also in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to start a poultry business.  Ruth N. runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more items for the shop.  Claire N. also runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to purchase a weighing scale and a fridge.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items and increase stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Busamin

texts.id:
Because living in Java is expensive and the job market is difficult, Busamin and his family moved to Bali to look for work. Busamin has only the most basic education, so he decided to start a business collecting second-hand goods and recyclables to resell. Using a wooden bicycle, he searches for items from 5A.M. to 9A.M. In the afternoon from 4P.M. to 9P.M. he he travels around the entire area of Monang-Maning ending up in Simpang Siur. In one evening he sells up to 30,000 Rupiah. He and his wife work together to meet their needs. They must pay 125,000 Rupiah per month in rent, 15,000 Rupiah per day in living expenses and 260,000 Rupiah per month for their children's education. They currently make up to 350,000 Rupiah per week.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Karena di Jawa biaya hidup semakin mahal dan lapangan kerja sulit, ia dan keluarganya pindah ke Bali untuk mencari pekerjaan. Dengan pendidikan yang sangat minim ia mulai usaha mencari barang bekas (pemulung). Dengan menggunakan sepeda kayuh ia berangkat mencari barang bekas sekitar pukul 05.00 - pukul 09.00 siang. Sore hari ia berangkat pukul 16.00 - pukul 21.00 malam. daerah yang dikelilingi mulai Monang – Maning sampai Simpang Siur. Sekali jalan ia sudah bisa menjual barang bekas Rp 30.000,00. Ia dan isterinya bekerja sama untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup mereka. Biaya kontrak Rp 125.000,00/bulan; Biaya hidup per hari Rp 15.000,00; Biaya pendidikan anak Rp 260.000,00/bulan. Per minggunya mereka mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp 350.000,00/minggu.

loans.use: to increase business capitol

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Antoinette T., truly a jack of all trades, is serious about her work as a seamstress. Over and above that work, however, she is ingenious about finding other ways to earn money: selling African prints and other cloth, stocking rechargeable telephone cards, and selling ice water, etc. She has a good reputation and is presently asking for her fourth loan. She was born on August 6, 1968 in Cotonou, is married, and is the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame T. Antoinette, véritable « touche-à-tout » est dévoué dans son métier de couturière. Mais, à côté de cela, elle ne manque pas d’ingéniosité pour créer des activités parallèles : vente de pagnes et tissus, de cartes de recharge, d’eau glacée, etc. Elle bénéficie d’une bonne notoriété et en est à son quatrième crédit. Elle est née le 06/08/1968 à Cotonou, mariée, mère de quatre enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 lengths of African print cloth and of rechargeable telephone cards for cell phones and phone booths

Achat de 20 pièces de pagnes et de cartes de recharge pour cabine téléphonique et pour téléphones mobiles.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Namugongo B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Sylvia N..  She is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to invest in the business.  Sylvia is 42 years old and is a widow.    She has 5 children ranging from age 12 to to 18 and her children go to school.  Each week, Sylvia makes approximately UGX 60,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to save money for her childrens' eduction  Sylvia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300,000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.  Sylvia is joined in her small group by Ritah B., Rose Namuyinbwa, Agnes N., and Damalie N..  Ritah B. currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase the stock of products in the shop.  Rose N. is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more clothes for sale.  Agnes N. is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand and become a wholesaler.  Damalie N. is currently runs a stationary shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy a photcopying machine.

loans.use: To expand matooke business

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Born around 1957 in Couffo, Mrs. Helene H. is married and the mother of six children. She is presently requesting her fourth loan and her conduct is irreproachable, both in her multiple business dealings and concerning her loan repayments, which she often makes before the due dates. A good wife and mother, she is a model client of our institution.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1957 dans le Couffo, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est à son quatrième crédit et est irréprochable tant dans la conduite de ses affaires multiples que dans le respect des échéances où elle anticipe souvent. Bonne mère de famille, elle est un modèle parmi les bénéficiaires de l’institution.

loans.use:
Purchase of 200 kilos of rice, 100 kilos of dried beans, 1 barrel of oil, 5 lengths of African print, and a dozen handbags

Achat de 200kg de riz, 100kg de haricot, 01 fût d’huile, 05 pièces de pagne et d’une douzaine de sacs à main.

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Ni Luh S. has sold items in the Sempidi Market for 10 years. In the beginning she sold awnings for storefronts. Now she is leasing a place where she can live and sell at the same place. She sells from 5A.M until the market closes. She is in need of funding to make a one-time purchase of inventory of 2,500,000 Rupiah. The funding she receives will be used to add on to the funding she is already using.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Luh S. telah berjualan di Pasar Sempidi selama 10 tahun. Pada awalnya dia berjualan di emperan toko. Sekarang dia sudah menyewa ruko untuk berjualan sekaligus tinggal. Dia berjualan mulai pukul 05.00 sampai dengan pasar tutup. Modal yang dia perlukan dalam sekali belanja untuk barang – barang dagangannya senilai Rp 2.500.000,00. Modal usaha yang dia terima akan digunakan untuk menambah modal usaha yang sudah dia miliki.

loans.use: to increase business capitol

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Mrs. Julienne K. is very dynamic and courteous, a favorite with her friends and customers. She is also very strict in the management of her business. Presently requesting her third loan, she has always made regular, punctual repayments. Born on January 28, 1959 in Cotonou, she is a widow and is raising three children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame K. Julienne est très dynamique et très courtoise. Elle est très appréciée de son entourage et de sa clientèle. Elle est aussi très rigoureuse dans la conduite de son affaire. A son troisième crédit, elle est toujours régulière et ponctuelle aux remboursements. Née le28/01/1959 à Cotonou, elle est veuve avec 3 enfants à sa charge.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 bolts of African print cloth

Achat de 10 pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Namugongo C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret L.. She is currently in the business of selling firewood and is requesting a loan to expand business. Margret is 22 years old and is single. Each week, L. makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

L. is joined in her small group by Margret B., Pauline N., Eva Tuhikumwe, and Sylvia N.. Margret B. has a business in Tailoring and wants to add in the business and buy a new sewing machine. Pauline N. is currently operating a business in canteen and wants a loan to increase stock. Eva Tuhikumwe operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to expand charcoal business. Sylvia N. is currently in the business of sells clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To increase the quanity of firewood for sale

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Safina N..  She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes/onions and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand the business.  Safina is 36 years old, married and her husband is a businessman .  She has seven children ranging from age 5 to 16 and her children go to school.  Each week, Safina makes approximately UGX 70,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business  Safina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.  Safina is joined in her small group by Prossy Nabaka, Prossy Nakibuka, Irene Mukasa, and Angella Nassali.  Prossy Nabaka is currently in the clothing business and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to purchase more clothes.  Prossy Nakibuka is currently in the business of selling charcoal and food sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy more charcoal.  Irene Mukasa owns a video hall/ restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to buy more food.  Angella Nassali is currently in the hotel business and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to invest more in the business.

loans.use: To expand her retail food business

loans.name: Namugongo D Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Jane S..  She is currently in the business of education, running a nursery schoool and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to construct another classroom.  Jane is a 46 year old widow.    She has onechild aged 22 who goes to school.  Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build more classrooms.  Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the education business and the loan was paid back on time.  Jane is joined in her small group by Faridah N., Juliet N., Margret N., and Betty N..  Faridah N. is currently in the business of raw foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to increase her stock.  Juliet N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to increase her stock.  Margret N. also runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy another fridge.  Betty N. also runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to start a restaurant business.

loans.use: To construct a new classroom and expand her nursery school

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Safina N..  She is currently runs a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to to expand her business.  Safina is 32 years old and is married.  Her husband is a businessman.  She has one child, aged 10 and she goes to school.  Each week, Safina makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business  Safina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.  Safina is joined in her small group by Alice Nazziwa, Nulu Musisi,  Monica Kobusingye, and Carline Bawehendeza.  Alice Nazziwa is currently in the clothing business and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to buy more clothes.  Nulu Musisi runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to buy more equipment.   Monica Kobusingye is currently runs a salon and a payphone business and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to expand her business.  Carline Bawehendeza runs a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to to buy more food.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Suyono Kholip

texts.id:
Suyono Kholip makes coals out of coconut shells. Through this business, which he started 7 years ago, Suyono can earn profits around $150 a month. Although the profit is not much, Suyono continues to work hard to support his wife and their 5-year-old child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Suyono Kholip adalah seorang pembuat arang dari batok kelapa. Usaha ini dia jalani sejak 7 tahun yang lalu dan lewat usaha ini Suyono bisa menghasilkan keuntungan sekitar 1.500.000/bulannya. Walaupun keuntungan yang didapat tidak seberapa namun Suyono tetap berusaha keras untuk menghidupi istri dan anaknya yang baru berusia 5 tahun.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (coconut shells)

loans.name: Nestapa Tay Ramatana

texts.id:
Nestapa works very diligently in a furniture business with a monthly salary of $80. He wishes for a better life, and thus, was very grateful to receive this opportunity from DINARI. He will use the loan to buy his own woodworking and carpentry tools, which he can use to accept freelance orders for additional income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Nestapa adalah seorang yang sangat ulet dan tekun bekerja, dia bekerja di sebuah usaha furniture dengan gaji 800.000/bulan. Nestapa menpunyai keinginan untuk maju dan untuk itulah dia sangat senang ketika mendapat pinjaman modal dari DINARI karena modal tersebut akan dipakainya untuk membeli alat-alat pertukangan. Dengan mempunyai alat sendiri secara otomatis akan bisa menambah penghasilannya dalam berusaha.

loans.use: To buy woodworking and carpentry tools

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr:
Born on January 29, 1960 in Cotonou, Mrs. Georgette A. is married and the mother of two children. She prepares and sells a type of dried beans that is greatly appreciated by motor-taxi drivers (commonly known as Zemidjan) and by workmen. She manages to attract more than 300 customers a day which allows her to do a substantial business. Unfortunately, she is living with a polygamous husband who does nothing to take care of her. She remains solely responsible for all her family's needs. It is for this reason that she is obliged to request a loan so that she can retain her customer base and expand her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 29/01/1960 à Cotonou, Dame Geogette A. est mariée et mère de 02 enfants . Elle prépare et vend du haricot; un met fortement apprécié par les conducteurs de taxi moto (communément appelés ZEMIDJAN) et par les ouvriers .Elle attire à elle plus de 300 clients par jour; ce qui lui permet de réaliser un important chiffre d’affaire. Malheureusement elle vit avec un mari polygame qui ne s’ occupe nullement de sa condition de vie .Elle reste et demeure la seule à régler tous les problèmes familiaux .C’est ce qui l'a obligé à recourir au crédit pour maintenir sa clientèle et renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 5 sacks of dried beans, 10 liters of palm oil, 1 bag of manioc semolina, and two sacks of voandzou (a type of groundnut)

05 sacs de haricot, 10 litres d’huile de palme, 01 sac de gari, 02 sacs de voandzou

loans.name: Mevlida

texts.en: Mevlida lives in Stupari, a small place near Kladanj. She is 43 years old and she is married. Her husband works in the state service as a jurist. His monthly income is 750 KM and they don't have any other additional sources of income. Mevlida resells used clothes. As she wanted to improve her business activity she took a loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 1000 KM. She intends to buy some more used clothes and in that way to provide better living conditions for her 3 children. She wants to secure their continued education.

loans.use: Buying used clothes.

loans.name: Ayaba Valentine

texts.fr:
Divorced and the mother of three children, Ayaba Valentine A. has benefited from the goodwill of her older brother, who gave her starting capital for her business selling hardware goods. Since then, she has been using only this capital, which is no longer enough in face of current business demands.  Aware of her situation, she has turned towards borrowing money in order to maintain growth and to establish herself firmly in this sector.  At 36 years of age, she alone is responsible for supporting her entire household. 
 Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Divorcée et mère de trois enfants, Dame A. a bénéficié de la bienveillance  de son frère aîné qui lui a donné un capital pour la vente des produits de quincaillerie. Depuis ce temps elle a utilisé uniquement ce capital qui ne suffit plus pour faire face aux exigences  de son activité. Consciente de sa situation, elle a fait recours au crédit pour maintenir sa croissance et s’imposer dans son domaine d’activité. Agée de 36ans, elle supporte entièrement  toutes les charges de son foyer .

loans.use: To buy 5 bundles of galvanized corrugated metal sheets, 20 iron bars, and 50 galvanized tips

loans.name: A. Jocelyne

texts.fr:
A. Jocelyne A. was born on May 9, 1976 in Cotonou (Littoral District). She is married and the mother of two. She sells clothing, shoes, and undergarments that she acquires in Lomé, in the neighboring republic of Togo. Her husband teaches in a private school and earns very little, which doesn't allow him to be the sole provider for his family. So she must help with family expenses. The income from her business enables her to meet family needs. She is waiting for this loan, which would build up her working capital to increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 09/05/1976 à cotonou dans le LITTORAL, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des vêtements, des chaussures et des dessous qu’elle achète à Lomé dans la république voisine du TOGO.Son époux instituteur dans une école privée a un faible revenu qui ne lui permet pas de subvenir seul aux besoins de la famille. Elle doit participer aux dépenses familiales .Le revenu issu de son activité lui permet de répondre aux sollicitations de la famille. Elle attend ce crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d'augmenter son revenu.

loans.use: To buy 12 women's dresses, 20 men's suits, 12 pairs of women's shoes, and 20 pairs of men's shoes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Y. Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Y. Jacqueline K. is a wholesale specialist in yams purchased from growers in her village. Her store is located inside the Dantokpa market, where she sells her goods, and where she also builds up her inventory during periods of abundance. But this requires a lot of funds that she cannot generate herself. In Cotonou, selling yams is a very worthwhile business because yams are a staple food. Her husband is a health department representative who does not earn enough, and family expenses demand much of her. So she has to have more resources to meet customer demand and to help with family expenses. She was born on June 3, 1977, is married, and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Dame KOKTOKO est spécialisée dans la vente en gros d'igname acheté auprès des cultivateurs de son village. Elle a son magasin de vente à l'intérieur du marché international de Dantokpa où elle vend et fait aussi le stockage pendant la période d’abondance; ceci nécessite beaucoup de fonds que sa seule capacité financière n’arrive pas à contenir .A Cotonou la vente de l’igname est une activité très rentable parce que faisant partie des aliments de base .Son mari est un agent de santé qui n’a pas suffisamment de ressources .Très sollicitée dans les dépenses de son ménage, dame K. doit multipler ses revenus afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et participer aux dépenses familiales. Née le 03/06/1977, elle est mariée et mère d’ un enfant.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of yams

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married, and has one daughter, Victoria. They live together in Vasilyevka. Yuryi sells sausage, meats, and other groceries in the local market. His vending stand is well known for the prices he offers, and the affordability compared to market prices. Yuryi knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them the best quality in groceries. He has been selling goods for a total of 6 years, with consistent profits. Currently, he earns around $3000 a month.

Yuri has been dreaming of opening a small grocery store for a long time. He is hoping for a loan of $1200 to open a store in his neighborhood. He has planned and envisioned the plans for expansion for his trade and believes that it will be truly helpful for his entrepreneurial endeavors. This loan will help Yuri persist and take the necessary steps to achieve the success he has been dreaming of.

loans.use: To purchase a small store

loans.name: Jader Genaro

texts.es:
Hardware and tools are used in many activities, which is why Jader C. wisely devoted himself to selling hardware products in the Central Market of León more than five years ago.

Currently, he is the father of two children, a boy and a girl, that he tells us are his entire motive for his working so hard to meet their needs.

Three months ago, Mr. C. got his first credit through CEPRODEL, and according to him, it has benefited him greatly, and he now sees greater income, and has been able to supply the needs of his two small children. He greatest need these days is the acquisition of hardware and tools.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Los productos de ferretería son muy utilizados para muchas actividades, es por esto que muy sabiamente desde hace más de cinco años el señor Jader C. se dedica a la comercialización de productos ferreteros en el mercado Central del departamento de León.

Actualmente es padre de dos pequeños (un niño y una niña) que según cuenta son todo el motivo por el cual él se esfuerza para satisfacer todas sus necesidades.

Desde hace tres meses, el señor C. realizó su primer crédito en CEPRODEL y según comenta le fue de mucho beneficio ya que percibió mejores ingresos y además logró suplir las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos. Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es la adquisición de los productos ferreteros.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware and tools for resale

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr:
Pascaline V. was born on September 12, 1971 in Cotonou, is married to a used car salesman, and is the mother of four children. She is in the restaurant business in a popular Cotonou neighborhood that enables her to realize enormous profits. Household expenses fall entirely upon her shoulders. Her business is what provides for her as well as her children. To properly take on these responsibilities of hers, she became our client six years ago. We approve a renewal of her loan request because of her dependability in repaying.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 12/09/1971 à Cotonou Dame V. s'est mariée à un vendeur de véhicules d’occasion et est mère de 04 enfants. Elle fait la restauration dans un quartier populaire de cotonou; ce qui lui permet de réaliser d’énorme bénéfice. Les charges familiales sont entièrement à sa charge et c’est de son activité qu'elle pourvoie à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pour assumer correctement cette responsabilité, elle est devenue notre cliente depuis 6ans .Sa fidélité dans le remboursement nous autorise à lui renouveler sa demande de prêt.

loans.use: To buy five 25-kg sacks of rice, three 25-kg sacks of beans, twelve benches, six tables, and other items.

loans.name: Roger Cruz

texts.es:
Mr. Roger D. dedicates his life to the selling of spices such as cinnamon, clove, raisins, vinegars, etc. His business got started at teh outskirts of the Leon central market. As time has gone by, he's been able to add his own business in this local market.

He is married and has two children. He works very hard in order to provide them the basic needs. His wife supports him greatly eventhough she's a housewife. She packages the spices in order for him to take them to the market.

Very intelligently, Mr. Roger D. has gone to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan. These loans have been used to purchase spices. His biggest hope is to purchase more spices that will be sold in his market, this will help him support his family. He's had a record of 20 loans so far.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Roger D. se dedica a la venta de especies como canelas, clavo de olor, pasas, vinagres, etc. Su negocio inició en las aceras del marcado central de León pero a medida que ha transcurrido el tiempo ha logrado un local propio en dicho mercado.

Es casado y padre de dos hijos que se esfuerza día a día para llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación. Su esposa lo apoya grandemente y a pesar de ser ama de casa le envuelve sus productos en bolsas para que luego él los venda en su local.

Muy inteligentemente el señor Roger D. ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de sus especies, hoy en día su mayor anhelo es comprar estos productos para seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar. Su record es de 20 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Antonio Tobias

texts.es:
Antonio M. is a very responsible gentleman who repairs shoes for a living at the local Leon area.

His business is widely visited by many because he is capable of fixing shoes. He offers his clients a high quality service.

Antonio M. has the urgency to purchase materials to repair these shoes (leather, sand paper, thread and glue). For this reason he goes to Ceprodel in order to get the necessary credit that will allow him repair shoes and offer the best quality out there.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio M. es un caballero muy responsable que se dedica a la reparación de zapatos en las afueras del mercado central del departamento de León.

Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy visitado debido a que el señor M. posee mucha habilidad en la reparación de los zapatos y por esto es que se prepara para recibir a sus clientes y brindarles un servicio de alta calidad.

Una necesidad que atraviesa el señor Antonio M. es la urgencia de la compra de los productos para la reparación de los zapatos (cuero, lija, pega e hilo) y por esta razón acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan adquirir estos materiales para continuar siendo el mejor zapatero de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair shoes

loans.name: Melba Del Rosario

texts.es:
For more than five years, Mrs. Melba S. has been in the business of selling costume jewelry, as well as stuffed animals, decorations, lamps, and backpacks, in the central market of the city of León. She began selling her products on the sidewalks with out any place to protect her, but after a few years she decided to invest in a fixed stand where she could manage her business without any troubles.

It’s necessary to highlight that Mrs. Melba is a single mother with one child to support. That’s why she’s turned to CEPRODEL to earn credit that will help her in the purchase of the products that will help her continue to support her son. Her credit history with CEPRODEL consists of 22 credits that were paid on time and according to the contract.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Melba S. desde hace mas de 5 años se dedica al negocio de venta de bisuterías (peluches y adornos, lámparas y mochilas) en el mercado Central de la ciudad de León. Comenzó con la venta de sus productos en las aceras sin ningún lugar que la protegiera pero al pasar de los años decide invertir en un puesto fijo el cual lo logra implementar sin ningún problema.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Melba es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener, por tal razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con Créditos que la apoyen en la compra de sus productos para continuar manteniendo a su pequeño hijo. Su record crediticio es de 22 créditos con CEPRODEL pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to resell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
For most of her life, Mrs. Mercedes S. devoted herself entirely to her family, living off of her husband’s income. Nevertheless, on realizing the difficulty of their family’s economic situation, she decided to take out a loan to open a beauty salon in their home, since she has skills in this area.

She began her beauty activities in her home, with her own savings and in part with those gotten through CEPRODEL. With the cash, she bought a mirror and some scissors to bring service to her customers in León, which is where she’s from.

Mrs. S. has benefited from her six credits through CEPRODEL. She says that thanks to them, her business has increased rapidly, achieving better conditions and providing her customers with better service, in addition to helping her husband with their household needs and raising their son.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Mercedes S., la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado solo a su familia viviendo de los ingresos del esposo sin embargo, al darse cuenta que la situación económica aun sigue difícil en el núcleo familiar decide realizar un préstamo para poner un salón de belleza en su hogar ya que ella presenta habilidades en este ramo.

Inicia la actividad de belleza en su casa, con ahorros propios y parte con los obtenidos en Ceprodel. Al tener el capital, compra un espejo y algunas tijeras para brindar servicio a la clientela de la ciudad de León de donde es originaria.

La señora S. ha sido beneficiada con seis créditos por lo que declara que gracias a estos préstamos en Ceprodel el negocio ha incrementado rápidamente logrando tener mejores condiciones para brindar buen servicio a su clientela, además de ayudar al esposo con la responsabilidad del hogar y la formación de su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Melvin José

texts.es:
Mr. Melvin L. devotes himself to renting computers with Internet access in the city of León. It’s a very important business since young students use the computers to do their homework assignments, which is why they turn to this center to rent computers.

Today, the business is growing rapidly due to the fact that he has known to invest in the businesss through loans from CEPRODEL that he uses to directly purchase computers as well as maintain and repair these machines.

Currently, he needs to acquire a new computer and to purchase new hardware to replace damaged equipment. For this reason, he confidently turns to CEPRODEL to receive help from these credits that he says will be of great use to him.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El alquiler de computadoras con acceso a Internet es el negocio que se dedica el señor Melvin L. en la ciudad de León. Es un negocio muy importante debido a que los jóvenes estudiantes hacen uso de computadoras para realizar sus tareas y por tal motivo acuden a este centro para alquilar las computadoras.

Hoy en día el negocio ha venido proliferando por el hecho de que ha sabido invertir en el negocio por medio de los créditos otorgados en Ceprodel utilizados directamente en la compra de las computadoras y además en el mantenimiento y repararon de estos equipos.

Actualmente su necesidad es la adquisición de una nueva computadora y la compra de piezas nuevas para cambiárselas a los equipos dañados y para esta razón es que acude confiadamente a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con estos créditos que asegura le son de mucha utilidad.

loans.use: Invest in new computers and replacement hardware

loans.name: Marha Catalina

texts.es:
Four years ago Martha started the selling of cosmetics through a catalog. This was because her husband lost his job and the severance that he received was not enough to cover the costs of their two children who are attending school. The supplies that the children need are many and occasionally they could not pay for them. After her husband found new work, she has continued with her business because she noticed that her income could improve their living conditions and ascertain that her children would not be in need of anything.

Martha currently has a portfolio of customers that place orders with her. However, she has at this time a couple of orders that she cannot fill because she lacks the funds. For this reason, Martha is requesting a loan of USD $475 that she will repay in six months. With this money she will be able to buy the products that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Martha comenzó hace 4 años a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Puesto que su esposo se quedó desempleado y con lo que le dieron de finiquito no era suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos a quienes tiene estudiando y los materiales que les piden son mucho que en ocasiones no los pueden pagar. Después de que su esposo encontró trabajo. Martha continuó con el negocio puesto que se dio cuenta que con lo que ganara ella podría incrementar su nivel de vida y así procurar que no les falte nada a sus hijos.

Martha actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes que poco a poco le están pidiendo productos. Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que no a podido surtir por falta de recursos. Es por eso que Martha está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar los productos que le hacen falta.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.en:
The Nicaraguan handcrafts have always been in high demand both from Nicaraguans as well as foreigners. The city of Leon is known for selling these types of products and one of the vendors is Ms. Maria Nela R. whom with much effort had dedicated herself to selling these handcrafts in the main open-air market in Leon.

Every day, Ms. Maria R. is visited by people wanting to purchase her products and for this reason each day she makes the effort to bring her customers excellent products which reflect the Nicaraguan identity.

To improve her business, Ms. Maria R. had come to Ceprodel which has given her great assistance with granting 13 loans which were used to acquire handcrafts to sell. Her current need is to purchase more of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Las artesanías nicaragüenses siempre han sido productos muy demandados tanto por personas nacionales como extranjeros. La ciudad de León se caracteriza por comercializar estos productos y una de las comerciantes es la señora Maria Nela R. que con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a la venta de estas artesanías que las vende al aire libre en el mercado central de la ciudad de León.

Todos los días, la señora Maria R. es visitada por personas interesadas en las compra de los productos y por tal razón es que día a día se esfuerza para brindar a sus clientes eficientes productos que reflejan la identidad nicaragüense.

Para mejorar su negocio, la señora Maria R. ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un gran apoyo con la entrega de 13 créditos utilizados para la adquisición de las artesanías para luego vender estos productos. Su necesidad actual es la adquisición de tales productos.

loans.use: Purchase of handcrafts.

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.en:
Over the last five years in the city of León, Mrs. Yazmina O. has been selling sweets (candies, cookies, chocolates) and soft drinks pops from her residence, in order to support her humble family. The business has been highly frequented since it is located in a very busy area on one of the major streets.

For the last two years, Ceprodel has supported Yazmina O. by granting 9 loans which have been used to purchase soft drinks and continue to strive to improve her family’s condition which they need very much. Her main need is to urgently invest in the remodeling of her store and the purchase of products.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace mas de cinco años, en la ciudad de León, para poder mantener a su humilde familia, la señora Yasmina O. se dedica a la venta de golosinas (caramelos, galletas, chocolates) y gaseosas en su hogar de habitación. El negocio es muy visitado por el hecho de que la señora Yasmina se encuentra ubicada en una localidad muy transitada por personas por ser una calle principal.

Desde hace dos años, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Yasmina O. con la realización de 9 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para la compra de las gaseosas y seguir esforzándose por sacar adelante a su familia que tanto lo necesitan. Su mayor necesidad es con urgencia la inversión en la remodelación de su local y además la adquisición de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
She was born about 1978 in Lokossa (Mono District), is married, and has no children. Her business selling staple foodstuffs is located in the international Dantokpa market in Cotonou and is very worthwhile due to high consumption in the city of Cotonou. Married to a mason, she is aware of her role in their marriage. This is why she is trying to build up her working capital in order to expand her business and thus her income. This loan is necessary for her goal and would serve as a springboard for renewing her business. So she is quite right to come and request a loan from our institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers 1978 à Lokossa dans le département du MONO, elle est mariée et sans enfant. Son activité de commercialisation des produits vivriers est exercé dans le marché international DANTOKPA de Cotonou et est très rentable à cause de la grande capacité de consommation de ces produits dans la ville de Cotonou. Epouse d'un maçon, elle est consciente du rôle qui le sien sous le toit conjugal. C’est pourquoi elle s’essaie à renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d’élargir son volume d’activité et par conséquent son revenu. Le crédit est à cet effet une solution nécessaire, un tremplin pour donner un nouveau souffle à son activité. et c'est à juste titre qu'elle est venue solliciter ce crédit auprès de notre institution.

loans.use: To buy twenty 50-kg sacks of beans and fifteen 50-kg sacks of voandzou  (a type of ground nut)

loans.name: Agustina Josefina

texts.en:
The sale of various products and making and selling clothing are the businesses which Ms. Agustina Josefina C. dedicates her time out of her home in the city of Leon.

The small businesses are run out of her home with the hope of improving their economic condition. The clothing business sets itself apart as being different from others since she designs the clothing she sells and she also works with custom orders, which she has been doing since she was little. She says she was always drawn to dressmaking and decided to begin these businesses to support her home and help her elderly parents.

To improve her business, Ms. Agustina has had other loans with Ceprodel and she feels very happy because they have helped her purchase the various products for her store and the fabric to make the dresses and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de productos varios (pulpería) y la elaboración y venta de ropa son los negocios a que se dedica la señora Agustina Josefina C. en la ciudad de León en su casa de habitación.

El pequeño negocio de pulpería lo posee en su hogar con la esperanza de mejorar su condición económica de igual manera con el negocio de venta de ropa. el negocio de venta de ropa se caracteriza por ser diferente a los demás debido a que ella elabora los vestidos y los vende, además trabaja por encargo siendo este su negocio desde muy pequeña. Comenta que siempre se sintió atraída por la costura y decide poner estos negocios para mantener su hogar y apoyar a sus padres que ya son mayores de edad.

Para mejorar su negocio, la señora Agustina ha realizado créditos en CEPRODEL y se siente muy contenta porque le han servido de mucho beneficio para la adquisición de los productos de la pulpería y de la tela para elaborar sus vestidos para luego venderlos.

loans.use:
Purchase products for a small general store and purchase fabric
for clothing.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
Born around 1974 in Lokossa, Mrs. Blandine K. excels at selling food-producing grain and palm oil in Cotonou's Dantokpa market. Much sought after by the small market retailers around town, her ambition is to increase the size of her market stall in order to meet the ever-growing demand. Married to a town-taxi driver, she puts a lot into the household expenses and contributes enormously to the various needs of her brothers and sisters.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1974 à Lokossa dame Blandine K. excelle dans la commercialisation des produits vivriers et d'huile de palme dans le marché DANTOKPA de Cotonou. Très sollicitée par les détaillants des petits marchés de la ville, elle ambitionne agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. Mariée à un Conducteur de taxi ville, elle investit beaucoup dans les charges du ménage et contribue énormément aux différents besoins de ses frères et soeurs.

loans.use: To buy 40 x 100kg bags of corn and 500 liters of palm oil

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen C. is a lady with much experience in sales; twelve years ago she started with the opening of a general store in the city of Leon. She used her own capital which she had accumulated since her youth working as an assistant in a carpenter shop.

It should be noted, that her business started as a table in her home from which she would sell her products. Little by little her business grew and she attained larger sales levels.

Since 7 years ago, Mrs. Carmen has seen and increase in sales due to the loans that she acquired from Ceprodel, which enabled her to rebuild her business and improve her mix of products. Her current goal is to increase her income and be able to continue to feed and support her family as they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carmen C. es una dama de mucha experiencia en el área de las ventas. Desde hace 12 años comenzó con la implementación de una pulpería en la ciudad de León. Inició con un capital propio que lo obtuvo producto de su arduo trabajo desde su juventud como ayudante de carpintería.

Es digno señalar que el negocio comenzó con una mesa en la cual vendía sus pocos productos desde su hogar y así fue creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a alcanzar mayores niveles de venta en su negocio.

Desde hace 7 años la señora Carmen ha visto un avance debido a que ha realizado préstamos en Ceprodel de los cuales le han apoyado para reconstruir su negocio y poder surtir su cartera de productos. Su meta hoy en día es llegar a aumentar sus ganancias y seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar con la alimentación y apoyo que su familia se merece.

loans.use: Purchase of products (Shanpoo, deodorants, crackers, oats, beverages, bread, cereals, etc.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr:
A seamstress by profession, Mrs. Sylvie A. is married to a photographer and has 2 children. After repeated failures in setting up a workshop, she repositioned herself within the trade by making and selling women’s clothes to store-keepers in central Africa. The profit margin on each sale is not insignificant and in fact is her motivation to pursue this on a larger scale. To satisfy her clientele, she has approached our institution in order to obtain a loan over a period of 12 months. She was born around 1978.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Couturière de profession, elle est mariée à un photographe et mère de 02 enfants.Après des échecs répétés dans l’installation d‘un atelier, elle s’est repositionnée dans ce métier en confectionnant et en vendant des vêtements pour femme aux commerçantes de l’Afrique centrale.La marge bénéficiaire tirée sur chaque opération n'est pas négligeable et constitue d’ailleurs sa motivation pour une activité à grande échelle.Pour satisfaire sa clientèle,elle a fait recours à notre institution afin d’obtenir un crédit d’une durée de 12 mois. Elle est née vers 1978.

loans.use: To buy 10 pieces of rich Bazin cloth and embroidery supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
Single with no children, Miss Florence A. left school early to follow her mother into selling food-producing grain. Self-taught, she became independent and has been carrying out this activity conscientiously and devotedly for 5 years. Her energy and zeal for work make her a woman who is economically very active. In fact the growth in her working fund is proof of this. In three years she has never missed a repayment. She is 25 years old.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Célibataire sans enfant elle a très tôt abandonné les bancs pour suivre sa maman dans la commercialisation des produits vivriers. Formée sur le tas, elle devenue autonome et réalise depuis 5ans cette activité avec conscience et dévouement. Son dynamisme et son zèle au travail font d'elle une femme économiquement très active. D’ailleurs l’évolution de son fonds de roulement en est une preuve. Depuis trois ans elle n’a jamais manqué ses remboursements. Elle est agée de 25 ans.

loans.use: To buy 20 x 50kg bags of beans and 15 x 50kg bags of voandzou.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
After her husband lost his job, Blanca started to sell shoes through a catalogue. Her mother sells these products and seeing the need she gave Blanca a portfolio of customers. With this help she enthusiastically started this venture. Currently her customer base has grown and fortunately her husband has found work.

She still needs to continue to grow her business, however, and she does not have enough capital to buy more shoes. This is the reason Blanca is requesting a loan of USD $1200, that she is certain she can repay in six months. With this money she will be able to get her three children, ages 9, 3 and 1, ahead so that they can get as much schooling as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo después de que su esposo se quedó sin trabajo. Su mamá se dedica a vender estos productos y al ver la necesitad de Blanca le pasó una cartera de clientes. Con esto y mucho entusiasmo comenzó con este oficio. Actualmente su cartera a crecido. Y afortunadamente su esposo ya tiene trabajo.

Sin embargo Blanca necesita seguir creciendo porque no cuenta con recursos suficientes para poder tener calzado. Es por eso que Blanca está solicitando un crédito de US $1200 que está segura podrá pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Blanca podrá sacar adelante a sus tres hijos de 9, 3 y 1 año para que estudien lo más que se pueda.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for pending orders

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Four years ago, as she separated from her husband, she was not able to receive money for the support of their children of 10 and 7 years of age because he was not employed. She thus saw the need to obtain income from other sources. While she was looking for a job, she saw newspaper advertisement for an opportunity to sell cosmetics through a catalog and went to the interviews. She currently has a group of more than 30 persons that sell the cosmetics.

However, the orders that her sales people place are many and the money that she has is not enough to fill them all. This is the reason for her request of a loan of USD $650 which she will repay in six months. With this money, Evelia will be able to advance her business as well as her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 4 años al momento de su separación, su ex-esposo no dio dinero para la manutención de sus dos hijos de 10 y 7 años, porque no tenía empleo. Así que ella vio la necesidad de buscar el sustento por otro lado. Y mientras buscaba un trabajo. Vio en el periódico la oportunidad de vender cosméticos por catálogo y acudió a las entrevistas, actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo de más de 30 personas que venden los cosméticos.

Sin embargo los pedidos que le hacen sus vendedoras son muchos y el dinero con el que cuenta no es suficiente para surtirlos todos, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Evelia podrá sacar adelante su negocio así como a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
