Her and her husband did not have the money to pay for her internal career payments, rectory payments, or the preparatory school payments for her three children. For this reason, Marina decided to work. Her friend invited her to sell shoes via cataloges and was integrated as a shoe saleswoman.

Actually, she already had various clients that constantly looked to buy shoes. Still, she has little merchandise and many pending orders from her clients. For this reason, she is asking for $750 that she will pay back in 6 months. With your help, Marina will be able to pay for the costs of her sons' education in order for them to become good men.

This story was translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer. El pago de la cuota interna de la carrera, el pago de rectoría y el de la preparatoria de dos de sus tres hijos se juntaron y Marina ni su esposo tenían dinero para poder pagarlos. Fue por eso que Marina se decidió a trabajar. Una amiga de ella la invitó a una plática de venta de zapatos por catálogo y se integró como vendedora de zapatos.

Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que constantemente la buscan para comprarle zapatos. Sin embargo tiene muy poca mercancía y varios pedidos pendientes que le han hecho sus clientes. Es por eso que Marina está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Marina podrá sacar adelante los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos para que estos sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: To supply orders.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
A hairdresser by profession, Mrs. Christine C. is married and has 3 children. She opened her hairdressing salon in Lokokoukoume, one of the neighborhoods on the outskirts of Cotonou. The geographic location of her salon makes it the most frequently visited in the area. Unfortunately she is experiencing difficulties due to not having enough products to satisfy her large clientele. She therefore decided to take out a loan in order to fulfill the expectations of the many young girls and women of her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Coiffeuse de profession, Dame C. Christine est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure à LOKOKOUKOUME, l'un des quartiers périphériques de Cotonou. La situation géographique de son salon fait de ce dernier le plus fréquenté de la zone. Malheureusement, elle éprouve des difficultés dues à l'insuffisance de matériels pouvant satisfaire sa forte clientèle. Ainsi, elle a décidé de contracter ce crédit afin de répondre aux attentes des nombreuses jeunes filles et dames de son quartier.

loans.use: To buy one free-standing hair dryer, one hand-held hair dryer, 20 packs of hair extensions and various cosmetic products.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sophie A. specializes in making African tunics and shirts using Bazin (a cloth with a design woven into the fabric), linen and Dutch wax-dyed cloth that she then sells to people who are the most poor, are in insecure jobs or have limited means. The growth in her business is due to the quality of her shirts and tunics. To sustain this growth, therefore, she especially needs to acquire a new sewing machine in order to gain the loyalty of her clientele.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame A. Sophie est spécialisée dans la confection de boubous et de chemises à partir des tissus bazin, lin et wax hollandais qu'elle vend aux plus pauvres, aux précaires et à une clientèle ayant des revenus moyens. L'accroissement de son affaire est dû à la qualité des chemises et boubous qu'elle confectionne. Pour soutenir donc cet accroissement, elle a surtout besoin d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre pour fidéliser sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, 10 pieces of Dutch wax-dyed cloth, 10 pieces of Bazin cloth and linen

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
There was a period of time where Lucinda's husband did not have a job and her parents had came to live with them in their house. As this happened, she needed to have a higher income. Fortunately, someone she knew offered her a job selling cosmetics. Lucinda, who had already been a vendor, accepted the job. Little by little her client's increased. Now, seh has various clients that want to buy cosmetics from her.

Still, she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her clients. For this reason she asks for a loan of $250 that she will pay back in 3 months. Se will be able to buy merchandise to offer her clients with this. With your help, she will be able to give a better life to her kids and her parents.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Hubo una temporada en que el esposo de Lucinda se quedó sin trabajo, y los papás de ella se fueron a vivir a su casa. Fue así como la necesidad de tener ingresos incrementó. Afortunadamente una conocida le ofreció trabajar como vendedora de cosméticos y Lucinda quien ya había trabajado como vendedora aceptó. Poco a poco fue incrementando su cartera de clientes. Actualmente ya tiene varias clientas que le piden los cosméticos a ella.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Lucinda podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Lucinda podrá darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y a sus papás.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing  in diverse products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her and her husband's furniture making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in ingredients and physical improvements to her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversifying her product line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials necessary to make his products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more crabs at higher quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products and improve the appearance of her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To inves4t in a high volume of merchandise.

Invertir en mas mercaderia a mas alto volumen

loans.name: Amanecer Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Waking Up Always, Amancer por Siempre, is made up of 17 women whose intention in life is to generate income to assure the welfare and education of their children.

They take part in different activities like craft and fabric painters, cloth vendors, florists and mainly selling toys. For this end, they travel to the interior of the country to buy the merchandise and subsquently sell it at the fair in the city named "The High One", or El Alto.

For this reason, it is necessary to build up capital to take advantage of carnival season and sell water games, famous squirts, globes, water bames and other things to generate bigger and better resources for their business.

Amanecer por Siempre, es el deseo de 17 mujeres cuyas intenciones en la vida son las de superación parra poder de esta manera generar los ingresos para asegurar principalmente el estudio y bienestar de sus hijos

Distintas actividades las caracteriza, como ser la artesanía en tela y pintura, el comercio de ropa y prendas de vestir, repostería, floristería, pero uno de los principales es la venta de juguetes. Para este fin, muchas de las socias deben viajar al interior del país para adquirir su mercadería que posteriormente será vendida en sus puestos en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto.

Por tal motivo, es necesaria la capitalización de estas socias, para aprovechar la temporada de carnavales, que es especial para la venta de juegos de agua, como los famosos chisguetes, globos, bombas de agua y otros, lo que permitirá generar mayores y mejores recursos para su subsistencia.

loans.use:
This loan is necessary to build up capital for the associates. They will take advantage of the season of Carnival and sell water games, famous squirts, globes, water bombs and other things to generate bigger and better resources for their business.

es necesaria la capitalización de estas socias, para aprovechar la temporada de carnavales, que es especial para la venta de juegos de agua, como los famosos chisguetes, globos, bombas de agua y otros, lo que permitirá generar mayores y mejores recursos para su subsistencia.

loans.name: Leo Group

texts.es:
Leo: This word can be interpreted in many different ways, such as lions – or in this case, lionesses. It can also be thought of as a sign of the zodiac, the strongest sign, as well as in many other ways. But according to these businesswomen, these two concepts showcase each of their personalities. Sixteen women make of this group, and for more than six years, they have been each other’s constant and most important companions.

Most of the members devote themselves to preparing fast food, while others prepare more sophisticated dishes in the national tastes, while still others dedicate themselves to making lunches in hotels and restaurants in the area.

Their main concern is the demand that will exist during the folkloric events that will go on during the parties of Carnaval, given that the attendance at these events is massive and they generally consume throughout the entire event. For this reason, they need cash to be able to purchase the needed ingredients for the preparation of their dishes; this way, they can compete in variety and quality with the many other food vendors that will be at these events.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Leo; esta palabra puede ser interpretada bajo muchos conceptos, como leones, o en este caso leonas, también es conocido como un signo zodiacal, el mas fuerte del zodiaco, y muchos otros significados mas, pero según las socias, estos dos conceptos encajan en la personalidad de cada una de ellas. 16 mujeres integran esta sociedad, desde hace mas de 6 años, siendo una de las asociaciones destacadas y constantes.

En su mayoría sus integrantes están dedicadas a la preparación y venta de comida en distintas modalidades, algunas se dedican a la preparación de comida rápida, otras a la preparación de platos mas sofisticados de la gastronomía nacional, y otros se dedican a la atención de almuerzos en pensiones y restaurantes de la zona.

Su principal preocupación es la demanda que existirá en aquellas entradas folklóricas a realizarse en las fiestas de carnaval, puesto que la afluencia de gente a estos eventos es masivo y generalmente son consumidores potenciales por la duración misma de los eventos. Por tal motivo ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de sus insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus puestos, de esta manera poder competir con variedad y calidad ante los muchos otros negocios de comida que existirán para esas fechas.

loans.use: Purchase of needed ingredients to compete for food sales at upcoming holiday events

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.es:
More than five years ago, a friend of María Guadalupe invited her to a seminar for selling beauty products from a catalog. The commission was attractive to Maria because it was offered on each products, and also because her husband's earnings weren't enough to pay for the expenses of the household and their two children in school. That's how she got interested in and started selling these products. Currently she is in charge of other saleswomen. She receives additional commissions through the sales that they make as well.

Nevertheless, she does not currently have enough merchandise, and what she has is out of season. That's why she is requesting a loan for $925 that she will be able to repay in six months. With this money, María will be able to buy in-season merchandise to sell to her customers. With your help, María will be able to get her two children ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hace más de 5 años, una amiga de María Guadalupe la invitó a una plática para vender productos de belleza por catálogo, y a María le pareció atractiva la comisión que ofrecen por cada producto, además que con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa y sus dos hijos a quienes tiene estudiando. Fue así como se interesó y comenzó a vender estos productos. Actualmente ya tiene a su cargo más vendedoras. Esto porque recibe más comisiones por las ventas de sus vendedoras.

Sin embargo Actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía. Y la que tiene no es de la temporada. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía de la temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the new season

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las Divinas , or The Divine Ladies, is the name of this Community Association in Villa Tejada, and for more than a year and a half they have worked constantly to make their businesses prosper.

They are a total of seventeen women whose occupations vary from creating fine artwork to selling vegetables and running grocery stores to running a hostel and preparing fast food.

All these activities demand great sacrifice on the part of these businesswomen, given that their income and earnings are minimal throughout the year, and they must take advantage of those parties that bring in large crowds. For example, the parties of Carnaval bring in many consumers as well as tourism, which in the case of the businesswoman who runs a hostel represents a big opportunity to bring in income that will keep her business afloat.

Unfortunately, the competition in this field does not allow our associate to earn enough to be able to invest in improving and remodeling her hostel, much less to be able to expand the facility and be able to bring her guests greater comfort.

For this reason, these businesswomen need cash to invest in their businesses so that they can compete in the market that will be created by the Carnaval parties and other parties throughout the year.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Las Divinas, ese es el nombre de la Asociación Comunal de Villa Tejada, que hace más de un año y medio trabajan constantemente con el fin de prosperar con sus negocios.

Un total de 17 mujeres cuya ocupación varía, desde la elaboración de artesanías, pasando por la venta de verduras, tiendas de abarrotes, hasta la atención de un hostal y preparación de comida rápida.

Todas estas actividades demandan gran sacrificio de parte de estas socias, puesto que sus ingresos y ganancias son mínimas durante el año, y deben aprovechar aquellas fiestas que mueven grandes masas. Por ejemplo las fiestas de carnaval generan gran movimiento consumista, y al mismo tiempo generan turismo, lo que en el caso de la socia que posee su hostal representa una gran oportunidad para generar ingresos importantes para mantener vivo su negocio.

Lastimosamente la competitividad en el rubro no permite que nuestra socia genere los recursos necesarios por no poder invertir en mejoras y refacciones a su hostal, menos en la posibilidad de ampliación de infraestructura, mucho menos en gastos que generen mayor comodidad a sus huéspedes.

Por tal motivo, las socias precisan de capital para poder invertir en sus negocios y de esta manera competir dentro del mercado que se va a generar en las fiestas de carnavales y otras que se dan durante el año.

loans.use: Invest in their business for the high season during the parties of Carnaval

loans.name: Juliana Dorotea

texts.es:
Juliana E. is a struggling, hard-working woman. She fulfills her role selling groceries and general merchandise in the Chinandega market. Thirty-two years ago, she couldn’t find work anywhere due to the difficult economic situation, and she decided to invest her meager savings in purchasing general goods to sell them.

Her work is very rough since, although she lives in Chinandega, her business is very far from her home. So every day she has to start very early waiting for a bus that will take her to the market where she has her business.

All her efforts are for the benefit of her family, as she is a wife and mother of one small boy.

For three years she has been a loyal client of CEPRODEL, earning loans that she has used to stock more products, in this way helping care for her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juliana E. es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes y productos de pulpería en el mercado de Chinandega. Desde hace 32 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que vive en Chinandega, su negocio está muy alejado de su hogar por lo que desde muy temprano todos los días espera un bus que lo lleve al mercado donde tiene su negocio. Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único propósito de mantener a su familia ya que es esposa y madre de un hijo pequeño.

Desde hace 3 años ha sido una fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir más sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
For the last seventeen years, Maria Lourdes has dedicated herself to selling clothing in a stairwell in the Bisne Market of Chinandega. She began her business selling small quantities of her products, but through the years, she has gone on to acquire greater quantities for sale.

She began her business due to the need her family found itself in for a long time; her husband’s income did not suffice to cover the household expenses, which is why she decided to invest in this business. As the years went by, three children her born, and her responsibility blossomed, since it was necessary to work harder to maintain her humble home.

CEPRODEL has been her unconditional support these last three years, providing her a total of 20 credits that have been used for acquiring her products as well as sustaining her household.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Lourdes desde hace 17 años se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa en un tramo del mercado Bisne de Chinandega. Su negocio lo inició vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades sus productos pero por medio de los años ha venido adquiriendo mas cantidades para su debida comercialización.

El negocio lo comienza por la necesidad que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado su familia, el cual los ingresos de su esposo no daban abasto para los gastos del hogar, es por esto que decide invertir en este negocio. Con el paso de los años, nacieron sus tres hijos y su responsabilidad proliferó ya que le es necesario trabajar mas fuertemente para mantener su humilde hogar.

Su apoyo incondicional ha sido Ceprodel desde hace 3 años atrás brindándole un total de 20 créditos utilizados para la adquisición de sus productos y a la vez para el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
It is very important to note that 40 years ago Mrs. Carmen A. decided to invest her small savings that she was able to accumulate with hard work and effort, into the purchase of meat for resale.

For a long time Mrs. A. has been going through financial difficulties but continued her business of selling meat to be able to support her family. She has been able to slowly improve this business. She is turning to Ceprodel requesting a loan that will enable her to improve her financial position and living conditions. She currently needs to purchase meat to resell.

She has a history of three loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Es de mucha importancia señalar que desde hace 40 años la Sra. Carmen A. decide invertir su pequeño ahorro que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logra reunir y decide invertirlo en la compra de carne.

Por mucho tiempo la señora A. ha atravesado dificultades económicas pero muy positivamente ha continuado en el negocio de la venta de carne porque tiene el deber de mantener su núcleo familiar. Este negocio lo ha logrado mejorar lentamente y por esta causa es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y un mejor nivel de vida. Actualmente su necesidad es la adquisición de la carne para comercializarla.

Su record es de 3 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of meat.

loans.name: Isabel De La Concepc

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel A.'s destiny changed after she los the job that was able to sustain her three kids in the city of Chinandega. For this reason, she's been selling a wide variety of refreshing drinks from her home. She lives in the city of Chinandega.

One of her goals is to establish herself in the local market since the room in her house is not practical for this kind of business. Her house is far away from the main streets and its difficult for people to notice her business.

With CEPRODEL's financial support, she's been able to increase her business. This allows her to have a wide variety of beverages to offer and at the same time cover some of her home daily expenses. She's had a total of 25 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Isabel A. por infortunios del destino pierde su empleo con el que mantenía a sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Por esta razón desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad de venta de refrescos variados en su casa de habitación den la ciudad de Chinandega.

Una de sus metas es establecerse en un local en el mercado ya que actualmente su casa de habitación no presta las condiciones por el hecho de que se encuentra alejada de las calles principales de esta ciudad.

Con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio, lo que le permite ofrecer mayor variedad de refrescos a sus clientes y de esta manera incide en los gastos del hogar. Su record crediticio es de 25 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits to make drinks

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina R.'s business is the sale of whole grains and grocery products in the Chinandega market. She is a single woman, and her responsibilities include covering her household expenses and looking after her elderly parents. She has passed through difficult economic situations since she started selling her products in this location.

This woman faces urgent needs to purchase whole grains and other products, and to do this, she takes out small loans from Ceprodel. This helps to make her dreams of being a better salesperson and of bringing high-quality goods to her customers a reality. Her record includes 30 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la dama Dina R. es a la venta de granos básicos y productos de abarrotarías en el mercado de Chinandega. Es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar y velar por sus padres que son mayores de edad. La difícil situación económica que atraviesa hace que incursione al mercado de la venta de granos básicos y abarrotarías en esta localidad.

La necesidad que atraviesa esta dama es la urgencia de la compra de los granos básicos y demás productos y para esto realiza pequeños prestamos en Ceprodel para así ver realizado su sueño de ser una mejor comerciante y seguir brindando productos de alta calidad a todos sus clientes. Su record es de 30 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and whole grains

loans.name: Paula Demencia

texts.es:
For the last thirteen years, Mrs. Paula M. has dedicated herself to selling all sorts of products in the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She devotes herself to this business so she can keep her son in school, and in so doing, help support her husband in the upkeep of the household, which is of course of limited resources.

Before dedicating herself to this business, she busied herself as a housekeeper, but due to the low income in their economy, she and her husband decided to invest in products for a general store and sell them. She has worked with Ceprodel, which has granted her great opportunities to improve her business. Through these credits, she has acquired a larger sales volume, which has benefited her store, but above all, the support of her son. Her greatest need is currently the acquisition of more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Paula M. se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos desde hace 13 años en la ciudad de Chinandega de Nicaragua. Se dedica a este negocio para poder mantener a su hijo en sus estudios y de esta forma apoya a su esposo para mantener su hogar que por cierto es de muy bajos recursos.

Antes de dedicarse a este negocio se ocupaba en la labor de ama de casa pero al percibir bajos ingresos en su economía decide invertir junto con su esposo para comprar los productos de pulpería y venderlos. Ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos créditos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de su hijo. Su mayor necesidad actualmente es la adquisición de los productos para comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Ccenhuancucho Group

texts.en:
“Las Estrellas de Ccenhuacucho” is a rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides credit and education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica and Ayacucho.

BCR “Las Estrellas de Ccenhuacucho” is located in the small community of Ccenhuacucho in the province of Huamanga, Ayacucho, at the border of a small river and on the main paved road of Ayacucho to Peru´s capital, L.. The little village is known for one particular thing: trout-fishing. The village has a big trout-farm with more than 50 big basins to grow the trout to an “eatable-size”. Along the main road, most of the population (which consists of only 20 families), have a small restaurant where you can eat grilled or fried trout. People traveling from L. to Ayacucho (over 8 hours) stop over on their way to rest a little and eat fish. Also, day-tourists from Ayacucho travel over one hour to eat the trout.

Currently, the bank has completed its first loan-cycle after half a year of existence and all 15 female borrowers paid back their loans punctually throughout the whole 6 month cycle. All the members are wearing their reward for paying back on time: a T-shirt from FINCA Peru!

The members of the bank during their first half year with FINCA Peru, besides having learned to be responsible and punctual, have also learned to respect each other and to help other members of the group when they face some kind of difficulty. Another important fact is that the members of the “board of directors” have learned how to manage their bank, assuming responsibilities they never assumed before in their life.

The group was able to save over 1,800 soles (about 600 US$) in the first loan-cycle and will continue to save in the future; following the first loan-cycle most members have kept their savings within their community bank, with the hope of saving more. For all members, the main use of the savings is for investing in their business or for the education of their children. The money is used to buy school uniforms, supplies, books and even to pay for entering primary or secondary school. Another dream they have for their savings is to be able to make renovations to their small restaurants or kiosks.

The loans range from 200 soles, 400 soles and up to 600 soles. The total of the loans adds up to 5,000 soles among the 15 members. Although many dedicate their time to the same business, every member has a different testimony….. As is the case of Bertha T. P.. Bertha has 2 businesses: a small grocery-store and the trout-restaurant she has run for over 10 years. But, with her 200 soles loan she will buy new supplies such as soft-drinks, beer, sweets and toilet paper for her grocery-store. When asked about her future, she says that everything she earns and saves is for the education of her children so they can be professionals and keep studying.

Jacinta H. G. is one of the few members that does not dedicate her business to trout. She sells vegetables and fruits in local weekly markets and has a small grocery-store. She will use her 400 soles loan to buy new products for both businesses. She continues to build up her savings for the future.

loans.use: Raising Fish

loans.name: Rocio's Group

texts.en:
Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam have been part of the community bank “Magnolia” for eight months, three years, and one year respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual, develop their business, and to avoid sickness. They mentioned that they like the solidarity they find in the community bank.

Marivel is 24 years old. She is a single mother and has a nine-year-old daughter. Marivel sells “raspadillas” which are similar to snow cones. She has had a stand in the “Americas Market”, for one year. In addition, in her free time Marivel does laundry.

Rocio is 34 years old. She lives with her partner and twelve year old son. For years Rocio has been selling cosmetics products to her friends and family. She also sells clothing to friends and businesses.

Miriam is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and six year old daughter. Miriam travels to the jungle eight hours from Ayacucho and sells potatoes, and grains. There she buys fruits, which she sells in Ayacucho.

Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam need loans of 200, 600, and 600 soles, (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying clothing, potatoes, peas, wheat, barley, fruit, and to fix the tires on their cart.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each member has. Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are that their children will be professionals, their businesses will continue to grow, and they will own their own homes.

loans.use: Marivel, Rocio, and Miriam need loans of 200, 600, and 600 soles, (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying clothing, potatoes, peas, wheat, barley, fruit, and to fix the tires on their cart.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Celina, Victoria, and Lucila have been members of the community bank “Suni” for one year, ten years, and five years respectively. In that time they have learned important life values and how to manage their businesses more effectively.

Celina is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has two children. Celina sells beverages on one of the main streets of Ayacucho. She has been renting a building there for six months. Previously, Celina sold clothing at the market in the city of Tambo, which is two hours away. With her new business she is very happy to not have to work so far from her home.

Victoria is 72 years old. She is married and has ten children who are now adults. Victoria has a small store where she sells food staples such as flour, sugar, and beans. She also sells fruits and vegetables.

Lucila is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Lucila sells a variety of drinks from a store located at her in-law’s house. She has been running this business for three years.

Celina, Victoria, and Lucila need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy soft drinks, beer, barley, peas, wheat, rice, and sugar.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Celina, Victoria, and Lucila plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education, to build a home, and in the future. Their dreams are to have steady jobs, economic stability, and that their children will become professionals.

loans.use: Celina, Victoria, and Lucila need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy soft drinks, beer, barley, peas, wheat, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Mr. Donald F. sells produce. At first, he sold them around the streets of Chinandega. As time went by, he decided to get a loan in order to build his own stand. He's been at this same spot for 15 years.

Donald F. tells us that thanks to CEPRODEL, he's been able to improve his lifestyle and his economic situation.

His local stand is not in the best conditions, there are no walls but he doesn't lose hope of one day being able to improve his situation.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Donald F. se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras. En un inicio oferta sus productos ambulante en la ciudad de Chinandega. En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para instalar su negocio en un local propio en el mercado Bisne el cual le fue otorgado y aquí se encuentra ubicado hasta ahora desde hace 15 años.

Donald F. comenta que el aporte económico que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido decisivo en el desarrollo de su actividad ya que le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida y sobre todo ha mejorado la difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado su familia.

Actualmente su local no tiene buenas condiciones el y no hay paredes pero no pierde la esperanza en que algún día mejorara estas condiciones.

loans.use: Purchase of produce and improve her business

loans.name: Karla Del Rosario

texts.es:
Karla H., or Karlita, is a woman devoted to her small grocery store in the department of Chinandega. For the last two years, she has had her own store, earned through her own savings and through the support of her husband.

The business began with very few products, but as the years went by, she has stocked her shelves with new products that people demand. Very intelligently, Karlita has turned to Ceprodel, who has granted her loans that she has known to pay on time and in agreement with her terms. That's why, with her greatest need being once again the purchase of these goods, she will this time trust in Ceprodel to support her and her business in getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karla H. conocida como Karlita es una dama que se dedica al negocio de pulpería en el departamento de Chinandega teniendo su propio negocio obtenido por sus ahorros propios y el apoyo de su esposo desde hace 2 años.

El negocio nace con pocos productos pero a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha surtido su estante de nuevos productos demandados por la población. Muy inteligentemente la señora Karlita ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha sabido pagar en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido, es por esta razón que su mayor necesidad es una vez mas la compra de estos productos pero esta vez confía en que Ceprodel la apoyará para salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Teofila's Group

texts.en:
Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila have been part of the community bank “Magnolia” for almost one year. In that time they have learned how to manage their finances, to treat clients properly, to stay healthy, and to feed their children a balanced diet. Jeanett is 26 years old with a three year old daughter. Jeanett and her husband own a bakery where she makes fortified bread for the school breakfast program. She formerly worked in another bakery where she was able to learn about the business and eventually to open her own.

Juana is 28 years old with two children. Four months ago Juana was able to open her own stand where she sells vegetable in the Americas Market. In her free time, Juana also bakes and sells cookies.

Teofila is 47 years old and is married with four children. She buys various cheeses from different markets around the region of Ayacucho and for the past several years has been selling them around her neighborhood.

Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will use towards buying flour, butter, squash, onions, and cheeses. One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest that each woman will earn from her savings account. Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila plan to use their savings to pay their children’s school fees. They dream to own their land, continue developing their businesses, and that their children will become educated and successful. These loans could significantly help them towards reaching these dreams.

loans.use: Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flour, butter, squash, onions, and cheeses.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Primitiva, Felicitas and Ruth have been part of the community bank “Suni” for between one and two years. In that time they have learned to be punctual and responsible, how to educate their children, avoid sickness, and to feed their children a healthy balanced diet. Primitiva is 52 years old, married, and has five children. Primitiva, together with her husband, buys cattle in the town of Huancasancos. Later she sells them in the city of Ayacucho. Primitiva raises other livestock in the village of Socos. She has a farm there where she grows a variety of grains. She then sells all of her products from the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho.

Felicitas grows vegetables in her farm located in the Chacco Valley near Ayacucho. She sells her produce in the Nery Garcia market. In addition, two months ago Felicitas opened a small store selling food staples such as flour, sugar, and butter.

Ruth is 23 years old. She is married and has one son. Ruth raises pigs from her house outsiD. of Ayacucho. She then sells them to a family member who owns a butcher shop.

Primitiva, Felicitas and Ruth need loans of 600, 1000, and 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pigs and sheep as well as lettuce, spinach, cilantro, and feed for their animals.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Primitiva, Felicitas and Ruth plan to use their savings to build a home and increase the capital available to their businesses. Their dreams are to continue developing their businesses, own a home, buy land, and give their children everything they need.

loans.use: Primitiva, Felicitas and Ruth need loans of 600, 1000, and 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pigs and sheep as well as lettuce, spinach, cilantro, and feed for their animals.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
"I have a business where I sell various goods, such as baseball caps, purses, belts, backpacks, and beauty products, and a few other things. I'd like to invest in purchasing merchandise to bring my customers different items, but I don't have the money for the investment. I am asking for $1200 to invest in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una negocio D. venta D. artículos varios, como cachuchas, bolsas, cintos, mochilas y productos D. belleza; así como algunas cosas más, me gustaría invertir en L. compra D. mercancía para traer a mis clientes artículos diferentes pero me hace falta algo D. dinero para L. inversión”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in my business

loans.name: Zuleyka Patricia

texts.es:
Zuleyka Patricia Alvarez Torres has been selling make-up for about a year in the local Chichigalpa market. She was a housewife for many years but, due to economic reasons, she decided to invest some of her savings and sell make up. Her current need at this moment is to purchase merchandise for her business.

Zuleyka, aware of her investment needs, goes to CEPRODEL in order to receive the credit that will allow her business to grow. For this reason, since her business began, she's been able to get 3 loans that wil allow her broaden her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Zuleyka Patricia

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nanik

texts.id:
In 1990, Nanik started her business by selling “rujak” (Indonesian fruit salad). After observing the promising future of a hot food kiosk, she started to sell rice dishes. Her initial regular was her neighbor who lives in the Sidakarya area. Her daily profit can reach $10. Nanik is borrowing $100 loan to buy supplies for her kiosk. Nanik and her husband no longer have to support their two children because they are married. Also, her husband earns $120 a month, which covers their monthly household expenses. However, she needs to help with their monthly rent and their future savings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Pada awal usahanya di tahun 1990 Nanik menjual rujak. Setelah melihat prospek yang menjanjikan dari warung makanan dia mulai menjual nasi. Langganannya adalah tetangganya yang tinggal di jalan Mertasari, Sidakarya. Keuntungan per hari dari usahanya ini mencapai Rp 100.000,00. Nanik meminjam uang sebesar Rp 700.000,00 untuk lebih melengkapi warungnya. Nanik dan suaminya sudah tidak memiliki tanggungan. Kedua anaknya sudah menikah. Selain itu untuk keperluan rumah tangga penghasilan dari suami sudah mencukupi. Suaminya memiliki pekerjaan yang bagus dengan penghasilan Rp 1.200.000,00 per bulan. Namun, dia juga harus memikirkan tentang biaya kontrak rumah dan masa depan mereka berdua.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the kiosk

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.id:
David sells young coconut drinks at the Kerobokan Primary School in the morning, and at the Thomas Aquino School in the evening throughout the school year with the help of his scooter. He makes $10 daily in profits. In Bali, he spends $2 a day and rents a room with a monthly rent of $22.50. He supports his wife, who lives in Java with their grandchild. He will use the loan to expand his business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

David berjualan es kelapa muda di Sekolah Dasar (SD) I Kerobokan pada pagi hari dan di Sekolah Thomas Aquino pada sore harinya. Hal itu dia lakukan setiap hari, selama hari – hari sekolah berlangsung. Dalam melakukan pekerjaannya sarana transportasi yang digunakan adalah sepeda motor. Per hari dia memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp 100.000,00. Modal yang dia peroleh akan dia pakai untuk menambah omzet penjualannya. Tanggungannya adalah seorang isteri yang tinggal di Jawa bersama cucu. Di Bali dia menyewa sebuah kamar dengan biaya Rp 225.000,00 per bulan dengan biaya hidup per harinya Rp 20.000,00.

loans.use: To increase selling turnover

loans.name: Murod

texts.en:
M. Murod is 31 years old. He is married and has three adorable kids. Murod’s wife is not working and is taking care of the kids.

Murod has very large family. In addition to his wife and kids he also supports his mother and brothers and sisters. To be able to do it, Murod has his business. He sells perfumes for women and men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and tooth brushes. All the goods are supplied form Almaty, Kazakhstan.

Murod has been a client of IMON since September 2006 and has no violations or delinquencies in payment of the loans. Today Murod requests 500.00 US Dollars which he is planning to use to expand his business and increase his capital. After receiving of large income Murod intents to arrange a wedding for his sister and pay for the education of his brother. Murod would like to thank all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in 4 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for increasing the range of goods and for the income from business to arrange the wedding for the sister and to pay for the education of the brother.

loans.name: Nurul

texts.id:
Nurul goes around her neighborhood to look for helpers to work in her fabric combing business, which she and her husband started. Her husband applies batik prints on the fabric, while Nurul applies the combing onto the sides of the fabrics. They can finish 100 pieces of fabrics per week with a 3-cent profit per piece. The $125 loan she hopes to receive will be used as initial capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Nurul berkeliling ke tetangganya untuk bekerjasama dalam usaha Sisir Kain-nya. Tetangganya merupakan pegawai yang membantunya menyisir kain. Usaha ini dia lakukan bekerjasama dengan suaminya. Suaminya bertugas memberikan motif batik ke atas permukaan kain. Sedangkan Nurul yang memberikan sisiran pada tepi – tepi kain yang diperlukan. Setiap kali pesanan mereka bisa mengerjakan 100 potong kain/ minggunya. Dia mengambil untung Rp 250,00 per kainnya. Modal Rp 1.000.000,00 yang ia peroleh akan dia gunakan untuk modal awal.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
E. Muhabbat is 39 years old. She is married with two children that are currently in school.

For the last 9 years, Muhabat has sold jewelry in the local market. She started her business having only 300.00 dollars from a loan. Gradually, her business expanded and currently Muhabbat has earned 3000.00 dollars from work. Muhabbat has sold jewelry of the oriental style. The national earrings, rings and bracelets are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan. Every woman has at least one set of jewelry probably inherited from her grandmother. Muhabbat has a lot of clients and her business is rather successful and generates the stable income for the family.

Today, Muhabbat requests 700.00 dollars for the 4 month term. She is going to purchase new items of jewelry for increasing the range of goods for selling. Being the client of IMON for several years already, Muhabbat has demonstrated herself as an accurate and reliable client. She thanks you for all your support and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of new items of jewelry for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Donier

texts.en:
A. Donier is 31 years old. He is married with two children. Except for his children and wife, the housekeeper, Donier is also supporting his parents.

Donier videotapes wedding parties and other family occasions. He has been in this business for about 15 years already. Donier tries to be creative about his job and when shooting the event and preparing the tape, as if he is making a cinema. In the neighborhood Donier is known as a very hard-working and diligent operator. He has many clients that make the business successful and brings stable income to the large family.

Today Donier requests 1 450.00 Somoni (425 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Donier is planning to purchase a computer for his business. This is Donier's first loan and he would like to assure everyone supporting him the he shall pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing  of computer

loans.name: Tulibako

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela, Tanzania! This is 34 year old Tulibako M.. She is married with three children, aged 16, 13, and 10.

In 2002, Tulibako established a hardware business. Tulibako has already successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy hardware appliances. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To buy hardware appliances in bulk

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
K. Firuz is 33 years old. He is married with two children.

Firuz has a shop where he repairs jewelry and also makes jewelry such as earrings, rings, and bracelets of the oriental style. He has been in business for more than 15 years. Mr. K.'s business is quite stable and generates considerable income for his family.

Firuz is going to purchase the equipment required for producing jewelry items of the oriental style. For this purpose he has requested 2 000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) which he will repay over 6 months. This is Firuz's first loan and he would like to thank everyone for thier trust and support and he promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing jewelry supplies

loans.name: Najmi

texts.en:
Z. Najmi is 53 years old. She and her husband raised two children who are already married and living independently.

For more than 15 years Najmi has been selling the jewelry. Najmi is selling oriental style jewelry items. The earrings are very beautiful. People trust Najmi as she is very honest when assessing the prices and quality.

Najmi has been working with IMON for more than 7 years. She has proved herself as an honest and reliable borrower. She wants this loan of $500 to expand her business. She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new items of jewelry of the national style.

loans.name: Kireka A3(I) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Lukiya N..  She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to increase her stock.  Lukiya is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver.  She has 10 children ranging from age 15 to 30 and her children go to school.  Each week, Lukiya makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education.  Lukiya has previously taken a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 700,000 in order to invest in the charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.  Lukiya is joined in her small group by Sauya N., Hasifah K., Margret N., and Teopista Natambi.  Sauya N. currently runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more items for the shop.  Hasifah K. also runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to increase her stock.  Margret N. currently runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more salon equipment. Teopista Natambi is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to start selling firewood.

loans.use: Expand charcoal business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Dorothy S..  She is currently in the business of Poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to  build a poultry house.  Dorothy is 49 years old and is a widow.    She has 5 children ranging from age 14 to 31 and her children go to school.  Each week, Dorothy makes approximately UGX 170,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to pay school fees for her daughter.  She has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda previously in the amount of UGX 350,000 in order to invest in the poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.  She is joined in her small group by Jane N., Joyce N., Jane N., and Joweria K..  Jane N. is currently in the business of fried edibles and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to  buy a charcoal stove.  Joyce N. is currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to  buy more stock.  Jane N. is currently in the business of selling juice and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to  buy a fridge.  Joweria K. is currently in the business of cloth selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to  buy more clothes.

loans.use: To build a poultry house

loans.name: Kireka A3(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N..  She is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 800000 to increase the stock in the business.  Rose is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a doctor.  She has 5 children ranging from age 6 to 16 and her children go to school.  Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education.  Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the matooke business and the loan was paid back on time.  Rose is joined in her small group by Florence N., Solome M., Jane N., and Margret N..  

Florence N. is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand the business.  Solome M. is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more matooke for sale.  Jane N. is also requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to re-invest in the business.  Margret N. is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more food supplies.

loans.use: To re-invest in the food business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mambo Kwisha Group

texts.en:
Clients are appreciating our services because of the funding you provide. I am writing this to deliver a message from Betty N., the Chairperson of Mambo Kwisha Group, Ndeeba, who had failed before at joining the group, but now nothing can stop her from prosperity. She has been running a restaurant business for 2 years preparing all sorts of dishes: matooke (local term for unripened bananas), rice, posho, Irish potatoes, and sweet potatoes. She is a widow of 48 years with 5 children and cares for 3 relatives. Her dream is to finish the construction of her business premises just next to her home to reduce transport and renting costs. She has also managed to pay school fees for her children and now 2 have enrolled as teachers and have secured jobs, while the rest are still in high school.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Betty Namyalo’s dream is to finish the construction of her business premises just next to her home to reduce transport and renting costs.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N.. She runs a small retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy more items. Rose is 32 years old and married; her husband is a businessman. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 60,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400,000 to expand business and paid back the loan on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Samalie N., Jane K., Grace S., and Suzan S.. Samalie N. cooks and sells food and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more food. Jane K. sells tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to buy a truck. Grace S. rears poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to build a poultry house. Suzan S. sells clothes and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Kireka A3(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose Mary B.. She runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to increase her stock. Rose is 49 years old and married to a doctor. She has 6 children ranging in age from 24 to 37 and her children go to school. loans.name: Redi Dwi M.s

texts.id:
Redi sells VCD’s at the Anyar market to support himself and his school-aged younger sibling. He needs additional capital to open similar business at a different location. He will be very grateful to receive the loan from DINARI. He will use the loan to buy selling supplies and VCD inventory. He is hoping that his business explansion plan will allow him to have enough money to save, and set him up for a better future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Redi adalah penjual VCD dipasar Anyar, usaha ini dia jalani untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya setiaphari dan membantu adiknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah. Untuk meningkatkan pendapatannya dalam berusaha Redi membutuhkan modal untuk membuka usaha yang sama ditempat lain, dan dia sendiri sangat senang ketika mendapatkan bantuan permodalan yang diberikan oleh DINARI. Modal tersebut nantinya akan dibelikan sarana untuk berjualan dan VCD yang baru tentunya. Dia berharap lewat pengembangan usahanya ini dia dapat menabung dan mempersiapkan hari depan dengan perekonomian yang lebih baik.

loans.use: To buy kiosk supplies and VCD inventory

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Fátima M., 47, was born in Maputo, Mozambique, where she lived for 24 years with her husband and three children. When her husband died, she moved to Boane-Marcone, where she started a small food stand as a way to provide for her family. She joined the Hluvuku-Adsema credit program in 2007, after hearing about it from a neighbor. Now on her third loan cycle, Fátima is applying for $525 to buy construction material to finish building her house. Her future plans include improving her food stand and starting a poultry raising business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Marcone Cliente: Fátima M. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo:12.000.00mt ( 508usd) Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 28-01-08 Fim:22-05-09 Fátima M., nasceu em Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade , viúva e mãe de 3 filhos . Cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais e estudou ate a 3ª classe devido a falta de condições financeiras pois o pai e deficiente fisico e foi sempre desempregado. Casou se em 1979 e viveu com o seu marido durante 24 anos data em que perdeu a vida , dai viu se obrigada a mudar-se de cidade de Maputo para Boane-Marcone onde começou a dedicar se a pequenos negócios como forma de sustentar a sua família. Através da sua vizinha soube da existência da HLUVUKU dai aproximou se e pediu o seu primeiro empréstimo em 2007 o segundo também no mesmo ano e pagou sem dificuldades. Com o empréstimo de 12.000.00mt pretende concluir a sua obra. Tem como perspectivas para o futuro ampliar a sua barraca para meter mais produtos e pretende tambem criar frangos mais tarde.

loans.use: To buy construction material to finish building her house

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nine years ago, Sonia began selling chickens along with her ex-boyfriend in the Universal de Vitarte market. With the earnings she made from that business and from EDAPROSPO, she has opened a restaurant selling Chinese and chifa (Peruvian-Cantonese) food for which she hired her cousins. Now that she’s single, Sonia splits her time between her market stall in the mornings and her restaurant in the evenings to be able to provide the best for her two young children. Today, Sonia’s goal is to complete the purchase of her market stall and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hace nueve años, Sonia comenzó a vender pollos junto a su ex pareja en el mercado Universal de Vitarte. Gracias a los ingresos que ha recibido del negocio y de EDAPROSPO, ha abierto un restaurante de comida china, chifa, en el que da trabajo a sus primos. Al estar sola, Sonia reparte su tiempo entre la atención de su puesto en el mercado en las mañanas y en las tardes de su chifa; a fin de poderles brindar lo mejor a sus dos menores hijos. Hoy, la meta de Sonia es cerrar la compra de su puesto del mercado y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a market stall.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has always been a very hard-working woman. She used to work selling items for the kitchen in the street. But when her daughter became ill, she had to look for a business that would provide her with more income. It was then that she began to work in the embroidery business.

Starting the business wasn't easy because she didn't have the necessary machines to do the work. However, with the help of her husband and children, she was able to collect enough money to buy her own machine last June and has been working in embroidery ever since.

This business not only has allowed Mercedes to improve her economic situation, but it has also generated work for 6 young people.

Mercedes would like to grow her business even more and buy another embroidery machine.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora. Ha trabajado vendiendo artículos de cocina en la calle, pero cuando su hija se enfermó, tuvo que buscar un negocio que le generara más ingresos. Fue ahí donde comenzó en el negocio de los bordados. El inicio no fue fácil, porque no tenía las máquinas para realizar estos trabajos, sin embargo, con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos, pudo juntar un capital para comprar su propia máquina con la que está trabajando desde junio del año pasado. Este negocio no solo brinda una mejora económica para Mercedes, sino que también ha generado puestos de trabajo para 6 jóvenes. Mercedes desearía crecer más y comprar otra máquina de bordados.

loans.use: Purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita began selling cakes and jellies from the door of her house. Gradually, her business began to grow and she converted it into a store. Nevertheless, her desire to work and get ahead motivated her to sell chicken soup and “picarones” (a dessert) at night in her neighborhood and sell “causa” (a typical Lima dish) at the gate of the National Stadium on the weekends. Thanks to her efforts, Margarita has been able to get her seven children ahead and improve their living situation. In addition, she has been able to help her sister, Delfina, take care of her two children since her husband became ill. As the start high school classes approaches, Margarita would like to take advantage of this opportunity to sell school supplies. For this, she estimates that she needs 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita comenzó vendiendo kekes y gelatinas en la puerta de su casa; de a pocos su negocio fue creciendo y se convirtió en una tienda. Sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, hicieron que vendiera por las noches caldo de gallina y picarones (dulce limeño) en su barrio y los fines de semana, causa (platillo típico limeño) en la puerta del Estadio Nacional. Gracias a su empeño, Margarita ha podido sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos y mejorar su vivienda. Además, ha podido ayudar a su hermana Delfina a cuidar a sus 2 hijos, pues su esposo se encuentra mal de salud. Al acercarse el inicio de clases en los colegios, Margarita quisiera aprovechar esta oportunidad para vender artículos escolares. Para ello estima que necesita 500 soles.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata had to find a way to support her two small children when her husband died 30 years ago. She started working at a stand at the market but had to leave it because she could not take care of her children. Hence, the idea to set up a small store out of her home was born.

Thanks to this business she has been able to provide a good education for her children and to build a house that was previously made of adobe.

Now that her children are grown, Fortunata works to support herself and to pay her household expenses. This is the reason she needs the loan to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando falleció su esposo hace 30 años, Fortunata tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus dos pequeños hijos. Comenzó a trabajar en un puesto del mercado, pero lo dejó al no poder cuidar a sus hijos. Fue así como nació la idea de poner una tienda en casa.

Gracias a este negocio, pudo darles una buena educación a sus hijos y construir su casa que antes era de adobe.

Ahora que sus hijos están grandes, Fortunata trabaja para poder mantenerse y pagar los gastos de la casa. Es por esto que desea surtir más su tienda.

loans.use: Expand and stock her store

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Mr. M. opened a bookstore when he retired from the stove manufacturing company he worked at. He has owned his bookstore for over 22 years and thanks to it he has been able to purchase the premises where his business is at and a house nearby. Additionally, he has been able to provide a good education for his four children, who now help him at the bookstore.

Mr. M. has been working with EDAPROSO for the past 7 years. Thanks to the loan he received he was able to buy his first photocopier. He currently has 2.

Mr. M. now wishes to expand his bookstore, he needs 1000 soles ($350) to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Al retirarse de la empresa de fabricación de cocinas donde laboraba, el señor Félix abrió una librería. Ya lleva más de 22 años con este negocio que le permitió comprar el local donde trabaja y una casa cerca de ahí. Además de poder brindarle una buena educación a sus cuatro hijos quienes hoy lo ayudan en la librería.

Desde hace 7 años, Félix trabaja con EDAPROSPO, y gracias al financiamiento que recibió pudo comprar su primera fotocopiadora. Hoy tiene 2.

Félix desearía ampliar su librería para lo que necesitaría 1000 soles.

loans.use: Expand his bookstore

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Twenty-six years ago, Jacinta came from Lima in search of a better future. She has always liked to work, so she wasn't embarrassed to go out selling candy in the street. She passed on this spirit to other women, with whom she later started selling candies as a microbusiness.

With good capital, she opened a vegetable stand in a market, which she later moved to the entrance of her house to alleviate the costs of renting. Jacinta's imagination for business doesn't have limits; she has opened a mini-market in her home. Thanks to the income she receives, she helps her husband, a cabinet maker, educate their four children.

With the support of EDAPROSPO's financing, Jacinta has opened an Internet cafe for one of her daughters.

Jacinta hopes to move the Internet workstations to a more central zone.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 26 años, Jacinta vino desde la sierra a Lima en busca de un mejor futuro. Siempre le gustó trabajar, por lo que no tuvo vergüenza al salir a vender caramelos en la calle. Este espíritu lo transmitió a otras mujeres con quienes, tiempo después, comenzó a vender golosinas como una micro empresa.

Con un buen capital, abrió un puesto de verduras en el mercado, que luego pasaría a la puerta de su casa al elevarse los precios del alquiler. La imaginación de Jacinta para los negocios no tiene límites, por lo que abrió un mini mercado en su casa. Gracias a los ingresos que recibe ayuda a su esposo ebanista a educar a sus cuatro hijos.

Con el apoyo del financiamiento de EDAPROSPO, Jacinta le ha abierto a una de sus hijas un negocio de internet.

Jacinta desearía trasladar las cabinas a un local en una zona más céntrica.

loans.use: To rent a new location for her Internet workstations

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
For the past 10 months Virginia has been working in her own business offering photocopying and document typing services. Thanks to this business she is able to pay for her schooling as a Systems Engineer (IT). She is also able to support her brother and mother, who helps her in the business when Virginia is at school.

Virginia would like to get the loan to be able to buy a new photocopy machine since the one she has is damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 10 meses, Virginia trabaja en su propio negocio de servicios de fotocopiado y trabajos de computadora. Gracias a este negocio puede pagar sus estudios de ingeniería de sistemas además de mantener a su hermano y su madre, quien la ayuda en el negocio cuando Virginia se va a estudiar.

A Virginia le gustaría tener un financiamiento para poder comprar una nueva fotocopiadora, pues la que tiene está averiada.

loans.use: Purchase a new photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix up his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her stock and make more improvements to her store

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Mrs. R. currently lives in a housing project which is located in the region of Libertad. Her family is made up of three people: her two children and her partner. The family income is dependent on Mrs. R.’ spouse who works in security. For her part, she sells tortillas, as well as other food like beans and rice, among other things. This is favorable since when people look for tortillas, they also can buy other food for their homes. She needs the loan so that she may improve her house since in winter the front part gets damp. In addition, she will construct a wall of medium height which will make more space and help her expand the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. R. vive en la actualidad en un Proyecto de Vivienda el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de la Libertad , Su grupo familiar lo componen tres personas dos hijos y su compañero de vida, los ingresos del grupo familiar dependen del esposo de la solicitante que trabaja como seguridad, y ella por su parte que se dedica a la venta de tortillas y artículos de consumo tales como frijol, arroz, y otros esto le favorece ya que la gente cuando busca las tortillas también puede llevar los artículos de consumo para el hogar, el crédito lo necesita para poder hacer una ampliación en su vivienda ya que en la época de invierno se le humedece la parte frontal de la casa . Por otra parte también construirá una pared a media altura lo cual le generara mayor espacio y le ayudara a dejar mas amplia la zona de la cocina.

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, sand, stone and material for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Untouchables (Intocables) Group

texts.es:
"Untouchables" is the name of this community association that brings together this group of women workers, most of them with family responsibilities, (i.e., married, with children and husbands in some cases) who do not have a fixed source of employment.

Their personal situations has forced each of them to be responsible for their families in ways like: providing for the cost of housing, food, education and needs of their children. That is why they decided to engage in many different activities, ranging from handicrafts, textile weaving and sewing of fabrics, trading products,etc. in the various fairs in their area, or in the main exhibition fair of Alteña.

They now require working capital to be able to purchase raw materials for their trade, after taking into account that demand for their work rose considerably, during the busy time of carnivals. They plan to take advantage of this demand for their work, so they can generate sufficient income to cope with the beginning of school term in the month of March.

Translated by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Intocables, es el nombre de la asociación comunal que reúne a un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras, la mayoría con responsabilidades familiares, es decir, casadas, con hijos y esposos en algunos casos no tienen una fuente de empleo fijo. Esta situación las ha obligado a ser responsables de sus familias y y los gastos de la casa, como ser la alimentación y los estudios y necesidades de los hijos. Por tal motivo ellas han decidido dedicarse a muchas actividades distintas, que van desde las artesanías en tela y textiles, costura y otros. Productos que comercian en distintas ferias de su zona, o en la principal feria Alteña. Ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de materia prima, tomando en cuenta que la demanda de sus trabajos en la época de carnavales se incrementa considerablemente y debe ser aprovechada para generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la temporada de inicio de clases que se avecina en el mes de marzo.

loans.use: This group requires working capital to be able to purchase raw materials to use in their trade during the busy carnival season, and especially since they anticipate expenses with the onset of the school term which begins in March. (Ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de materia prima, tomando en cuenta que la demanda  de sus trabajos en la época de carnavales se incrementa considerablemente y debe ser aprovechada para generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la temporada de inicio de clases que se avecina en el mes de marzo.)

loans.name: Perlas De German Busch Group

texts.es:
"Pearls of Germán Busch" is the name of the community association that brings together 15 women, who have been working for 2 years and a half years, at improving their lives, and mostly to secure the future of their children.

Various activities are performed by this group, such as: new and used clothing sales, some food stations, crafts, etc. These are typically what characterize the activities performed by these women, who either own their own posts or participate in traveling fairs and markets in the city of El Alto so they can help sustain their families.

Currently, they need capital in order to meet the demands of the folk art fairs in the city of La Paz, El Alto and in some provinces of the Department, where they travel to offer their crafts/products. This is the only way they can hope to meet their obligations as heads of households.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Perlas de Germán Busch, ese es el denominativo de la asociación comunal que reune a 15 mujeres que hace 2 años y medio trabajan en pos de mejorar sus vidas, y principalmente asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Diversas actividades las caracterizan. El comercio de ropa, nueva y/o usada, algunos puestos de comida, y algunas artesanías caracterizan las actividades de estas señoras, que ya sea en puestos propios o deambulando por ferias, plazas y mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, intentan llevar a sus hogares el sustento diario. Actualmente precisan de capital para hacer frente a la demanda que existirá principalmente en las entradas folklóricas que se realizaran tanto en la ciudad de La Paz, El Alto y en algunas provincias del Departamento, donde ellas vijan para ofrecer sus productos, solo de esta manera podrán responder a las tantas obligaciones que les depara ser jefas de familia.

loans.use: They need capital in order to meet the demands of the folk art fairs in the city of La Paz, El Alto and in some provinces of the Department, where they travel to offer their crafts/products.  This is the only way they can hope to meet their obligations as heads of households.  (Actualmente precisan de capital para hacer frente a la demanda que existirá principalmente en las entradas folklóricas que se realizaran tanto en la ciudad de La Paz, El Alto y en algunas provincias del Departamento, donde ellas vijan para ofrecer sus productos, solo de esta manera podrán responder a las tantas obligaciones que les depara ser jefas de familia.)

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
Cielo is the name of an association of 16 women who, a little more than one and a half years ago, joined Pro Mujer with the intention of improving their quality of life and developing certain business skills. Only in this form would they be able to face their obligations as mothers, and in some cases, head of the family. This association is characterized by the sale of food products and in some cases we can find the sale of electronics and clothing. Concerning food sales, the majority of the women possess stalls in the main markets, and in some cases, in the fairs of their zone. In the case of the other products, the women have to walk around in order sell and generate the necessary income for their families. Currently, the partners need capital in order to revive their businesses and take advantage of the festivities of Carnaval, when during the longer holiday, people tend to buy different products for the home or simply have parties when the food consumption is massive.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Cielo, es el nombre de la asociación comunal que reúne a 16 mujeres que hace poco mas de un año y medio ingresaron a Pro Mujer con la intención de mejorar su calidad de vida, y principalmente de desarrollar ciertas destrezas en los negocios, solo de esta forma podrían hacer frente a las obligaciones que representa ser madre y en algunos casos jefa de familia. Esta asociación se caracteriza por la venta de productos alimenticios, y en algunos casos podemos encontrar la venta de artefactos electrónicos y prendas de vestir. En lo que respecta a la venta de productos alimenticios, la mayoría posee puestos propios en los principales mercados y en algunos casos en las ferias de la zona. En referencia a los otros productos, diremos que deben deambular para poder vender y generar las ganancias necesarias para sus familias. Actualmente las socias precisan de capital para poder reactivar sus negocios con el fin de aprovechar los festejos de las fiestas de carnaval, donde lo extenso del feriado, la gente tiende a abastecerse de distintos productos del hogar, o simplemente realiza fiestas y prestes donde el consumo de alimentos también es masivo.

loans.use: The partners need capital to revive their businessesesfor the Carnaval festivities.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Esmeralda is the name of a precious stone, as precious as the women who make up the association of the same name. They're 15 women who their livings selling seasonal merchandise which means that they buy and sell the merchandise most likely to be in demand at a particular time of the year.

The Carnaval festival is coming up soon where sales of party favors, water pistols, fireworks and, most importantly, alchohol will be in great demand so the members want to make the most of the event to generate income and also prepare themselves for the soon-to-start school year, where they will buy and sell school supplies, and for other upcoming dates.

They need funds to buy merchandise for the Carnaval season, as well as the start of the school year and, soon, the Semana Santa (Easter week) celebrations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Esmeralda, es el nombre de una piedra preciosa, como preciosas son las mujeres que integran la asociación del mismo nombre. Son 15 mujeres que se dedican a la venta de mercadería de temporada, es decir, dependiendo de las fechas, ellas aprovechan para comprar y vender mercadería relacionada con las mismas.

En pocos días se celebrarán las fiestas de carnaval, donde la venta de cotillón, pistolas de agua, fuegos artificiales, y principalmente bebidas alcohólicas tienen gran demanda, y las socias aprovechan para generar sus recursos y preparar sus puestos para la siguiente temporada, como es la temporada de inicio de clases, donde ellas aprovechan para comprar y vender material escolar y de escritorio, y así sucesivamente en cada fecha especial del año.
