Ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de la mercadería, tanto para las fiestas de carnaval como para el inicio de clases, y próximamente la celebración de las fiestas religiosas de Semana Santa.

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es:
Julia L. is a small business woman who, for more than 10 years, has dedicated herself to the clothing business, handmade by her in a small workshop inside her home, located in a poor area of Guatemala. She also offers her services in pastry making since she is trained and has obtained knowledge of pastry making, this being her secondary commercial activity. Approximately six years ago, she became a widow but she has not tired of her job since she is trying to get her four children ahead. The house in which they live is itself in the capital and located in the area described above. Recently, she has purchased an industrial machine with which she hopes to increase the production of children’s clothing since children’s clothing is what her customers request the most, some for personal use and others for resale. Julia L. is an example of tenacity, courage and dedication to her job.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Julia L., es una mujer microempresaria, que por mas de de 10 años Se ha dedicado al comercio de de prendas de vestir, elaboradas por ella misma, En un pequeño taller que funciona dentro de su casa de abitacion, ubicada en : area pobre urbana de Guatemala. Temala, tambien ofrece sus servicios en la elaboraciòn de pasteles, ya que fue ca- Pacitada, y obtuvo varios conocimientos de reposteria, siendo esta, su segunda ac- Tividad comercial. Hace 6 años aproximadamente, quedò viuda, y no ha desmayado en su trabajo, a fin De sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos. La casa donde viven, es propia, son originarios de la capital, y radicados en la di- Recciòn antes descrita. Ultimamente ha comprado una màquina industrial, con la cual espera incrementar La produccion de ropa de niño, ya que es la ropa de niño la que mas le piden sus Clientes, algunos para uso personal y otros para revender. Doña Julia L., es un ejemplo de tenacidad, valor, y dedicaciòn al trabajo .

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make dresses and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Leo Group

texts.es:
Leo. The word can conjure up different meanings: lions--or, in this case, lionesses--and the strongest of all the signs of the Zodiac and other things besides but, according to its members, it's the first two concepts that encapsulate each of their personalities.

For more than 6 years, these 16 women have worked together, making their association one of the best known and steadfast of its kind. Most of them earn a living making and selling food products of various kinds: some, quick and easy meals; some, sophisticated versions of their national cuisine; and others, lunches for area "pensiones" (a kind of boarding house) and restaurants.

Their major preoccupation now is how to meet the demand that will arise during the upcoming Carnival festivals because the event attracts people with money to spend, people who will buy plenty during this period. Consequently, they need funds to buy the supplies they need to prepare their stands so that they can compete with the many other food businesses that will pop up for the event.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Leo; esta palabra puede ser interpretada bajo muchos conceptos, como leones, o en este caso leonas, también es conocido como un signo zodiacal, el mas fuerte del zodiaco, y muchos otros significados mas, pero según las socias, estos dos conceptos encajan en la personalidad de cada una de ellas.

16 mujeres integran esta sociedad, desde hace mas de 6 años, siendo una de las asociaciones destacadas y constantes. En su mayoría sus integrantes están dedicadas a la preparación y venta de comida en distintas modalidades, algunas se dedican a la preparación de comida rápida, otras a la preparación de platos mas sofisticados de la gastronomía nacional, y otros se dedican a la atención de almuerzos en pensiones y restaurantes de la zona.

Su principal preocupación es la demanda que existirá en aquellas entradas folklóricas a realizarse en las fiestas de carnaval, puesto que la afluencia de gente a estos eventos es masivo y generalmente son consumidores potenciales por la duración misma de los eventos. Por tal motivo ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de sus insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus puestos, de esta manera poder competir con variedad y calidad ante los muchos otros negocios de comida que existirán para esas fechas.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making food and preparing space at upcoming Carnival event.

loans.name: Clotilde's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Clotilde, and America are members of the community bank “Magnolia”. Maria and Rotilde have belonged for seven and five years, while America joined just four months ago. In that time they have learned discipline, the importance of helping others, and how not to be dependent on the men in their lives.

Maria is 39 years old. She is married and has one eleven-year-old child. Maria owns a photography business where she takes pictures for a variety of local events. She has been a photographer for 20 years.

Clotilde is 59 years old. She is a widow and has six children between the ages of twenty-four and thirty-six. Cotilde travels 10 hours to Lima every three or four months to buy clothing, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. She has this business for 18 months. Previously, in the 1980s, she owned a small grocery store, but do to civil unrest and astronomic levels of inflation she was forced to close.

America is 30 years old. She travels to different markets in the region selling clothing, which she buys in Lima. She has had this business for one year. Before that she was a cashier, but the hours were very long and she prefers working for herself.

Maria, Cotilde, and America need loans of 1000, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in a piece of photography equipment, and a greater variety of clothing.

An important part of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Maria, Cotilde, and America plan to use their savings to buy land, and later build a house, to purchase a refrigerator, and to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are to see their children get good educations and become professionals.

loans.use: Maria, Cotilde, and America need loans of 1000, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in a piece of photography equipment, and a greater variety of clothing

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
"I need to make some repairs in the bathroom of my house because there's a lot of damp on the walls that lead to family illnesses. My wife and I are older now and the damp especially affects us. I'm asking for US$1,000 to repair the bathroom in my house."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

“Tengo la necesidad de hacer algunas reparaciones en el baño de mi casa ya que hay mucha humedad en las paredes y por lo tanto provoca enfermedades a mi familia, sobre todo por que mi esposa y yo ya somos personas mayores y nos afecta más la humedad” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para reparar el baño de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Repair bathroom.

loans.name: Rosenda Federica

texts.es:
My 2 siblings and I live in this house. We would like to enlarge it a bit at the front because we only have two rooms and there's not enough space for the 3 of us. We need privacy and more room. I'm asking for US$1,000 to enlarge my house."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

“En mi casa vivimos mis 2 hermanos y yo, así es que nos gustaría ampliar nuestra casa un poco hacia adelante ya que tenemos solo 2 cuartos y el espacio es muy reducido para los 3, necesitamos privacidad y sobre todo estar más cómodos”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para ampliar mi vivienda

loans.use: Home improvement.

loans.name: Lourdes Patricia

texts.es:
"I have a "casa de interes social" (a publicly-subsidized house) where I live alone with my daughter. I'd like, bit by bit, to fix it up. I want to start by installing "vitropiso" (tiled flooring) so I can keep the floors cleaner. I worked many years to get this house and I want to leave it to my daughter. I'm asking for US$550 to install vitropiso in my house."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

“Tengo una casa de interés social, vivo sola con mi hija y me gustaría poco a poco ir arreglándola pero quiero empezar por ponerle vitropiso ya que así podré mantenerla más limpia, trabaje muchos años para que me dieran esta vivienda y es el patrimonio de mi hija” Solicito $ 550.00 dlls para poner Vitropiso en mi casa.

loans.use: Install tile flooring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock in her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock and move to permanent premises.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is a single man who lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1985. Rovshan has worked one year in his auto repair business. Now he requests a loan of $775 to buy the necessary supplies to improve his business and increase the number of his clients.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for auto repairs

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur has been in his business for a year. He was born in 1977. Zaur buys potatoes and onions from the villages for sale in the market. He is single and lives in the Khachmaz region. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif was born in 1970 and lives in the Khachmaz region. He is married and has 2 children.  Five years ago he started a farming business. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba (her husband is pictured), who was born in 1974, is a mother of 2 children. The Aslanov's family lives in the Khachmaz region. Mahbuba has run this business for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy seedlings and pesticides for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is a 42-year-old mother of 2 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region. Dilbar has 10 years of experience in the cattle business. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow for getting more milk and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila was born in 1960 and she is a mother of 3 children.  The family lives in the Khachmaz region. Rahila has sold agricultural produce for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy fruits and vegetables for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Berha's Group

texts.en:
Bertha, Francisca, and Dora have been part of the community bank “Suni” for 5, 2, and 12 years respectively. In that time they have learned how to save, how to use their money more effectively, and how to be responsible. In addition they learned how to avoid domestic violence and how to more effectively prevent sickness. They like the community bank because it is simple. At other banks you have to wait a long time and fill out many forms.

Bertha is 30 years old. She is a single mother and has one six-year-old child. Her neighbor invited her to join the bank, and she started with just a $50 loan. At this time she sold vegetables at several regional markets. Now, with the help of the community bank, she owns a clothing store, and has been able to build a house.

Francisca is sixty years old. She is a widow and has eight adult children. Francisca never learned to read, and has been working all of her life. She grows potatoes in the region of Ayacucho, and with a van she was able to purchase with a bank loan, she transports them to the jungle eight hours away.

Dora is thirty-three. She lives with her partner and two children. She joined the bank twelve years ago when it was just starting out with $2 to her name. At the time she sold candies on one of the streets of Ayacucho. Since then she has been able to buy a house and start a new, and more profitable business, selling clothing.

Bertha, Francisca, and Dora need loans of 600, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying clothing, and raising potatoes.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Bertha, Francisca, and Dora plan to use their savings to put a second floor on their home, buying another field, and adding a roof to their home. Their dreams are to finish building their home, not have to travel to Lima as frequently, and to see their children happy and healthy.

loans.use: Bertha, Francisca, and Dora need loans of 600, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying clothing, and raising potatoes.

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa and Lucy have been members of the community bank “Magnolia” for two years. In that time they have learned to save, work efficiently, and not be dependent on their husbands. They agreed that they enjoy coming to weekly meetings, and see the other associates as their friends.

Elsa is 33 years old. She is married and has two young children. Elsa was encouraged to join the community bank by her cousin; she has five other family members who all belong. Elsa travels to Lima to buy clothing that she then sells in Ayacucho.

Lucy is thirty-one. She is married, and has two young children. Lucy has owned a convenience store for five years. Elsa and Lucy need loans of 600 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy shoes, and to add a few tables to the convenience store so she can serve snacks and beverages.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate gets. Elsa and Lucy are planning to use their savings to buy a piece of land and build a house. Their dreams are to own a comfortable home and help their children become professionals.

loans.use: Elsa and Lucy need loans of 600 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy shoes, and to add a few tables to the convenience store so she can serve snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products and materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more material to make her products.

loans.name: Lissette Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Lissette, who is 41-years-old, is married with a 9-year-old son, who studies in elementary school. They live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua.

Lissette's husband is a lawyer and works independently. With his support, she started a small grocery store 6 years ago. With time, she has improved it, and now it is a store that has almost all of the products for daily basic consumption for her neighbors who visit her. Her neighbors are people who live on small quanities of money and need to buy the products that they are going to use every day.

Lissette hopes to expand her business even more, and for that she needs to buy dairy products, meat, and bread, among other things. This is how her family has gotten ahead, and she is offering education and a decent life to her small son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lissette, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, con un hijo de 9 años, quien se encuentra estudiando la educación primaria, habitan en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua.

Su esposo es abogado y trabaja por cuenta propia, y con al poyo de él montó una pequeña pulpería hace 6 años, con el tiempo ha ido mejorando y ahora es una pulpería que cuenta con casi todos los productos de consumo básico diario de los vecinos que la visitan, los vecinos del lugar son personas que subsisten con pequeñas cantidades de dinero al día y necesitan comprar diario los productos que van a usar.

Desea expandir más su negocio es por eso que requiere comprar productos lácteos, carnes, pan entre otras cosas. Es así como esta familia ha salido adelante y le estan brindando educación y una vida digna a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, meat, and bread.

loans.name: Fridda Alicia

texts.es:
Frida is a merchant who sells cosmetics. She works as a street vendor and also works in her home. She sells her products to her neighbors in the neighborhood where she lives.

Presently, Doña Frida has very little stock of her products. This is why she needs the credit to buy creams, perfumes, and cosmetics to be able to keep offering her merchandise. Valentine's Day is also getting closer, which is good for her because she can offer a larger quantity of products.

Frida is 35-years-old and is married with a teenage daughter. Her family lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood, a poor and marginalized neigborhood. Her husband works as a technician repairing radios and televisions. He has a small shop in their home and also attends to his clients in their homes. Both offer support to each other to be able to take good care of their small family. Doña Frida has had this business for three years and hopes to start a small store to offer her products with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Frida es una comerciante que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Su forma de vender es ambulante y también atiende en su casa de habitación, ella comercializa sus productos entre las vecinas del barrio donde habita.

Actualmente Doña Frida se encuentra con poca existencias de productos, es por eso que necesita el crédito para comprar cremas, perfumes y cosméticos para poder seguir ofertando su mercadería, también se acerca e día de San valentín, que es aprovechado por ella para ofertar mayor cantidad de productos.

Frida tiene 35 años de edad, casada, con una hija adolescente, esta familia habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez, un barrio pobre y marginado. Su esposo trabaja como Técnico en reparación de radios y televisores, tiene un pequeó taller en su casa de habitación y también atiende a sus clientes a domicilio. Ambos se ofrecen apoyo para poder sacar a su pequeña familia adelante. Doña Frida tiene 3 años en este negocio y espera poder poner una tienda para ofertar con mejor servicio sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of creams, perfumes, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Marcia Aurora

texts.es:
Marcia is 48 years old, married, and has 3 daughters, 2 of them are in high school and the other is at college. Her husband is the breadwinner and assumes responsibility for the entire family's living expenses as well as their children's tuition and school fees. Marcia is responsible for her elderly mother, who is sick and requires care, attention, and medication. Seeing that her husband was unable to provide for her mother's medical costs, Marcia decided to look for an alternative way to earn income to cover all expenses for taking care of her mother. This is how she came to sell cosmetics amongst her friends, neighbors, and to the general public. Doing this has allowed her to support her family when there was a need. Marcia wishes to set up a store to sell various items for women, men, and children and offer different product lines so she does not have to do business in the streets and leave her mother and children alone. Currently, this woman needs to buy cosmetics such as lipstick, nail polish, eyeshadow, perfumes because these are the products in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Doña Marcia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas se encuentran estudiando en secundaria y una en la Universidad, su esposo trabaja y es quien asume todos los gastos familiares de la casa, así como también los gastos escolares y la universidad de la hija mayor. Doña Marcia tiene cargo a su madre, ya es una señora de edad avanzada, enferma que requiere de cuido, atención y medicina, viendo que su esposo no puede asumir también los gastos médicos de la anciana, dona Marcia decide buscar una alternativa que le pueda generar ingresos para ella hacerse cargo de todos los gastos de su madre y es así como decide vender cosméticos a sus amistades, vecinas y público en general. Es de esta manera como esta familia ha salido adelante y han podido subsistir con lo necesario, el deseo de la señora es el de llegar a montar una tienda de variedades para damas, caballeros y niños, en el cual pueda ofrecer diferentes líneas de productos, ya que así no tendría que salir a las calles y dejar sola a su madre e hijas. Actualmente, la señora necesita comprar sus cosméticos como son pinturas de labios, uñas, sombras de ojos, perfumes, ya que sus clientes están demandando dichos productos.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es:
Wilber, 26, is a young entrepreneur, married, and has 3 young children who are at elementary school. His family lives in Laureles Sur, a rural region. Ever since his youth, Wilber wanted his own business and had the opportunity to study optometry at college. This passion led him to build his profession on it; approximately, 4 years ago, he set up his own optician shop with the help and financial support of his sister and that of his wife as well.

This family has also been involved to fully taking care of the business, attending to customers, and expanding. Currently, the shop serves customers from all the northern rural areas and some urban areas of the country, which is an indicator that this business has also provided jobs. In addition, the business depends on a great number of satisfied clients. These days, this young man needs a loan to buy lens and different colored frames, which are in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Wilber es un joven empresario, tiene 26 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos pequeños, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en primaria, esta familia habita en el asentamiento Laureles Sur, una zona rural. El señor desde muy joven deseó tener su propio negocio y aprovechó la oportunidad para estudiar en la universidad la carrera de Optometrista, la cual es una profesión que le apasiona, hace aproximadamente 4 años el señor monto su propia Óptica, con mucho sacrificio y con el apoyo económico de su hermana así como el apoyo de su esposa.

Esta familia se ha dedicado de lleno al cuido del negocio, la atención de los clientes y el de irse expandiéndose. Actualmente la óptica cubre todo el sector norte rural y parte urbano del país, a medida que crece este negocio ha sido generador de empleos, cuentan con un buen número de clientes los cuales están satisfechos con el servicio brindado por la óptica. En estos momentos el señor requiere de un préstamo para la compra de lentes y marcos de diferentes colores, ya que la demanda de sus clientes es cada vez mayor.

loans.use: buy lens and frames of various colors

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim has one year of experience in the taxi business. This man is married and has 3 children. The I. family lives in the Khachmaz region. Now, this 39-year-old man needs a loan of $725 to buy spare parts for this car in order to attract more clients and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: This single man lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1985 and started this business a year ago. Now Farid needs a loan of $725 to buy phone accessories to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: 3 years ago, this single man started taxi business. He lives in Khachmaz region and was born in 1980. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy spare parts for this car so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana (her sister is pictured) lives in Khachmaz town. She is 29 years old and single. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Parvana buys clothes to sell from Baku and other towns. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy cloth to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammad Ismail

texts.en: Mohammad Ismail lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 2 children. He has a retail shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 2 years. He wants to expand his business to make a good income so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like boxes of cookies, bags of rice, boxes of sugar, chocolates, and sweets. He is happy that he can help his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials to complete his stock

loans.name: Gulasmar

texts.en: Gulasmar (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 3 children. She was born in 1968. She has been in this business for 4 years. The Seyidov family needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow to improve their business and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: You can see in the picture the young man who is Raisa's son. This young man helps his mother. Raisa is a mother of 4 children. 5 years ago she started this business. She is 52 years old. This family lives in the Khachmaz region. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy foodstuffs to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: İlhama

texts.en: Ilhama started this business one year ago. She was born in 1970 and lives in the Khachmaz region. Ilhama is single. She sells clothes, blankets, towels, etc. by retail. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy additional stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin (his wife is pictured) was born in 1959. He is married and has 2 children. The R. family lives in Khachmaz region. 6 years ago they started this business. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy a cow to get more milk and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul (her husband is pictured) lives in Khudat town. She was born in 1990. 7 years ago she started this business. The Ramazanov family does not have childlren. Now this family needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan is a single man, who lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1981. He has 4 years of experience in the farming business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings and pesticides to improve his farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children. She started a farming business 2 years ago. They plan to buy seedlings and pesticides to improve their farming, which is why they are applying for this loan of $1200. Valida is 43 years old.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children and was born in 1969. The Suleymanov family lives in Khachmaz town. They have 7 years of experience in this business. Now they plan to buy 2 cows to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en: Sardar G. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. He has a building materials shop and has lots of experience in this business. He has been involved in this business for a few years and has lots of customers. He needs to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan to expand his business and make a better income. He needs a loan in the amount of $850.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mohammad Nasir

texts.en: Mohammad Nasir lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the only one to support his family  -  he is married.  He was in Iran for about 7 years where he had a dress shop. When he came back two years ago he decided to open dress shop in Kabul and now he wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import new designs of clothes for teenagers to attract a good numbers of clients. This way, he can make a good income and help his family.

loans.use: To import new designs of clothes

loans.name: Khabibullo

texts.en:
B. Khabibullo is 31 years old. He is married with two children, the elder just started at school and the younger is only 2 years old. 

Khabibulo is an expert in audio editing of video tapes and discs with records of  family events of  his clients. He has been in this business for 4 years already. Khabibullo tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. For instance, now he is planning to purchase a mputer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business.

With this purpose Khabibullo requests 1450.00 Somoni (425 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan of Khabibullo and he thanks all for their support and promises not to let them down and to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of a computer

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mr. N. lives in Koh Dach on Mekong River. He married Sok Lang in 1970, five years before the Pol Pot Regime. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Three of the children have married and live in separate housing, the other two children are living with them. Mr. N. buys mangoes and jicama under contract in the village and takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. His wife helps him collect the fruit before they are taken to the market.

Chhum N. is requesting his seventh loan in the amount of $600. He will use this loan to purchase mangoes and jicama under contract from the local farmers.

loans.use: Buy Mangoes and Jicama in contract

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
M. Farhod is 26 years old. He is married.

During the last year Farhod has provided transportation as a service. With his lorry Farhod transports  hardware, planking, and house ware and house equipment. As a rule he is working in his region only. 

In order to decrease the expenses for fuel, Farhod is planning to install a system so he can use natural gas which is much cheaper than petrol.  For this purpose Farhod requests 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan Farhod has applied for  and he would like to promise to pay the loan in time and to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: Replacing the fuel system with a natural gas supply system in his lorry.

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en:
Mr. S. lives along the national road on the way to Ankor Wat. He married Dieb Soka in 1987 and has one son and three daughters. He and his wife have been growing vegetables for nine years and after harvesting, they take the vegetables to sell in Phnom Penh. They are polite and friendly and wish to help one of his daughters open a beauty shop in Phnom Penh city.

Mr. S. is requesting his third loan in the amount of $500. He will use this loan to pay for plowing and worker fees and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and worker fees and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. S. has been weaving since 1992, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She was married in 1982 and has two sons and a daughter. All of them have jobs. Her husband works as a construction worker but helps in the weaving business when time allows. They live in Koh Dach in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. All of her finished product is sold to the middle man in the village.

Mrs. S. is requesting her third loan in the amount of $250. She will use this loan to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.use: Buying silk material for weaving

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. S. was married in 1984 and has seven children. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, but the other children live at home and are involved in the weaving business. Mrs. S. and her husband, Chann Vy, are also rice farmers. The family lives in Koh Dach by the Mekong River.

Mrs. S. will use this loan of $200 to purchase silk material for her three children who are weaving at home. This is her fourth loan request.

loans.use: Buying silk material for weaving

loans.name: Kul

texts.en:
Mrs. N. married in 1992 and has six children ( all in school) . She has worked in the garment factory for two years and her husband is a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh. Her family lives in Takmao Commune, about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They are friendly, loyal and hard-working.

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. A. married in 1979 and has three children; two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons live with her and her daughter has married and has her own family. Mrs. A. is one of the rice wine makers in the village while her husband, Sek Saroeurn, is a motor taxi driver. She is in her late 50's but still strong enough to work. They both were unable to finish the primary school, but they try to earn money to support the two sons so they may attend school. Their house is about 11 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. A. is requesting a loA. for the third time in the amount of $700 to buy more rice and rice husk to make rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase rice and rice husk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. P. has sold fish in Preak Ho Market for over 20 years and her husband is a construction worker. They have been married since 1985 and have eight children; six sons and two daughters. Both daughters work in the garment factory and the sons are in school. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Even though Mrs. P. and her husband were not able to finish primary school, they are friendly and clever in their business.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to buy a motorbike for her husband so he can drive her to the market and drive himself to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Mr. S. lives about 11 kilometers from Phnom Penh. He married in 1993 and has two sons and a daughter who are in school. He has worked in the construction business for ten years, building and repairing houses and fences for the people in his village. His wife, Sok Sreytay, looks after the house and children.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $600 to purchase tools and building supplies.

loans.use: To purchase tools and building supplies

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. and her husband, Morm Phun, live approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for over twenty years and have two daughters, both who work in the garment factory. Mrs. S., 50, repairs fishing nets for her husband and other local fishermen. Her husband, 54, has been a fisherman for over twenty years. They catch fish from the Tonle Sap River and sell the fish in the village.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $200 to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 26, married in 2000 and has two little sons. She learned to weave from her mother and has been weaving for 8 years. She sells the finish product to the middle man in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns three dollars gross income every day. They live along the Mekong River, about 8 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Charatha is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $400 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: En

texts.en:
Mr. P., 42, has been married for two years and has one son. He is a doctor in the local village while his wife, Prum Sok, looks after their house and child. He has been a village doctor since 1989.  Both Mr. P. and his wife have completed secondary school. They live close to the Viet Nam border. 
P. is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1000 to fix his fence and house.

loans.use: To fix the fence and house

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Mrs. K., 52, has sold rice soup in front of the garment factory for six years. She has been married to Koa Tuy, a motor taxi driver, since 1970. They have nine children: three sons and six daughters. Seven children are living with Mrs. K. and her husband. Five of of the children are in school, one daughter works in a garment factory and a son is a motor taxi driver. They are all living in Phnom Penh City.

Her husband needs a new motorbike to replace the old one, so she is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1000 to make this purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mrs. L., 47, has been selling beef soup, cake and candy since 2001. She is married to Seang Sroy, 61, a truck driver for 26 years. They have one daughter who is working in a garment factory. They are living in Sam Raung Commune along Tonle Sap River, about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. L. is friendly and works very hard in her business. She hopes to build a new house for her family in the future.

She is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $1,200 to buy rice because the price is greatly reduced during harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase rice in harvest season

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. S. has been married since 1993 and has only one son who is studying in a primary school in the village.   He and his wife raise pigs at home. Mr. S. is also a Reumork driver ( a motorbike that has the caravan behind) where he earns four dollars a day.  His wife stays at home to look after the house, her son, and the pig. They live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. In the future they plan to build a pond to raise fish.     
Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $500 to buy more pig food.

loans.use: To purchase more pig food

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. S. married in 1993 and has one son and one daughter. They all live on Koh Dach Island, on the Mekong River. She learned to weave from a neighbor and has been weaving for two years. Her husband is a farmer but he also helps his wife when he has free time after working on the farm. Their oldest son is studying in the primary school in the village; the daughter is too young to study.

Mrs. S. sells her finish product to the middle man inside the village. She is requesting a loan for the fifth time in the amount of $200 to buy silk material to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk material to weave

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 40, lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River. She has been married to Mak Phea since 1984 and has three sons and a daughter. She learned to weave from her mother and started weaving in 1980. Her husband is a construction worker with their second son. Two of the children are in school and the oldest child works as waiter in a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Mrs. S. sells her finish product inside the island. She is friendly and hard working as is her husband.

She is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $300 to buy silk material to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk material to weave

loans.name: Blung

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 38, is a widow. She has one son and three daughters who are all studying in the village school. She is living with her elderly mother and children along Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She has been selling personal beauty products for 15 years, which earns five dollars gross income daily. She buys these items from a market in Phnom Penh and sells to the local villagers and visitors who travel through her village. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for the fourth time from MAXIMA in the amount of $600 to fix her house and fence.

loans.use: To fix her house and fence

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. S., 20, has been married for two years.  She and her husband have been weavers for 7 years, a skill they learned from her mother. They sell the finished product to the middle man in the village. They wish to build a new house in the future for their family. They are polite and friendly. S. is requesting a loan of $250 for the first time to buy silk material to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk material to weave

loans.name: Lugoba B 2022(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hafuswa N.. She operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock her shop. Hafuswa is 24 years old and is single, with a child.

Hafuswa is joined in her small group by Latifa N., Mastula N., Barbara N., and Margret B.. Latifa N. has a retail shop and wants to buy another fridge. Mastula N. is also operating a retail shop and wants a loan to add business. Barbara N. operates a business selling snacks and wants to expand. Margret B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shops and expand businesses

loans.name: Luk

texts.en: Mr. S. has been married for five years and has two little sons. He has been a cook in a restaurant in Phnom Penh for the past six years. His wife, Sokom, weaves at home, a skill she learned from her mother. The family is in Preak Takov commune along the Mekong River about 10 Kilometer from Phnom Penh. Their wish for the future is to open a neighborhood grocery store. Mr. S. is requesting a $1200 loan amount  for the first time to make repairs on his home.

loans.use: To make home repairs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Mr. S. is married  and has one little child. He and his wife live with his mother in-law in Phnom Penh City. He has two jobs: he is a cassette player and TV repairman for people in his neighborhhood; he is a motor taxi driver. His wife is a fish seller in a market in Phnom Penh.  His mother-in-law stays at home and looks after hergrandchild and the house. Mr. S. is studying English because he wants to teach English. 
He is requesting a $1000 loan amount for the first time to buy a motorbike to commute to his various jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jinja Kawempe A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rebecca N.. She is currently in business selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rebecca is 37 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 2 and 4, both of whom go to school.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Milly N., Betty N., Joeria N., and Betty N.. Milly N. has a poultry business and wants to construct another poultry house. Betty N. is currently operating a restaurant and wants a loan to buy more equipment, like foodstuffs and a fridge. Joeria N. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to construct a shade for the charcoal. Betty N. is currently in the business of hair dressing and is requesting a loan to put up a personal salon.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam (his son is pictured) was born in 1958,  has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz region. 2 years ago Islam and his son started a business selling phone accessories.  Now this family needs a loan of $725 to buy additional phone accessories to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Jinja Kawempe B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Martha N.. She operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Martha is 30 years old and is married. She has a 4-year-old child who goes to school. Each week, Martha makes approximately UGX 40,000 in profits and, with the extra help from her loan, she hopes to be able to renovate her mother's house.

Martha is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Rehema N., Rebecca N., and Resty N.. Prossy N. has a salon and wants to buy a hair dryer. Rehema N. is currently operating a retail shop and wants a loan to increase her stock. Rebecca N. operates a business selling fresh foods and wants to expand. Resty N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to start a firewood selling business.

loans.use: To add in stock in shop

loans.name: Jinja Kawempe C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Claire N.. She is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment. Claire is 27 years old and is single. She has two children, aged 5 and 7, both of whom are in school.

Claire is joined in her small group by Joyce S., Mary N. , Florence N., and Margret N.. Joyce S. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand. Mary N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to start up a shoe-selling business. Florence N. also operates a salon and wants to re-invest in her business. Margret N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy another fridge and weighing scales.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment and expand businesses

loans.name: Abduvoris

texts.en:
G. Abduvoris is 33 years old. He is married with 4 children. 

Abduvoris sells confectionery like candies, cookies, pastries, fruit jelly. He is in this business for about 13 years. Abduvoris supplies the goods from the neighboring city two times a month. He has been working with IMON for more than 5 years and has a positive credit history. The generated income allows Abduvoris to support his large family. He is also dreaming of educating all of his children in good schools.

Today Abduvoris requests 1 000.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. He is going to spend the loan to purchase confectionery  so he can enlarge the range of goods. The income  generated from this he is planning to spend on buying a private store and for supporting of his family and educating his children. Abduvoris thanks all for the support.

loans.use: Enlarging the range of goods and for the generated income purchasing of the private store

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children. 6 years ago Arzu and her husband started this business. They sell clothes, blankets, buckets, etc. by retail. Now they need a loan of $600 to buy goods to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Gombolola Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Gorette N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Gorette is 41 years old and is married. She has six children ranging in age from 2 to 14 and they all go to school.

Gorette is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Dina N., Rose N., and Carol N.. Sarah N. has a salon and wants to buy more braids and hair oils. Dina N. is currently operating a used clothing business and wants a loan to expand. Rose N. operates a business tailoring and wants to buy a new sewing machine and more materials. Carol N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her charcoal stock.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Gulkhanim

texts.en: Gulkhanim (her husband is pictured), born in 1957,  has sold hazels for 10 years. She and her husband have 3 children and live in Khachmaz town.  Now they need a loan of $725 to buy hazels in order to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy hazels

loans.name: Gombolola B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hellen N.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to pruchase more chicks and buy poultry feed. Hellen is 35 years old and is married. She has three children ranging in age from 3 to 7 years, and they all go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately UGX 55,000 in profits and, with the extra help from her loan, she hopes to be able to to build another poultry house.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Ssanyu N., Maureen N., Melisa N., and Gloria N.. Ssanyu N. has a business selling chicken mash and wants to re-invest in her business. Maureen N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to increase stock. Melisa N. operates a retail shop and wants to add stock. Gloria N. is also in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to expand.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chicks, and to expand businesses

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suati

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Suati and I Kadek Polos are a couple with three children. They work really hard. Suati is a homemaker while her husband is a farm worker working on someone else's farm with unstable income everyday. Because of the large family expenses, Suati is finding a way to be more productive to help the family makes ends meet. Just as many other women do, Suati finally chose to raise hogs. However Suati does not have enogh money to buy the two sows she wants. Finally Suati is getting the loan from Dinari in the amount of 300,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between 9,000-9,500 IDR). The loan is going to be used for buying sows and animal feed. She hopes that the sows will deliver piglets that in turn can be resold. Suati is very happy to run the business and very confident that she will be getting enough profit to support her children's education to the highest possible level.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Wayan Suati dan I Kadek Polos adalah sepasang suami istri dengan tiga orang anak, mereka sangat rajin bekerja. Suati adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga sedangkan suaminya bekerja sebagai petani yang hanya bisa mengarap milik orang lain dengan upah yang tidak pasti setiap hari. Mengingat akan besarnya kebutuhan hidup setiap hari yang harus dikeluarkan oleh Suati maka Suati mencari jalan keluar bagaimana caranya agar Suati pun memiliki usaha yang produktif yang bisa mendatangkan penghasilan bagi keluarganya. Akhirnya Suati memilih untuk memelihara babi seperti kebanyakan ibu –ibu yang lain. Tetapi Suati tidak memiliki modal yang cukup untuk membeli 2 induk ekor induk babi, akhirnya Suati mendapatkan modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp 3.000.000.- Dana pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi dan pakan. Dengan membeli induk babi, Suati berharap induk babinya bisa segera mempunyai anak sehingga bisa dijual kembali. Suati sangat senang sekali dan menjalankan usaha ini dengan penuh keyakinan bahwa Suati akan mendapatkan keuntungan yang besar dari hasil usahanya ini dan berharap anak –anaknya tetap bisa sekolah sampai tingkat tinggi.

loans.use: To buy sows and animal feed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gombolola D Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Juliet N.. She is currently in the business of selling raw foods and is requesting a loan to expand business. Juliet is 26 years old and is single; she has one 3-year-old child who goes to school.

Juliet is joined in her small group by Eumen K., Hanifa N., Brenda N., and Joweria N.. Eumen K. has a business tailoring and wants to buy more sewing machines. Hanifa N. is currently operating a retail shop and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Brenda N. also operates a retail shop and wants to buy another fridge. Joweria N. is currently in the clothing business and is requesting a loan to expand.

loans.use: To invest in food business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en: Djamila (her husband is pictured), born in 1971, is the mother of two children. The Mutallimov family lives in Khachmaz town. They started this business 2 years ago and now need a loan of $850 to buy additional medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Ni Kadek Westri

texts.id:
Ni Kadek Westri has been a widow for 20 years. Her husband died because of illness. Ni Kadek Westri does not have any child. In addition to running a food mart, Ni Kadek Westri is also raising a hog for meat. She bought one hog since piglet for 300,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between 9,000-9,500 IDR). Ni Kadek Westri is currently getting a loan from Dinari for 1,500,000. With the money Ni Kadek Westri is going to purchase another piglet to expand her hog farming. Ni Kadek Westri spend 5,000 IDR every day, morning and afternoon, for animal feed. After six month, an approximately 100 kg hog can be sold for 12,000 per kilogram. Hence Ni Kadek Westri's gross income is 1,200,000 IDR. She spent 600,000 IDR for animal feed, hence she netted 600,000 IDR. Ni Kadek Westri hopes that her profit multiplies as her hogs do.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Kadek Westri berstatus janda yang sudah 20 tahun ditinggal oleh suaminya meninggal karena sakit. Ni Kadek Westri tidak memiliki anak dari perkawinannya ini. Selain memiliki usaha warung, Ni Kadek Westri juga memelihara babi penggemukan 1 ekor yang dibeli dari masih bibit dengan harga Rp. 300,000,- Ni Kadek Westri saat ini mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Dengan modal ini Ni Kadek Westri akan membeli bibit babi lagi agar jumlah babi yang dipeliharanya bertambah banyak. Setiap hari untuk modal pakan Ni Kadek Westri menghabiskan pakan Rp. 5.000,- untuk 2 kali makan, pagi dan sore hari. Setelah umur 6 bulan, babi penggemukan sudah bisa dijual dengan berat diperkirakan 100 kilogram dengan harga per kilogram Rp.12,000,- Jadi pendapatan kotor Ni Kadek Westri Rp.1.200.000.- Pengeluaran pakan menghabiskan Rp.600,000,-. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat Rp.600,000,- Ni Kadek Westri berharap, semakin banyak memelihara babi maka semakin banyak pula keuntungan yang diperolehnya.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Wayan Warning

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Warning raises a sow. Although she only owns one sow, Ni Wayan Warning is grateful to have additional activity beyond her domestic job. Ni Wayan Warning has one working child. Her house is permanent so is her sow's shed, with metalic roof. She obtains her sow using the 1,500,000 IDR loan from Dinari. (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). The sow costs her 900,000 IDR. She use the remaining money for animal feeds. Ni Wayan Warning feeds her sow twice a day, in the morning and the afternoon. The feed is a mix of polard, taro and concentrate. Ni Wayan Warning is delivering the piglets within three weeks. She hopes that her business can sustain and the sow can reproduce healthily.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam keseharian Ni Wayan Warning memiliki kesibukan memelihara induk babi. Walaupun hanya 1 ekor Ni Wayan Warning bersyukur karena setelah mengerjakan pekerjaan dapur ada kesibukan yang dikerjakan. Ni Wayan Warning memiliki 1 orang anak yang sudah bekerja. Kondisi rumah Ni Wayan Warning sudah permanen .Begitu juga kondisi kandangnya sudah permanen dengan atap seng diatasnya. Induk babi yang dimiliki dibeli dari pinjaman Dinari Rp.1,500,000,-harga induk babi Rp.900,000,- sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Setiap hari Ni Wayan Warning memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Untuk campuran makanannya diberi campuran dedak padi, daun talas dan konsentrat. Saat ini induk babi Ni Wayan Warning mendekati melahirkan kira-kira 3 minggu lagi. Harapan Ni Wayan Warning supaya usahanya berjalan dengan lancar dan induk babi bisa melahirkan dengan selamat.

loans.use: To purchase sow and animal feeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Winastri

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Winastri and her husband live in a village. Her husband, I Made Weneh is an elementary school teacher. They have three children. The oldest works in Denpasar. The other two are still in elemantary school. Ni Ketut Winastri raises one sow from piglet. Now the sow has nine 3-weeks-old piglets. Ni Ketut Winastri borrows from Dinari for 3,600,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). She spent 1,500,000 IDR for constructing a more permanent shed. Prior to that Ni Ketut Winastri raised the hog in a much traditional way, by tying it to a tree. The rest is spent for another hog for 300,000 IDR and animal feed. The nine piglets are sold after 2 month old for a total of 2,430,000 IDR. She spent 500,000 IDR for animal feed so she netted 1,930,000 IDR each time she harvests.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Winastri dan suaminya tinggal di desa . Suaminya, I Made Weneh, seorang guru SD. Ni Ketut Winastri memiliki 3 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah bekerja di Denpasar. Dan 2 anaknya lagi masih bersekolah di SD. Ni Ketut Winastri memelihara 1 induk yang dipelihara dari mulai kecil hingga sudah besar dan menghasilkan. Sekarang induk babi Ni Ketut Winastri sudah memiliki 9 ekor anak yang baru berumur 3 minggu. Ni Ketut Winastri meminjam modal dari Dinari Rp. 3.600.000.- Untuk membuat kandang menghabiskan Rp.1.500.000.- sehingga kandang babinya lebih permanen dengan atap genteng, sebelumnya Ni Ketut Winastri memelihara secara tradisional di ikat dipohon. Sisanya untuk membeli calon induk babi seharga Rp. 300.000.- dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan induk dan anaknya. Setelah berumur 2 bulan, 9 ekor anak babi dijual dengan pendapatan kotor Rp. 2.430.000.- Untuk biaya pakan menghabiskan Rp. 500.000.- jadi keuntungan bersih Rp. 1.930.000.- per panen. .

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and piglets

loans.name: Gomboloa C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jaria B.. She is currently in business operating a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more hair oils and cosmetics. Jaria is 38 years old and is married. She has four children ranging from age 5 to 18 and her children go to school.

Jaria is joined in her small group by Hilda N., Getu N., Zaria N., and Molly N.. Hilda N. has a hotel business and wants to expand. Getu N. is currently operating a business selling raw foods and wants a loan to start up a vegetable business. Zaria Nassozi operates a public pay phone and wants to purchase more air time credit cards. Molly N. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies and expand businesses

loans.name: Ni Kadek Artini

texts.id:
Ni Kadek Artini had been wanting to raise boars for breeding and meat producing. Finally with loan from Dinari for 3,000,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1USD ranges between 9,000-9,500.00 IDR) Ni Kadek Artini could purchase two piglets, one for breeding and another one for meat producing. Ni Kadek Artini wishes that her hog farming can grow without further buying piglets from other farmers or insemination. Good boar typically is 8 or 10 month old. An old enough boar can be loaned to breed other farmers' sow. Each week 3 to 5 people loan Ni Kadek Artini's boar for 50,000 IDR. Each week the boar can produce 150,000 IRD to 250,000 IDR. Ni Kadek Artini maintains the quality of feed given to her boar. Beside polard and concentrate, Ni Kadek Artini also feed the boar with free range chicken eggs to maintain the boar's condition to breed a high quality piglets. The meat producing side costs 500,000 IDR for animal feed, giving her a gross of 900,000 IDR. Hence the total income from breeding and meat producing is 1,000,000 to 1,500,000 IDR per month

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dari dulu Ni Kadek Artini berkeinginan untuk pelihara pejantan dan penggemukan. Akhirnya dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.- Ni Kadek Artini bisa membeli 2 bibit babi yang dipakai untuk pejantan dan yang satu lagi dipakai untuk penggemukan. Ni Kadek Artini berkeinginan supaya usaha ternak babinya bisa berkembang biak tanpa harus membeli bibit di peternak lain atau memakai kawin suntik. Pejantan yang bagus berumur 8 atau 10 bulan. Pejantan yang sudah cukup umur, bisa disewakan untuk mengawini induk peternak lainnya. Setiap satu minggu, 3 s/d 5 orang yang menyewa pejantan milik Ni Kadek Artini dengan ongkos Rp. 50.000.- sekali kawin. Dalam satu minggu, penghasilan yang didapat dari pejantan bisa mencapai Rp.150,000,- s/d Rp.250,000,-. Ni Kadek Artini menjaga sekali mutu makanan yang diberi untuk pejantannya. Selain dedak padi dan konsentrat, Ni Kadek Artini juga memberi telur ayam kampung supaya kondisinya tetap kuat dan sehat sehingga mampu menghasilkan keturunan yang berkwalitas. Sedangkan untuk penggemukan sampai panen menghabiskan pakan Rp.500.000.- dengan hasil kotor Rp. 900.000.- . Jadi keuntungan bersih pejantan dan penggemukan per bulan rata-rata Rp.1.000,000,- s/d Rp.1.500.000,-

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and piglets

loans.name: Ruksara

texts.en: Ruksara was born in 1962, is the mother of one child. and lives in Khachmaz town.  2 years ago she opened an Internet cafe where she teaches students how to use computers, computer programs, and the Internet.  Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy another computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Central 4 Group

texts.en:
Lazia N. is the leader for this group. She is currently in the business of selling raw food and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Lazia is 39 years old and is married; her husband sells fish. She has 3 children ranging from age 17 to 20, and they all go to school. Each week, Lazia earns approximately UGX 40,000 in profits and, with the extra help from her loan, she hopes to be able to increase her stock and start a stall for her daughter .

Lazia is joined in her small group by Annet N., Catherine N., Jane N., and Aisha N.. Annet N. has a business selling tea and wants to expand. Catherine N. is currently operating a business in a market stall and wants a loan to increase her stock of vegetables. Jane N. and Aisha N. also operate businesses in market stalls and want to re-invest in and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand food business

loans.name: Wakimese A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hasifa K.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks. Hasifa is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 4 children ranging in age from 2 to 10 years, and all her children go to school.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Deborah W., Grace K., Mariam N., and Suzan N.. Deborah Wanyana has a business operating a retail shop and wants to expand her business. Grace K. is currently operating a poultry business and wants a loan to buy poultry feed. Mariam N. also operates a poultry business and wants to start up a pig business. Suzan N. is currently in the salon business and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand he poultry business

loans.name: Nazila Huseynali

texts.en: Nazila (her sister is pictured)  was born in 1976 and is the mother of 3 children. The Abdullayev family lives in Khudat town. Naziila has 3 years of experience in this business, and the family now needs a loan of $600 to buy a cow in order to produce more milk.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Wakimese B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Sarah K.. She operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Sarah is 40 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children, both of whom are in school.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Immaculate S., Suzan N., Mastula N., and Rehema N.. Immaculate S. has a catering business and wants to buy more food warmers. Suzan N. is currently operating a salon and wants a loan to expand her business. Mastula N. operates a business selling clothing and bags and wants to increase stock. Rehema N. is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more stock.

loans.use: To expand retail businesses

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en: Mammad is a single man who lives in Khachmaz region. He was born in 1985. Mammad has worked as a dentist for a year and he now needs a loan of $725 to buy necessary medicines and  instruments for his profession.

loans.use: to buy medicines and  instruments necessary for the dental profession

loans.name: Wakimese C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Kevin K.. She operates a school and is requesting a loan to paint the school buildings and buy more furniture. Kevin is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children (twins) aged 20 who attend school.

Kevin is joined in her small group by Jane B., Virgo N., Annet M., and Annet N.. Jane B. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand her business. Virgo N. operates a business in tailoring and wants a loan to buy more sewing machines. Annet M. also operates a tailoring business and wants to buy more materials. Annet N. operates a clinic and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To paint school buildings and expand businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Wakimese D Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Florence A.. She currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Florence is 38 years old and is a single mother of two children, aged 2 and 3. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits and, with the extra help from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy another fridge.

Florence is joined in her small group by Asia M., Mary K., Sarah S., and Faumah L.. Asia M. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand. Mary K. is also operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to add stock. Sarah S. operates a clinic and wants to buy laboratory equipment. Faumah L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand retail businesses

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz, born in 1958,  is a widow with one child.  She lives in Khachmaz town and has been in the retail business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy goods in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim A., a mother of three, leads a group of five entrepreneurial women in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan. They wish to use a $1,475 loan to invest in their families' businesses, so they can build a better life for themselves and their children. Shamim's husband is retired, and her son helps support the family. He's worked by dying cloth since elementary school, and Shamim will use the money to purchase more supplies for his business. Meanwhile, Hanifa will put her share to purchasing a donkey and cart so she can sell fruit, while Sardarn will invest her loan in her family's grocery store. Shakila hopes to buy her son a rickshaw, while Sharifan will purchase materials for her son's welding shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth for a cloth-dying business

loans.name: Wakimese E Group

texts.en:
The leader for this small group is Kuruthum N.. She is currently in the business of wholesale and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Kuruthum is 32 years old and is single. She has 4 children ranging in age from one to seven years.

Kuruthum is joined in her small group by Phiona N., Rashida N., Madina N., and Miriam N.. Phiona N. has a business in a market stall and wants to purchase more raw foods. Rashida N. is currently operating a retail shop and wants to increase her stock. Madina N. operates a poultry business and wants to buy poultry feed. Miriam Naluwooza is an herbalist and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia Bib, the mother of three young daughters, lives in the small town of Chichawatni, Pakistan. Her husband supports their family as the a rickshaw driver, but he one day hopes to own his own. That way, he'll be able to grow his business and bring in more income for their family.

Safia and four other women would like a $2,000 loan to invest in their families' small businesses. Khursheed B. would like to buy a donkey cart; Bushra B. will put it to her public phonebooth; and Khursheed B. will also improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for a business

loans.name: Djafarova

texts.en: Z. (her husband is pictured) was born in 1961 and is the mother of 5 children. She and her husband have been in clothing sales for 3 years. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy additional clothes in order to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim B., a of six, has lived her entire life in Chichawatni, a small town in the Punjab region of Pakistan. She leads a group of five women who all live in the same neighborhood. Each one has the same dream: to invest money in their families' small businesses so they can build a better life for themselves and their children.

With her share of the $1,475 loan, Shahim would like to expand her husband's pharmacy; Saleh wants to buy a donkey cart. Jameela will invest it in her family's restaurant; Nusrat hopes to buy sheep for livestock trading; and Suriya will put the money in her family's barbershop.

loans.use: Buy medicine and supplies to grow a family pharmacy

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en: Sadia M., the mother of six young children, leads an entrepreneurial group of four women in the rural town of Chichawatni, Pakistan. "All of us are hardworking and dream of a better life," she says. With a $725 loan, each woman would like to invest the money in their families' small businesses. Sadia, for example, wants to buy more supplies for her husband's food stall. As for the other women: Azra also wishes to purchase food for her family snack stall, while Jameela hopes to buy a donkey cart for her son. Lastly, Kaneez wants to invest her share into her family's fruit business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a food stall

loans.name: Arkinaz

texts.en: Arkinaz, born in 1956, is a widow with 6 children. . She lives in Khachmaz region and has 10 years of experience in the dairy business.  Arkinaz now  needs a loan of $725 in order to buy a cow to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik is 34 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Khachmaz town. Namik has run this business for 2 years and now needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya B., the mother of four young children, lives in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan. She makes snacks to sell to a local school canteen, while her husband builds bamboo cages for hens and other pets.

Last year, Suriya and three other women applied for a loan and saw their businesses grow. This year, she hopes to do the same so she'll be able to get brick floors for her home and do some repairs. With their shares of the loan, Sajida and Kalsoom want to purchase rickshaws for their husbands' businesses, while Koser hopes to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for a cage-making business

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema S. is the leader of a group of five entrepreneurial women in the small town of Chichawatni, Pakistan. "I completely trust all of my group members and being their group leader gives me a sense of accomplishment," says Haleema, the mother of four young children.

Haleema wishes to divide a $1,125 loan among the women. With her share, she wants to repair the roof of her home, which is in dismal condition, and buy wood for her husband's business. He makes charpai beds, which are traditional day beds made of ropes strung between a wooden frame. Like Haleema, the four other members hope to develop business to improve their families' lives. Sajida will invest in her family's shoe business; Samina will help her husband's restaurant; Sharifan will put the money to her uncle's barber shop; and Zareena will open a restaurant for her sons.

loans.use: To buy wood for a furniture business

loans.name: Banda B7 A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Dorothy A.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand business. Dorothy is 34 years old and married; her husband is a retail trader. She has 5 children ranging in age from 5 to 15.

Each week, Dorothy makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits and, with the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Dorothy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Dorothy is joined in her small group by Regina N., Gorette N., Mastula N., and Aisha N.. Regina N. has a business selling local brew and wants to add to her business. Gorette Namudu is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to increase stock. Mastula N. operates a business of selling raw foods and wants to expand. Aisha N. is also in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to start a shoe business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida B., the mother of two sons and five daughters, resides in the small city of Chichawatni in the Punjab region of Pakistan. One of sons works in a local factory, while her other children still attend school.

Zubaida leads a group of five women. They wish to divide a $1,050 loan among themselves to invest in their own small family businesses. Zubaida wants to purchase medicines for her husband's pharmacy. Her wish: That they'll make enough money to buy a refrigerator for their home. Parween wishes to start a barber shop; Fatima would like to open a grocery store; Saima hopes to purchase a rickshaw; and Yasmeen will invest the money in her family's business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine, a rickshaw, and supplies for a barber shop and grocery store

loans.name: Zarnigar

texts.en: Zarnigar (her brother is pictured) is a  53 year old widow with 3 children. She and her family live in Khachmaz region.  Zarnigar and her brother have been in clothing sales for 5 years, and now they need a loan of $850 in order to buy clothes to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. The I. family lives in Khachmaz region, and Bayram has 5 years of experience in cattle breeding.  Now this family needs a loan of $725 to buy another cow in order to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Editor

texts.en: For a woman to excel in the hardware business for 16 years, she needs determination and hard work, just like B. Editor. She is a widow of 30 years with 6 children (2 in secondary school and 4 in primary school) and caters for 3 dependents. She has been running a hardware shop selling building materials like iron bars, cement, and wall paints in Kazo town for 16 years with the help of money from loans, and now her monthly sale is $355. She has benefited by paying school fees for her children, as well as buying cows that she keeps at home. Her dream is to increase stock in her hardware shop from $1760 to $4680 to enable her to continue paying school fees, as well as buy more cows that provide milk for her family. She needs a loan of $600 for her dream to come true.

loans.use: Bagumire Editor intends to increase stock in her hardware shop from $1760 to $4680 to enable her to continue paying school fees, as well as buy more cows that provide milk for her family.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David’s business involves buying cows from the villages and transporting them to Kampala, the capital city, to sell at a higher price. He has done this business for 25 years. He is 49 years old and married with 7 children. His only dependent was his sister, who died recently. His success depends on the loans of various amounts that he has taken before that have helped him buy more cows, sheep, and goats. He has also bought a piece of land and paid school fees for his children. With this loan of $1175, he intends to buy more animals to sell to enable him to send his 2 children who have completed secondary school to university, as the rest of his children join higher classes. His determination and longevity in business will see him through.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell

loans.name: Rwamunono

texts.en: Rwamunono P., a single mother of 5 primary school-going children, has run a retail shop at Kazo town for 7 years. She is our client and she has taken loans of $150 and $300 before, which have helped her in paying school fees for her children, buying household items, and buying a plot of land in Kazo town. She needs a loan of $300 to help her restock her shop with kerosene, cartons of soap, and cooking oil. Her dream is to complete the unfinished building on the plot of land that she bought and buy more land for her children.

loans.use: To restock her shop with kerosene, cartons of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Banda B7 B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Cissy K..  She is currently a tailor and is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine.  Cissy is 35 years old and is married.  She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 14 and her children go to school.  Each week, Cissy makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a plot of land  Cissy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Cissy is joined in her small group by Rose N., Kizza A.,  Scovia M., and Shamim M..  Rose N. is also a tailor and wants to add in business.  Kizza A. is a tailor a wants to buy more cloth materials and expand business.  Scovia M. operates a bar and wants to expand her business.  Shamim M. owns a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand tailoring business

loans.name: Deo
