texts.en: Deo B. sells bicycle spare parts like tires, spokes, and others. He is 47 years old with business experience of 8 years. He is married with 9 children, of whom 3 are already married, 1 is a mechanic, 1 has a laundry, 1 is a businessman, 2 are still in primary school, and 1 is in pre-primary. His previous loans have helped him buy 2 cows, buy a plot of land in Kazo, and pay school fees for his children. He needs a loan to increase stock in his shop to make his dream of building his plot from the previous loans come true.

loans.use: To increase stock in his bicycle spare parts shop

loans.name: Banda B7 C Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Esther K..  She is currently a tailor and is requesting a loan to expand business.  Esther is 38 years old and is divorced.   She has 2 children ranging age 10 and 12 and her children go to school.  Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house  Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Esther is joined in her small group by Betty N., Jenifer K., Cissy K., and Teresa K..  Betty N. owns a grocery and wants to increase stock.  Jenifer K. is currently operating a salon and wants a loan to expand business.  Cissy K. operates a business of shoes and wants to add in inventory.  Teresa K. owns a canteen and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and expand business

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: “One plus one makes a bundle” is the business strategy behind K. Enid's success. She buys goats, rears them for 3 months, then sells some of the goats, while keeping others to produce more. Enid is 46 years old, married, and has 8 children. She has been involved in animal sales business for the past nine years, and is thankful for her previous loans that have helped her buy and sell increasingly more goats, as well as buy beans and ground nuts for sale as a side business. Enid's dream is to buy a house in Kazo's trading center to generate rental income, as well as to open a shop for the wholesale of beans and ground nuts. A loan of US$600 will help her achieve these two goals.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of a house in the town's trading center to generate rental income 2) Opening of a shop for the wholesale of beans and ground nuts

loans.name: Banda B7 D Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Agnes K..  She owns a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.  Agnes is 40 years old and is divorced.   She has 3 children ranging from age 11 to 15 and her children go to school.  Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a piece of land  Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Agnes is joined in her small group by Gloria N., Betty N., Aisha Nakafero, and B. Nakazzi.  Gloria N. has a business in arts and craffs and wants to expand business.  Betty N. is currently operating a business in livestock farming and wants a loan to expand her piggery business.  Aisha Nakafero operates a business of clothing sales and wants to add inventory.  B. Nakazzi is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam P. is a widow with 5 children. She lives in Khachmaz town, Azerbijan. This woman was born in 1956. She has been in this business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Banda Bbb Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Agnes N..  She owns a salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more salon equipment.  Agnes is 35 years old and is divorced.    She has 2 children aged 10 and 12 and her children go to school.  Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a piece of land.  Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Agnes is joined in her small group by Mastula W., Eve N., Odaru S., and Margret N..  Mastula W. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to increase stock.  Eve N. is currently operating a business in stone quarrying and wants a loan to invest in business.  Odaru S. operates a business of arts and crafts and wants to expand.  Margret N. is currently in stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to rent more land to expand business.

loans.use: To expand salon business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kasharara Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en: B. Judith, the chairperson of Kasharara Bakyara Twimukye Group, is 40 years old and has 2 children: 1 is at a university, while the other is in secondary school. Judith also takes care of her 2 brothers. For the past 12 years, she has been running a shop that also operates as a bar in Kagongo, Ibanda district. She has borrowed from the loan organization before, and currently needs support to expand her business by increasing the stock of sodas, beer, and other drinks. Judith's dream is to see her business transform into a whole-sale business, so that she can afford to buy a new business car.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of sodas, beer, and other drinks to expand business

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
"I am a widow and my name is Nazira H. U.. I was married 25 years ago and since then I have been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan. I am the mother of eight. All of my daughters are married and all of my sons embroider clothes. My sons want to buy threads, beads, and sequins in bulk and for this purpose we require a loan. Wedding season is around the corner and during this season, my sons can obtain bigger orders.

I would like to borrow in a group: Jameela B. wants to improve their restaurant; Khalida B. will invest her share of our loan to buy a rickshaw; Nabeela B. will also invest her loan in her husband’s business; and Azra B. is borrowing for her husband’s shoe business."

loans.use: expand our embroidery business

loans.name: Banda Bbb A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Fatuma N..  She sells vegetable and is requesting a loan to expand.  Fatuma is 38 years old and is married to a business man.  She has 4 children ranging from age 8 to 14 and her children go to school.  Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.  Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Fatuma is joined in her small group by Rashida N., Sarah N., Joyce N., and Mary Z..  Rashida N. has a business selling matooke and wants to purchase more mattoke for sale.  Sarah N. is currently operating a canteen and wants a loan to buy a fridge.  Joyce N. operates a salon and wants to buy a hair dryer.  Mary Z. is currently in the business of chapati making and selling and is requesting a loan to buy more baking ingredients.

loans.use: To expand vegetable business

loans.name: Banda Bbb B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Belinda N.. She is currently in thecanteen business and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Belinda is 34 years old and is married to a taxi driver. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Belinda makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to save for the children's education Belinda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Belinda is joined in her small group by Rodah N., Alice N., Mary N., and Racheal N.. Rodah N. has a business in poultry and wants to expand. Alice N. is currently operating a canteen and wants a loan to buy a fridge. Mary N. operates a business of vegetable selling and wants to start selling fruits. Racheal N. is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To expand canteen business

loans.name: Kireka A1 (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Agnes N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Agnes is 35 years old and her husband is in the welding business. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 150000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a piece of land. Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Agnes is joined in her small group by Jane Adam, Robinah N., Leonia Gipata, and Joyce N.. Jane Adam owns a local brewery and wants to reinvest in her brew business. Robinah N. is currently operating a bar/ pub and wants a loan to purchase more beers and soft drinks. Leonia Gipata operates a business of stone quarrying and wants to expand business. Joyce N. owns a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand clothes business

loans.name: Kanyansheko Group

texts.en: T. Margaret, 39, is married and has 4 children. In addition, she also looks after her cousin. Margaret is the chairperson of Kanyansheko Group and, for the past 8 years, has successfully run a Handcraft business, weaving and selling baskets, mats, and handbags. Her customers are mainly from Mbarara and Ibanda districts. With the help of previous loans and the income from her business, Margaret has bought land, a banana plantation, a coffee shamba, and has paid school fees. With the current loan, she intends to buy another piece of land for a banana plantation to be able to earn more income to support her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a piece of land for a banana plantation

loans.name: Kireka A1 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma M.. She currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Fatuma is 37 years old and is married to a business man. She has 4 children ranging from age 21 to 1 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Victo M., Sulaimah N., Zainah M., and Florence K.. Victo M. has a business in timber selling and wants to expand her business. Sulaimah N. is currently runs a charcoal sales business and wants a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal. Zainah M. operates a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries. Florence K. is currently in the business of soda depot and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beers.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop

loans.name: Kireka A1 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Beatrice M.. She currently sells shoes and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Beatrice is 30 years old and is single. She has 2 children aged 10 and 12 who go to school. Each week Beatrice makes approximately UGX 60000 and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house. Beatrice has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Beatrice is joined in her small group by Joan N., Grace M., Florence N., and Z. Beatrice. Joan N. has a business in used clothing and wants to expand her business. Grace M. is currently operating a gift shop and wants a loan to add stock. Florence N. operates a business of shoe sales and wants to increase her inventory. Z. Beatrice owns a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: M. Amon, 46, is married and has 7 children -  1 has finished college and is now working, while the rest are still in high school. Amon owns a furniture business where he makes chairs and desks for sale. His previous loans from the organization have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. Currently, Amon needs another loan which he intends to use to buy more timber for business. Additionally, he will spend part of the money to purchase a generator to run his two maize milling machines.

loans.use: Purchase of timber for a carpentry business and of a generator for maize milling machines

loans.name: Kazo 11 Abamwe Group

texts.en: Evaristo T., 48 years old, is the chairperson of Kazo 11 Abamwe, and has seen his business grow over years. He is married, has 7 children and 2 other dependants, and is a boda boda cyclist by profession. “Boda boda” is a term used in Uganda for motorcycle business which Evaristo has been involved in for the last 3 years. He has borrowed from this loan organization before, and his previous loans have enabled him to buy a new motorcycle and to pay school fees for his children. Now, Evaristo and his loan group are asking for a loan to purchase a number of cows and to develop Evaristo's piece of land by building houses for commercial purposes. All members of the group are certain that, with the help of the loan, their business ideas will be implemented successfully.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of cows and 2) development of a piece of land by building houses for commercial purposes

loans.name: Byeshembe Savings Group

texts.en: The chairperson of Bushembe Savings Group, M. Kellen, has been a great group leader. She is 32 years old, married, and has 5 children. In addition, she also takes care of her 3 sisters. Kellen is involved in the tailoring business - she buys new textiles for sale and sewing. Kellen needs a loan to help her develop the piece of land that she purchased for cattle keeping with the help of her previous loans. Additionally, she plans to use part of the loan money to tender Uniform materials for a number of secondary schools, such as Kazo secondary, Buremba secondary, Kazo model secondary, St. Catherine secondary, and Kyabahura Primary school, all of which are located in Kellen's locality. With her previous loans, Kellen has already been able to buy 2 sewing machines, a flat iron and an overlock machine that has helped her in the tailoring business by making her work look neat and professional.

loans.use: 1) Development of a piece of land for cattle keeping and 2) tender of Uniform materials for secondary schools in the locality

loans.name: Awa Yombe

texts.en: Madame D. has requested a loan to buy products to replenish and expand her small boutique. She sells a variety of products and now she would like to supply goods that are being more demanded. For the moment she would like to buy shoes, clothing, perfume, body creams, etc. Awa Yombe has been a good client of Caurie's for several years and already paied back another loan. Madame D. uses profits from her business to enrich the family and home environment and pay for school fees. This loan is for 6months with 1 payment made at the end of the loan.

loans.use: Funds to replenish and grow her boutique's business.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Her perseverance, desire to succeed and the wish to see her children with good prospects for the future, are Alejandrina's reasons for working hard each and every day in her business selling sheep and alpaca wool. She is the mother of two adolescent children and, upon seeing that her husband’s income as a bread maker would not cover their household expenses, she decided to find a way to generate additional income for the family. Her business brings her much satisfaction, as it is rapidly showing good results. This charming lady buys her merchandise from the different providers in the Ayaviri province. She tries to gather a considerable amount of merchandise to be able to sell them at wholesale to the textile manufacturers in the city of Juliaca. The wish of this hard-working mother is to obtain a loan to invest in her business. She waits for your friendly helping hand to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Su perseverancia, voluntad de superación y el deseo de ver a sus hijos con un prominente porvenir; son las razones que tiene doña Alejandrina para esforzarse día a día con mucha constancia en su noble labor de comercialización de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca. Ella es madre de dos hijos adolescentes, al observar que el ingreso económico que su esposo obtenía como panadero no cubría todas las necesidades de su familia decidió buscar la manera de generar ingresos extras, ahora su labor de comercialización de lana de oveja y alpaca viene generándole mucha complacencia; porque rápidamente está obteniendo buenos beneficios.Esta encantadora dama adquiere su mercadería de los diferentes comuneros de la provincia de Ayaviri que después de trasquilar cuidadosamente sus ganados proceden a vender su lana; ella trata de juntar considerable cantidad de mercadería para luego ofrecerlos al por mayor a los empresarios textiles de la ciudad de Juliaca.El deseo de esta laboriosa madre es adquirir un préstamo para invertirlos en su negocio. Ella espera tu mano amiga para salir adelante.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase additional quantities of wool.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
We find Alejandra and her charming husband located in front of a school in the city of Ayaviri, offering a wiD. variety of sweets, cookies, sodas, etc. for sale to the students and other pedestrians in said city. Alejandra is 56 years old and her loving husband is 71. They always have been entrepreneurial and hardworking people; both are from Ayaviri. Since starting their family, they dedicated themselves to working the land, a noble enterprise that helped them educate their son who is now a professional and living independently. They retired from this labor when they found it became too physically demanding as they grew older. For this reason, they decided to invest their savings and start a business selling snacks/sweets. This activity brings them much joy, as it provides them with financial stability and peace. The wish of this humble couple is to prosper in this endeavor and, to do this, they are considering purchasing another tricycle/tram and additional products with which to expand their sales efforts. Let’s help seal the plans of this loving couple.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Frente a un colegio D. la ciudad D. Ayaviri ubicamos a doña Alejandra y a su encantador esposo Patricio ofreciendo gran variedad D. golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, etc. a los estudiantes D. dicho centro D. estudios y transeúntes en general.Alejandra D. 56 años y su amoroso esposo D. 71 años D. edad siempre fueron personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, ambos son D. la ciudad D. Ayaviri y desD. que formaron su familia se dedicaron ha labrar la tierra, con este noble oficio educaron a su hijo, quien ahora es profesional e independiente, dejaron esta labor porque ya no cuentan con la misma fuerza física D. antes, es por esa razón que decidieron invertir el ahorro que tenían e incursionar en el negocio D. venta D. golosinas, esta actividad les viene generando mucha alegría porque les está permitiendo obtener bienestar económico y tranquilidad.El deseo D. esta humilD. pareja es prosperar con este oficio, para eso tiene pensado adquirir otro triciclo y mayor cantidad D. productos con el fin D. ampliar su mercado. Ayudemos a concretar los planes D. esta amorosa pareja.

loans.use: Purchase a tricycle/tram and additional merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
A few months ago, Luz inherited her parents’ small and humble bakery. She learned this noble trade, which she loves so dearly, when she was very young. Because of her affinity, she has been able to move her bakery forward through efforts and perseverance, turning it into one of the biggest and most frequented bakeries in the city. Ms. Luz starts preparing her delicious, assorted breads from 1:00 to 7:00 in the morning, with the help of other people. After distributing her bread in the different shops and shopping centers throughout the city of Ayaviri, she helps her husband Manuel in his cattle business, thus offering their beloved family comfort and well-being. Luz would like to buy a mixer in order to accelerate her efforts as a baker. She appeals to your good heart with that goal in mind. Your generous support will help make Ms. Luz’s plans concrete.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz hace algunos meses heredó la pequeña y humilde panadería de sus padres, desde muy niña aprendió este noble oficio, por el que siente un especial cariño, gracias a esto ahora con mucho empeño y perseverancia está logrando sacar adelante su panadería, convirtiéndola en una de las más grandes y solicitadas de su ciudad.La señora Luz inicia su labor diaria con la elaboración de sus deliciosos y variados panes desde la 1:00 de la madrugada hasta las 7:00 de mañana con apoyo de otras dos personas, luego de distribuirlas en las diferentes bodeguitas y centros comerciales de la ciudad de Ayaviri apoya a su esposo Manuel en su actividad de comercialización de ganado, y así entre los dos tratan de ofrecerles bienestar y comodidad a su amada familia.Con el fin de agilizar su trabajo tiene pensado comprar una máquina batidora, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón.“ Vuestra desinteresada ayuda permitirá concretar los planes de doña Luz”

loans.use: Purchase of mixer

loans.name: Raúl Percy

texts.es:
Raúl is a 25-year old, energetic and hardworking father. For the past two years has dedicated himself to the sale of leather and wool, merchandise that he buys on fair days in the districts of Ocuviri, Cupi and Pucará which border the city of Ayaviri. He sells them at wholesale to a textile enterprise in the city of Arequipa, where they manufacture very fine and beautiful sweaters, shawls, coats and gloves, and countless products to be exported overseas. He inherited the business, which he carries out with much patience and diligence, from his parents who dedicated themselves to this work their whole lives. It has now become the means of sustenance for Raúl and his own family. His wish is to augment the capital of his business, for which he turns to you for assistance. Let’s grant his wish so he can continue to support his family’s progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl es un vigoroso y trabajador padre de 25 años de edad, desde hace dos años viene dedicándose a la comercialización de cuero, lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca, mercadería que compra los días de feria en los distritos de Ocuviri, Cupi y Pucará, pueblitos limítrofes de la ciudad de Ayaviri y los vende al por mayor a una empresa textil de la ciudad de Arequipa en donde fabrican finísimas y hermosas chompas, chales, abrigos, guantes e infinidad de productos que son exportados al exterior.Este oficio que desempeña con mucha paciencia y diligencia lo heredó de sus padres, quienes toda su vida estuvieron dedicados a esta labor, y ahora se ha convertido en el ingreso principal de Raúl y su familia.Su deseo es aumentar el capital de su negocio, para eso requiere de vuestra ayuda.Posibilitemos su petición para que su familia siga progresando.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase additional quantifies of wool and leather.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad is an eager and humble mother who, for many years, has dedicated herself to the sale of “chicharrónes” (pork rinds) and seasonal wares. Her trade allows her to provide an education and well-being for her young children. In the current season, she has decided to sell a variety of water-proof ponchos (capes) that provide protection from the rain. She brings her wholesale merchandise from the city of Juliaca and sells her products in an ambulatory manner through the busiest streets of her native town, Ayaviri. This business, which sees great demand, permits her to improve her standard of living and that of her family. For this reason, she wishes to expand her market and offer her products in neighboring towns. To seal her plan, she needs to obtain a loan to invest in the purchase of additional merchandise. “Natividad needs your generous heart to get ahead.”

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad es una afanosa y humilde madre, desde hace muchos años viene dedicándose a la venta de Chicharrón y artículos por campañas, oficios que le permiten brindar educación y bienestar a sus dos hijos menores. Ahora en esta temporada decidió ofrecer gran variedad de ponchos impermeables para la lluvia, mercadería que trae al por mayor de la ciudad de Juliaca y los ofrece en forma ambulatoria por las arterias más concurridas de su pueblo natal Ayaviri.Este negocio que está teniendo gran demanda le permite mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia, es por esa razón que desea ampliar su mercado y para eso tiene pensado ofrecer sus productos en los diferentes pueblitos limítrofes de su ciudad, para concretar su proyecto requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que lo invertirá en adquirir más mercadería.“Natividad requiere de tu generoso corazón para salir adelante”

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire a greater quantity of ponchos to take to neighboring towns.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
The business of red meat sales is proving profitable to Hilda who, at 40 years of age, is the hard-working mother of three children. For the past 20 years she has dedicated herself to purchasing, feeding and caring for sheep until they reach the appropriate weight. She offers fresh meat from her butcher shop to her customers. This enterprise, which she carries out with the support of her family, is allowing her to help her children get ahead. Thanks to her great efforts, they will shortly complete their high school studies. Hilda’s wish is to increase her business capital, which is why she seeks a loan she can invest in her business for additional yields. We can all help her reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de venta de carnes rojas le está resultado rentable a la señora Hilda de 40 años de edad, ella es madre empeñosa de 3 hijos, desde hace 20 años está dedicada a comprar ovinos, luego de cuidarlos y alimentarlos diligentemente para que tomen un peso y tamaño adecuado procede a degollarlos y vender su fresca carne a sus clientes ya selectos.Este oficio que desempeña con apoyo de su familia le esta permitiendo impulsar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes gracias al esfuerzo de su madre dentro de muy poco tiempo concluirán sus estudios superiores.El deseo de Hilda es aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese fin hace la solicitud de un préstamo que luego de su inversión le permitirá obtener mayores beneficios. Vosotros podemos ayudar a conseguir la meta que se ha planteado.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase a greater quantity of small animals.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is a very responsible person who is dedicated to his family. A few years ago, he suffered the painful loss of his wife, and since then he had to become both father and mother for his 4 young children. This exemplary father sought to provide the best example, love and affection for his offspring, trying to somehow fill the void left by the passing of their mother. David took on many jobs in order to earn sufficient income and be able to offer food and shelter to his children. He currently buys and sells American apparel, which he purchases in bundles in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, then sells in Rinconada. This business helps him pay the rent, food, and his children’s education. He would like to take this opportunity to appeal to your generous heart, requesting the loan in order to purchase greater quantities of merchandise. David appreciates the trust you give him through your help.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

David, es padre muy responsable y dedicado a su familia, hace algunos años sufrió la penosa pérdida de su amada esposa, desde entonces se convirtió en padre y madre de sus cuatro menores hijos. Este ejemplar padre en todo momento buscó ofrecerles el mejor ejemplo, amor y cariño posible a sus pequeños retoños, para cubrir de alguna manera el gran vacío que dejó en sus vidas la partida de su madre. David se desempeñó en diferentes oficios con el fin de obtener suficientes ingresos y poder brindarles alimentación y cuidado a sus hijos.Actualmente está dedicado a la compra y venta de ropas americanas, mercadería que adquiere por fardos en la ciudad de la Paz – Bolivia y los vende en la mina Rinconada; este negocio le permite cubrir el alquiler de vivienda que comparte con sus amorosos hijos, alimentación y educación de sus pequeños.En esta oportunidad recurre a vuestro generoso corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías.David agradece la confianza que le brindas a través de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantities of apparel

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
A few months ago, Carmen decided to invest the money, which cost her time and effort to set aside, in setting up a grocery and beverage store. At first, this business did not seem very lucrative, but little by little with her perseverance, the store yielded good economic benefits. She started out with a small amount of products in an inadequate business space, but now, thanks to her hard work and dedication, things have changed for the better. Her little store currently has many loyal customers, allowing her and her elderly father—who is her only relative—to enjoy financial stability and well-being. Carmen is planning to increase her stock, and for this reason, she is requesting this loan and your generous support. Your generosity can help crystallize Carmen’s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace algunos meses Carmen, decidió invertir el dinero que le había costado mucho esfuerzo reunir durante mucho tiempo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y variedad de bebidas, este negocio en un principio no parecía ser muy rentable, pero poco a poco con su constancia le fue trayendo buenos beneficios económicos. Inició con poca mercadería y en un local no muy adecuado, ahora gracias a su dedicación y empeño las cosas han cambiado. Actualmente su tiendita tiene gran cantidad de asiduos clientes permitiéndole así gozar de bienestar y tranquilidad económica en compañía de su anciano padre quien es su único familiar.Carmen tiene pensado ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, para eso requiere de tu apoyo desinteresado y hace la solicitud de un préstamo. Tu generosidad puede ayudar a cristalizar los sueños de Carmen”

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity and variety of goods for general store

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
The buying and selling of sheep and alpaca wool has always been a good business for Mrs. Fortunata, fighter, mother of two children that she adores and who keep her motoring on. A few years ago, she and her husband mutually agreed to separate and since then she has been in charge of the family, looking out for the wellbeing and security of each one. Mrs. Fortunata acquires her material at the plaza Dominical and Las Mercedes in Juliaca and adds the sheep and alpaca wool to the mix and sells it to a textile company. Her two sons have finished their secondary studies and will now be enrolling in pre-university courses, which will ultimately increase the family’s expenses. She would like to increase her working capital so that she can cover the cost of running the household and the new expenses that will be incurred. Your help will permit this hard-working mother to accomplish her goals.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca siempre le resultó muy rentable para la señora Fortunata madre luchadora de dos hijos, quienes son su adoración y motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante.Hace algunos años en mutuo acuerdo decidió separarse de su esposo, desde entonces quedó a cargo de su familia velando por el bienestar y seguridad de cada uno de sus miembros; doña Fortunata adquiere su mercadería en la plaza Dominical y las Mercedes de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca los vende a una empresa textil.Sus dos queridos hijos ya concluyeron sus estudios secundarios y este año requieren inscribirse a una academia PRE-Universitaria, razón por la cual sus gastos económicos se incrementarán. Para poder cubrir cada una de sus necesidades tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital de trabajo, esta inversión le permitirá cubrir todos sus gastos familiares. Vuestra ayuda permitirá el cumplimiento de los objetivos de esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: Increase capital to acquire more wool in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Up until four years ago, Lidia lived in her hometown of Huancane. Upon realizing that her children needed to pursue their high school studies and broaden their knowledge, she and her husband decided to move to the city of Juiliaca, where her children could obtain a high-quality education. They invested what few savings they had in the purchase of two sewing machines, and with these tools they started to manufacture backpacks to sell wholesale in the San José market. Both parents, with the help of their children, work hard in order to move their little factory forward. Thanks to their efforts, the have been able to build their humble home. These industrious parents wish to convert their little sewing factory into one of the biggest in their city, and with the profits earned offer their four children financial stability and more importantly, an education. In order to bring these projects to fruition, they are requesting a loan that will be invested in the manufacturing of their backpacks, thus filling all their orders. Your collaboration will allow Ms. Lidia and her family to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia hasta hace cuatro años, vivía en su pueblo natal de Huancane, al ver que sus hijos ya ingresaban a cursar estudios secundarios y necesitaban mejorar sus conocimientos, decidió junto a su esposo radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca con el fin de que sus pequeños puedan obtener una educación de calidad.El poco ahorro con el que contaban al llegar a la ciudad de Juliaca lo invirtieron en la compra de dos máquinas de coser y con estas herramientas iniciaron la fabricación de mochilas escolares para venderlos al por mayor en el mercado San José, ambos padres con apoyo de sus hijos se esforzaron mucho para sacar adelante su tallercito, gracias a eso actualmente han construido su humilde morada.El deseo de estos laboriosos padres es hacer de su pequeño taller uno de los más grandes de su ciudad y con las ganancias que obtengan brindarles estabilidad y sobre todo educación a sus cuatro hijos.Para concretar sus proyectos requieren obtener un préstamo de dinero que será invertido en la fabricación de sus cómodas mochilas y así cumplir con la gran cantidad de solicitudes.Vuestra colaboración permitirá el cumplimiento de los objetivos de doña Lidia y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity of materials needed to make backpacks

loans.name: Yaquelyn's Group

texts.en:
Yaquelyn and Teodora have been members of the community bank “Señor de los Milagros” for eight months and two years respectively.  In their bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and above all to save.  
Yaquelyn is 21 years old.  She has been selling cosmetics to her friends and family for one year.  Yaquelyn is an accountant by profession and works for a public institution.  In addition, four months ago she started selling shoes. Teodora is 43 years old and is married with two children.  In the past, Teodora also sold cosmetics, but was not successful.  Now, Teodora sells typical food and beverages from her house.  She does this on the weekends and during the week she works as a secretary.
Yaquelyn and Teodora need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles =$1), which they will use to buy shoes, rice, sugar, beer, and soft drinks.
One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Yaquelyn and Teodora plan to use their savings to further develop their existing businesses, and open a new business.  Their dreams are that their children will be professionals and they can complete their masters degree.

loans.use: Yaquelyn and Teodora request loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles =$1), which they will use to buy shoes, rice, sugar, beer, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.en:
Teresa, Paulina, and Lucia are members of the community bank “Gracias Morenita”.  They have belonged for eight months, two years, and four years respectively.  In that time they have learned values that help them in their daily lives, and the importance of saving.
Teresa is 38 years old.  She lives with her partner and three children.  Teresa sells “salchipollos”, a typical dish consisting of chicken and french-fries, from a cart in the center of the city.  Teresa has had this business for many years.
Paulina is 40 years old.  She is married and has six children.  Paulina sells prepared food from a stand in the Magdalena Market of Ayacucho.
Meanwhile, Lucia is 39 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Lucia is an artisan.  She weaves a variety of products such as tapestries, and bedspreads.  Her workshop is located in her home, and she sells her products at the Vivanco market of Ayacucho.
Teresa, Paulina, and Lucia need loans of 200, 400, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy oil, plates, spoons, plastic table wear, potatoes, rice, and wool.
One of the important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate receives. Teresa, Paulina, and Lucia plan to use their savings to buy a piece of land and pay for their children’s school.  Their dreams are to own a pretty house, have a successful business, and see their children become professionals.

loans.use: Teresa, Paulina, and Lucia need loans of 200, 400, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy oil, plates, spoons, plastic table wear, potatoes, rice, and wool.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has always worked hard to give her son the best. He’s now 18 years old and is working so he can help out with household expenses. Ever since he was born, she was forced to take up the responsibilities of both mother and father and she did so by knitting sweaters and different pieces of clothing. With her sister, she was able to offer her services to different companies. As time went on, she perfected her skills, and now knits clothing for retail in the markets where she lives. Her big dream is to form an association of knitters so they can import what they produce. To continue progressing toward her goal, she’s asking for a loan to invest in guinea pigs, so she can begin raising them and selling them. Support this courageous woman so she and her family can continue forward.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria siempre ha trabajado arduamente porque desea conseguir lo mejor para su hijo que actualmente tiene 18 años y trabaja para ser también un sostén de los gastos de su hogar, ella desde que su hijo nació tuvo que desempeñar las responsabilidades de padre y madre y lo hizo dedicándose al tejido a mano de chompas y diferentes prendas de vestir, fue así que en compañía de su querida hermana ofreció sus servicios a diferentes fábricas y con el tiempo su técnica se ha ido perfeccionando y ahora teje prendas para comercializarlas en las ferias de su localidad. Su gran anhelo es formar una asociación de tejedoras para que puedan exportar lo que producen. Para seguir progresando y alcanzar su anhelada meta a mediano plazo solicita un préstamo, los cuales invertirá en la compra de cuyes para dedicarse también a la crianza de cuyes como un ingreso más para la encomia de los suyos. Apoya a esta mujer de gran coraje a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Establish a guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Ivis

texts.es:
Ivis works incessantly every day selling gelatin desserts which she carries on a tray. She sells in different parts of the city, mostly at festivals and sporting events. Each day she leaves her house early in the morning and when she comes back with an empty tray, she’s happy because she knows she has made enough to maintain her 4 children for one day. Doing this and with the work her husband does, who also takes care of the kids, she is able to cover the most urgent household necessities. She dreams that one day she’ll have a kiosk at the market where she can sell her gelatin desserts. Let’s support Ivis’s desire to see her children do better each day.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Ivis, trabaja incesantemente cada día en la venta de gelatinas de manera ambulante, siempre vende en los diferentes puntos de la ciudad, sobre todo en las fiestas y eventos deportivos, cada día ella sale de su casa temprano y cuando regresa con la bandeja vacía de sus ventas está contenta porque sabe que es el sustento diario para cuatro hijos. Con esta actividad y también con el trabajo de su esposo que a veces apoya con la manutención de sus hijos ha podido cubrir durante años las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar.Ella sueña en que algún día tendrá un puesto en el mercado para comercializar sus gelatinas.Apoyemos a Ivis a seguir adelante con sus deseos de ver a sus hijos superándose día a día.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to offer the public a better selection of desserts.

loans.name: Agustina's Group

texts.en:
Agustina and Mariela have been part of the community bank “Los Milagros” for close to one year.  In the community bank they have learned how to invest in their business, avoid sickness, and to manage their businesses more efficiently.
Agustina is 37 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Agustina sells food from a stand in the Nery Garcia market.  She has been doing this for one year.  In addition,  Agustina sells tuna, a local fruit, which comes from a cactus, and grains.  Agustina is planning on starting a new business selling candy in addition to her other businesses.  
Mariela is 21 years old.  She is a single mother and has a two-year-old daughter.  Mariela sells shoes in the city of Ayacucho.  The business is actually owned by Mariela’s mother.  In addition, Mariela works on a local television channel.
Agustina and Mariela each need loans of 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying candy, rice, meat, and potatoes.  Another part of their loan will be used to pay for their children’s education.  
They plan to use their savings to increase the capital available to their businesses and opening a store selling food staples such as rice, sugar and flour.

loans.use: Agustina and Mariela each need loans of 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying candy, rice, meat, and potatoes.  Another part of their loan will be used to pay for their children’s education.

loans.name: Juana Gliceria's Group

texts.en:
Julia, Maria, and Juana have been members of the community bank “8 of September” for one year.  They are all from the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.  In their community bank they have learned to save, how to manage their businesses, and to work in unity with the other associates.
Julia is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner and two young children.  For the past three years Julia has been selling food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar.  She also sells fruits and vegetables
Maria is 30 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Maria, together with her husband, have a workshop where they make doors, windows, and fix bicycles.  They have had this business for the past four years.
Meanwhile, Juana is 41 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Juana owns a store where she sells food staples.
Julia, Maria, and Juana need loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, pasta, tuna fish, milk, beer, soft drinks, and bicycle repair parts.
One of the most important parts of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives. Julia, Maria, and Juana plan to use their savings to pay for any emergency that comes up, to buy a piece of land, and to pay for their children’s education.  Their dreams are to own a home, see their business progress, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Julia, Maria, and Juana need loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, pasta, tuna fish, milk, beer, soft drinks, and bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati, 36, is married to O. and has a child aged 17. She has a food stall where she sells fresh food such as Indonesian salad called 'gado-gado'; an Indonesian sauce based on peanuts, called 'pecel'; and snacks, etc., earning about $15 a day, while her husband sells chickens at the market and earns about $23 a day. To add to her business capital, Ati is asking for a loan of $125. As a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Dorotea's Group

texts.en:
Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana have been part of the community bank “8th of September”  between six months and one year.  They all live in the district of Acosyinchos, which is one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.  In the community bank they have learned how to care for their health, invest their money, and how to run their businesses more efficiently.
Ricardina is 31 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Ricardina raises and then butchers pigs.  She then sells them to people in her village.
Dorotea is 37 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Dorotea, together with her husband, cuts firewood and kindling.  She sells is to middlemen who take it to Ayacucho and to the coast.  Dorotea would like to open a bakery.
Meanwhile, Juana is 35 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Juana sells a variety of grains in the city of Ayacucho.  She buys the grains in the town of Acosyinchos.  In addition, Juana occasionally sells meat.
Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana need loans of 450, 450, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pigs, eucalyptus wood, barley, wheat, corn, and quinoa.
One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana plan to use their savings to educate their children, and if there is an emergency.  Their dreams are that their children will study and have a better life then they do.

loans.use: Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana need loans of 450, 450, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pigs, eucalyptus wood, barley, wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Zenaida's Group

texts.en:
Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecilia are members of the community bank “Gracias Morenita”.  They have belonged for one year, four months, and eight months respectively.  In the community bank they have learned to save, to be punctual, to be honest, and to be organized in their business.
Zenaida is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Zenaida sells food from a cart in the suburb of Enace.  In addition, on Saturdays and Sundays Zenaida sells cebiche, a typical dish maD. from marinating fish in lemon juice, from her house.
Yudith is 18 years old.  She has a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar.  Yudith’s father helped her start the business so that she would be able to pay for school.  Yudith is studying accounting and in her free time she does accounting for a small office.
Cecilia is 24 years old and lives with her partner and two children.  Cecilia sells fruit from a cart near the bus station.  Previously, Cecilia had a laundry business but her niece convinced her that fruit would be more profitable.
Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecelia need loans of 200, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, sugar, soap, detergent, mangos, apples, grapes, other regional fruits, plates, cups, and spoons.
Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecelia dream of owning a home, giving their children a good education, and becoming professionals.

loans.use: Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecelia need loans of 200, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, sugar, soap, detergent, mangos, apples, grapes, other regional fruits, plates, cups, and spoons.

loans.name: Olivia's Group

texts.en:
Celia, Yolanda, and Olivia have been part of the community bank “Orquideas” for one year.  In the community bank they have learned to be punctual, responsible, use family planning techniques, and how to treat their children.
Celia is 40 years old.  She is separated from her husband and has three children.  Celia owns a bar and restaurant.  Previously, she sold shish kabob from a cart, but stopped when she was able to open the restaurant.  
Yolanda is 39 years old.  She is married and has three children. Yolanda makes breads such as “chapla”, a traditional bread similar to pita.  She rents an oven to be able to make her bread and then sells it to stores.
Olivia is 55 years old.  She is married and has six children, three of whom live with her.  Olivia sells fruits from a cart in the Magdalena market.  
Celia, Yolanda, and Olivia each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, candies, rice, and flour.
One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Celia, Yolanda, and Olivia plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s school.
Their dreams are to improve their business, own their own oven, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Celia, Yolanda, and Olivia each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, candies, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Sutinah

texts.en: Sutinah, 47, is married to W. who does not have a fixed job. They have 2 daughters, aged 13 and 8. So to earn income for the family, she sells snacks and flavoured ice at her small stall in front of her house, earning about $10 a day with a very small profit margin. Now she is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her stall so she will be able to increase her income. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has been a member of the community bank “8th of September” for 18 months.  She is from the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.
Sonia is 32 years old, and by profession she is a nurse.  She makes andean shingles, which are used on most of the roofs in the area.  She learned this profession from her parents.  Sonia mentioned that in the past she was able to produce very little, but with loans from the community bank she is able to produce much more.  She sells her products in her native town to people who then transport them to other villages in the area.
In addition, Sonia works as a nurse in the city of Cangallo.  While she is working as a nurse her sister helps with the tile business.
Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wood and pay laborers.  
One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Sonia plans to use her savings to build a home, and to start a new business selling food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar.  Her dream is to continue studying and specialize in anesthesiology and to have a successful business.

loans.use: Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wood and pay laborers.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia has been a member of the community bank “8th of September” for two years.  She is a native of the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.
Lidia is 28 years old, and by profession a nurse.  Lidia has a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar.  In addition she sells a variety of medications.  Lidia rents a building in the main plaza of the district.  When she started Lidia sold very few products, but little by little, thanks to the loans from the community bank, her business has continued to grow.
As a member of the community bank she has learned how to keep her children healthy, avoid domestic violence, and how to manage her business efficiently.
Lidia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, eggs, firewood, and different medicines.
One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Lidia plans to use her savings to study a specialization.  Her dream is to build a house, raise more capital, and start a new business with a motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: Lidia requests a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, eggs, firewood, and different medicines.

loans.name: Ijah

texts.en: Ijah is a 40-year-old widow. Her only child has already married. To support herself, she sells food at her small stall in front of her house, earning about $10 a day. She is requesting a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her stall and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her food stall

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf M. is a 40 year old man, married and has three children. Merdan lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He rents a small café and this business is family's only income. He established his business five years ago. He has borrowed three loans from Normicro and has expanded his business. Rauf has again applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $700. He would like to purchase new equipment for his café.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Elburus

texts.en: Elburus S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 51 years old, married and has four children. He owns and operates a small butcher shop in the city center. Elburus established his business six years ago. He needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa’s works made by hand are an art that are very beautiful, each day she dedicates herself laboriously to embroider her patterns in different items of clothing, typical of the area, that are utilized by the costumed dancers like el Huaylash. With the passage of the years she saw that this was a valuable experience in her life, since she was 14 years old she has learned this art and dedicated herself to it for many hours perfecting her skill, nowadays she splits her time between homework and her work. She covers the requests of her demanding clients and she also thinks to embroider the jackets that she uses as clothing of the typical dance of Huaylash, a work well done with this type of embroidery will take her 3 days for the quantity of threads that she uses to clarify the colors of the flowers and the little animals. Despite the existence of machine embroidery and until computerized this does not matter to Narcisa it only forces her to continue creating her embroidery and elevating her creativity. With the noble intention of continuing her work this noble mother requests your help to obtain a loan to acquire a better quantity of fabrics and threads

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Los trabajos hechos con las manos de Narcisa son todo un arte ya que son muy bellos, cada día ella se dedica muy laboriosamente a bordar sus trabajos en diferentes prendas de vestir, típicas de la zona, que son utilizadas para las danzas costumbristas como el Huaylash, chonguinada entre otras. Con el pasar de los años ella ve que es una experiencia muy valiosa en su vida, desde que tenía 14 años aprendió este arte y a la cual dedica muchas horas para perfeccionarla, actualmente reparte su tiempo entre las tareas de la casa y su trabajo. Cubre los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes y piensa también bordar los chalecos que se utilizan como indumentaria de la danza típica del Huaylash, un trabajo bien hecho con este tipo de bordados le llevará hacerlo en tres días por la cantidad de hilos que utiliza para matizar los colores de las flores y o animalitos.A pesar de que ahora existen bordados a máquina y hasta computarizados esto no acobarda a Narcisa aún más la fortalece para seguir innovando sus bordados y elevar su creatividad.Con el noble propósito de continuar su desempeño esta noble madre solicita vuestra ayuda a fin de obtener el préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de telas e hilos.

loans.use: To purchase a better quantity of fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Aybeth

texts.es:
Aybeth is a hard worker with perseverance. Her desires to better herself push her ahead and keep her from being brought down by her economic situation. For this reason, she decided to start up a store in her house. The income from the store is not enough to support the household and her children, who also work at the store and study to have a better future. She supports her husband and maintains the house and children, even though she’s in the last months of her pregnancy. She’s very happy with the store, hoping to grow the business and trusts that it will happen. She pays attention to the quality of service she offers and the quality of products she has, in order to increase sales. At this time, school days are approaching and she’d like to increase her stock by adding school supplies and hardware items. In order to get these supplies, she is asking for a loan. Support Aybeth as she moves forward fighting for a better future for her children.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Aybeth, es muy trabajadora y empeñosa, sus deseos de superación la animan y empujan a sobresalir y a no dejarse abatir por las circunstancias de carencia económica y es por esta razón que ha decidido recientemente implementar una tienda en su casa, las ganancias que percibe muchas veces son insuficientes para sostener un hogar donde sus niños hacen su parte trabajando y estudiando para superarse y tener un buen futuro. Ella apoya a su esposo en el sostén de sus dos hijos con su desempeño diario a pesar de que se encuentra en los últimos meses de embarazo. Su nueva ocupación la mantiene muy contenta porque espera crecer y confía en que así será; la atención cálida que ofrece día a día, los precios y la calidad de sus productos son detalles que cuida para asegurar el incremento de las ventas en su tienda. Para esta época en el que se acerca de la campaña escolar desea incrementar sus ganancias con la venta de algunos útiles escolares y también de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para lo cual solicita un préstamo. Apoya a Aybeth a seguir adelante para seguir luchando por un futuro prometedor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to offer school supplies and hardware items in the store.

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. He owns and operates a small café in Beylagan city bazaar. He has six years of experience in this business. His customers are people who work in the city bazaar. He is one of the best clients of Normicro. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $900, which he plans to use to expand his business and increase his number of customers.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Carmen Del Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen has a business selling fish and various other products. She got the idea for this business a year ago, when she saw a need in her neighborhood. Now she has become one of the main providers of fish in her area, converting a space especially for the business, and stocking it with popular vegetables as well. She starts early in the mornings and buys the fish wholesale. Thanks to this work, she is improving the economic situation for her family. Carmen has 5 children, but one of them is already independent, so Carmen works to take care of and educate the others. She is requesting a loan to expand her work space and increase the quantity and variety of the products she offers. This hardworking mother needs your support to continue improving the quality of life for her family.

Carmen, es una microempresaria de carne de pescado y helados de crema. La idea de involucrarse le surgió hace un año cuando vio que las vecinas de su barrio necesitaban comprar en una zona cercana el pescado; ahora ella se ha convertido en una de las proveedoras de carne de pescado de su barrio en un espacio de ventas que acondicionó para este fin y a la cual inteligentemente ha surtido de verduras de preferencia sale en las mañanas y muy temprano se dirige a los camiones de reparto de carne de pescado para comprar al por mayor. Gracias a esta actividad puede ser no solo la proveedora de carne de pescado en su barrio sino también una de las proveedoras de recursos para mejorar la economía de su hogar, ella es madre de cinco hijos pero uno de ellos ya puede sostenerse por si solo; ahora trabaja para poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos.Carmen quiere ampliar su espacio de ventas e incrementar la cantidad y variedad de artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece, con este fin solicita un préstamo. Recuerda que una mujer responsable es una madre que lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y en este caso Carmen necesita de tu apoyo para seguir haciéndolo.

loans.use: TO INCREASE HER WORK SPACE AND PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF PRODUCTS TO SELL.

loans.name: Zara

texts.es:
From the time Zara was very young, she has dedicated herself to work. She did not allow her lack of a profession and her humble economic situation to become obstacles. Her four years of studies in cosmetology have opened doors for her which she'd never imagined. The quality of the work she offers has turned her into a well respected and well known professional in her area. She offers haircuts, styling, tints, etc. Her clients like that she offers a service in their homes, and she is also asked by a friend of hers, who owns a salon, to work occasionally as a stylist there as well. Zara is happy with what she has achieved and this fills her with satisfaction. But she continues to work hard because she hopes to one day have her own salon in the city center, as well as other branches throughout the country. This great vision that she has is motivated by her love for her 3 children. Zara wants to improve the infrastructure of their house as well as invest in more supplies for her business. You can help this hardworking woman achieve her goals.

Zara, desde muy joven a trabajado dedicándose al comercio, luego que se unió a su esposo la responsabilidad de trabajar fue mayor y siempre sus ansias de prepararse para la vida aunque no puede acceder a una profesión por su humilde situación económica no fueron obstáculos para encontrar su vocación a la que hoy se dedica; después de estudiar en un centro de educación ocupacional hace 4 años la carrera técnica de cosmetología ha abierto puertas que jamás imaginó, la calidad del trabajo que ofrece la ha convertido en una cosmetóloga bien dedicada y de prestigio en su zona, por el momento ofrece sus servicios de cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, etc. al gusto de su clientela y lo mejor es que lo solicitan en su hogar, ahora ofrece un servicio a domicilio y ocasionalmente una de sus amigas dueña de un centro de belleza la llama para que ella sea una de sus estilistas. Zara está contenta de ejercer lo que le agrada y eso la llena de satisfacción más no de conformismo porque desea a futuro tener su propio centro de belleza en el centro de la ciudad para incrementar con el tiempo sucursales en todo su país. Esa gran visión que posee es motivada por el amor ilimitado que siente por sus tres hijos. Para seguir brindando comodidades a sus hijos desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y comprar algunos insumos de cosmetología. Colabora con Zara, una mujer con muchos deseos de disfrutar la vida al lado de los suyos.

loans.use: TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS ON HER SMALL HOME AND PURCHASE ADDITIONAL SUPPLIES FOR HER COSMETOLOGY BUSINESS.

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Hafiz S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old and married. He rents a small food-market in Beylagan, and he started this business two years ago. Hafiz needs a loan in the amount of $350 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka J. is a 43 year old woman, and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in Beylagan, a small city in  Azerbaijan. She and her husband have a business of cattle-breeding. They established their business ten years ago. Maleyka needs a loan in the amount of $1075 to purchase a cow and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Doña Teófila is a fighting woman that has not allowed the passage of years to diminish the value of her work and as such has always set a solid example for many youths of today. She was born in a clearly agricultural family of Pampas in the city of Huancavelica that taught the hard work of tilling the land and also the joint effort of an arduous work. She has been dedicated for 30 years to agriculture; sowing corn, potatoes and beans in an independent way. When her marriage moved her to the city of Huancayo she continued being dedicated to the agriculture for short periods. In that time it was necessary to do it that way so that her children could study in the city. Her great wish is to collaborate with the studies of her small grandchildren and for this reason she travels periodically to Pampas to verify how the crops are doing. At harvest time she works to market directly in the wholesale market of her locality in order to obtain the profits. Teófila requests a loan to acquire a greater quantity of fertilizer with the objective of improving the quality of her products. Support Teófila and her desire to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teófila, es una mujer luchadora que no ha dejado que el paso D. los años disminuya el valor D. su trabajo y es así que siempre se ha mantenido con fuerzas siendo un ejemplo para muchos jóvenes D. hoy. Nació en una familia netamente agricultora D. Pampas en la ciudad D. Huancavelica que le enseñó el duro trabajo D. labrar la tierra y también el esfuerzo conjunto D. un trabajo arduo; se dedica desD. hace 30 años a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, papa y habas D. manera independiente al contraer matrimonio se desplazó a la ciudad D. Huancayo y siguió dedicándose a la agricultura por temporadas, en aquella época era necesario hacerlo D. esa manera para que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la ciudad. Su gran anhelo es colaborar con los estudios D. sus pequeños nietos y por esta razón viaja periódicamente a Pampas para verificar como están los cultivos y en el tiempo D. cosecha se dedica a comercializar directamente en el mercado mayorista D. su localidad para luego obtener las ganancias. Teófila solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. abonos con el objetivo D. mejorar la calidad D. sus productos.. Apoya a Teófila y sus deseos D. trabajar arduamente.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen always applies her creativity in the moments when it is necessary to live frugally. Her ingenuity has brought her to work in multiple positions for several years but for 8 years she has worked selling cosmetics for different companies, chiefly Ésika and Avon, turning up in the homes of her friends and neighbors. Each day counting also on the support of one of her sisters that has a store at home, she can increase her sales by putting in a product showcase in which she brings to light the benefits of the products and the new items. The quality of her dealings assures the sales of her cosmetics. Now Carmen wants to overcome her difficulties and to resume her interrupted studies, to be able in this manner to continue being dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. Her objective is to give to her small son all that is needed for his development. Her husband at present is a cabdriver and many times his income is insufficient, which motivates her to continue with what she proposes to do. We support her petition so that she can quickly become the best saleswoman of cosmetics of her city.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La creatividad de Carmen siempre se aplica en los momentos donde es necesario el sustento económico. Su ingenio la ha llevado a dedicarse por varios a años a múltiples oficios pero hace 8 a la venta de cosméticos de diversas compañías, principalmente de Ésika y Avon, acudiendo a casa de sus amistades y vecinos, cada día contando también con el apoyo de una de sus hermanas que tiene una tienda en casa, puedo incrementar sus ventas poniendo una vitrina de exposición en el que da a conocer las bondades de los productos y las novedades, la calidez de su trato aseguran las ventas de sus cosméticos. Ahora Carmen está deseosa de superar sus dificultades y reanudar sus estudios interrumpidos de educación para poder de esta manera seguir dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos, su objetivo es darle a su pequeño hijito todo lo necesario para su desarrollo. Su esposo actualmente es taxista y muchas veces los ingresos son insuficientes lo cual es un motivo más para que continúe con lo que se ha propuesto.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto pueda convertirse en la mejor vendedora de cosméticos de su ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 58 years old, married and has two children. He owns a chemist near his home, which he started two years ago. He has one employee who helps him with his business. Yusuf needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to purchase more kinds of medicine and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi has always been very diligent. She works incessantly to be able to offer the best to her small children. Her youth and her desire to get ahead give her the strength to conquer all obstacles. She sells kebabs and skewers of chicken in the door of her house all afternoon. The good seasoning that she uses has brought success to her business and she will continue ahead with this activity. She would like to improve her business quickly by buying another grill in better condition, since she would like in the future to open a store in her house in order to continue progressing and to have her own house. At present she lives with her husband and small one in the house of her in-laws. Part of what drives her each day is the desire to consolidate the family that she has formed with her husband. Heidi requests a loan to buy another grill and ingredients for the preparation of her delicious kebabs. It will help Heidi to continue working for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Heidi siempre ha sido muy empeñosa, trabaja incesantemente para poder brindar lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos, su juventud y los deseos de superación le dan fortaleza para vencer todos los obstáculos. Vende anticuchos y brochetas de pollo en la puerta de su casa todas las tardes, por la buena sazón que tiene su trabajo ha dado frutos y seguirá adelante con esta actividad; piensa mejorarla pronto comprando otra parrilla en mejores condiciones ya que desea a futuro abrir una tienda en su casa para seguir progresando y tener una casa propia; debido a que actualmente vive con su esposo y su pequeño en la casa de sus suegros y parte de sus proyectos es que cada día pueda consolidar la familia que ha formado al lado de su esposo. Heidi solicita un préstamo para comprar otra parrilla e ingredientes para la preparación de sus deliciosos anticuchos. Apoya a Heidi a continuar por el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a new grill and ingredients for making her delicious kebabs

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman A. is a 50 year old man, married and has three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $700, which he plans to use to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir B. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli in Azerbaijan. Now he lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Mahir is 30 years old, married and has two children. He owns a bakery, and has seven years of experience preparing and selling bread. He has two employees who help him at his business. He wants the Kiva loan so that he can buy products for the preparation of bread.  He needs a loan in amount of $1200. His wish is to be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Aliagha

texts.en: Aliagha F. is a 56 year old man, married, with four children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a small butcher shop. Aliagha established his business last year, and he does not have many customers. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $1100, and he plans to purchase some sheep and sell the meat at his butcher shop. He thinks this loan will help his business be very successful.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 58 years old, married and has five children. He drives a taxi and this business is his family's only income. He needs a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase necessary spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en: Jalil I. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a food market near his home. He started his business nine years ago. He is 58 years old, married and has five children. Jalil applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan in the amount of $850 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Edixon Elias

texts.es:
Edixon is 31 years old of age and married with 2 children ages 9 years and 3 months. They reside in the Cuajachilla region, a rural sector located on the outskirts of Managua.

Edixon is an automobile mechanic, having worked at this for 16 years, which has earned him experience and clients in the sectors adjoining the place where he resides. His workshop is located in his house. He requires the loan to buy new tools for his work since the ones that he has at present are too old and do not function 100%. He will also put a roof on his workshop, since winter is approaching and when the rains fall he cannot work and he loses many clients.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Edixon tiene 31 años de edad, es casado con 2 hijos de 9 años y 3 meses de nacido, habitan en la comarcaCuajachilla, un sector rural ubicado en las afueras de managua.

Edixon es mécanico automotriz, lleva 16 años en este trabajo lo que le ha permitido ganar experiencia y clientes en los sectores aledaños al lugar donde habita. Su taller lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. requiere del préstamo para comprar nuevas herramientas de trabajo ya que las que tiene actualmente en uso por su antiguedad no funcionan al 100%. y también pondrá techo en su taller ya que se acerca el invierno y cuando caen las lluvias no puede trabajar y pierde muchos clientes.

loans.use: To buy tools for his auto repair business and to put a roof on his shop so that he can work when it rains and avoid loosing clients.

loans.name: Adolfo Candido

texts.es:
Adolfo is 49 years of age and married. His wife is 42 years old. They reside in the Lomalinda neighborhood of Sierra Maestra, a rural area near the city of Managua. Adolfo is a small merchant that is dedicated to the manufacture and sale of coal and to the breeding and fattening of hogs, pelibuey sheep and chickens. He also cultivates the wheat himself that he feeds to his animals. The wife of Adolfo is dedicated to the preparation and sale of food, which she sells at noon and at night. These activities occupy Adolfo’s entire day since he has to take time to care for his animals and he also leaves to sell in the markets, chiefly coal. They need money to buy hogs and pelibuey sheep to fatten and sell. Also they will buy necessary vegetables for the preparation of the foods that they sell daily. In this manner this couple has done well and generated the necessary income to live. Adolfo puts a lot of effort into this activity, because he enjoys the interaction with his animals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Adolfo tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, su esposa tiene 42 años, habitan en el barrio Lomalinda, Sierra Maestra. Un lugar rural de la ciudad de Managua. Adolfo es un pequeño comerciante que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón, a la crianza y engorde de cerdos, pelibuey y gallinas. También el mismo cultiva el trigo con el que le da de comer a sus animales. La esposa de Adolfo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, estas ventas la hace al mediodía y por la noche. Esta actividad le ocupa todo el día a Adolfo ya que tiene que dedicarle tiempo al cuido de sus animales y también sale a vender a los mercados, principalmente el carbón. Necesitan el dinero para comprar cerdos, pelibuey para su engorde y venta, también comprarán verduras necesarias para la elaboración de las comidas que venden a diario. De esta manera es como esta pareja ha salido adelante y generar los ingresos necesarios para vivir. Adolfo le pone mucho empreño a esta actividad, porque le gusta mucho la interacción con sus animales.

loans.use: To buy hogs and pelibuey sheep to fatten and sell.  Also to buy vegetables for preparing foods for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rose is 46 years old, married, with a son of 9 years. She resides in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, considered one of the poorest neighborhoods and with more need for infrastructure than other parts of Managua. She works as a cook in a restaurant in a market of Managua. She has six years of experience doing this work. Her husband is 42 years old and works in construction. They want to give better living conditions to their small son and to themselves. They have worked at improving their house little by little, but still have a long way to go.
